If you are like me, and don't need to follow the masses, you will like this movie. Are there boring moments? Could they have stopped with part 1? Are there some lame moments or characters that the movie could have done without? Yes, yes, and yes. But, what else am I going to watch on Netflix? Rewatch ozark? Maybe. But I love sci-fi, especially new sci-fi.Part 2 was actually better than part 1. I already knew the basis of the film, and knew what to expect. Minus the characters going over there backstory it was pretty cool movie.

title: Movie is so laughable and should never have been made.
text: Take every single basic SciFi trope and shove it into a movie. EVERYTHING is SLO-MOTION. Someone picks up a cup.... slo-motion. The reach for a gun... Slo-Motion. Slow zoom in on the villian. Super Slow Motion. This movie could have been edited down to about 20 minutes. No idea why this movie was made. No idea where they got the HORRIBLE... I mean HORRIBLE writers. Editing is gawd aweful. Plot? What plot? Acting: Oh my my...... no emotion, no attachment, big character get's killed? Who cares. Nobody cares. But it will be in SLO-MOTION. There are no actors in Hollywood anymore. No emotion, but they are pissed about something. Maybe someone grounded them over the weekend, and they are pissed. They all look like they are going to really stomp on someone..... in slo-motion. And you really don't care, just as long as the slo-motion stops.I think during one scene, I phased into the late 1930's and now have a permanent time skip in my memory.In Slo-motion.

title: Lost all my faith on Snyder from the first Rebel Moon, but I kinda enjoyed it
text: Does this fix the problems of the first film? NoBut, the movie was more organised then the first one. The dialogue is still bad, but what do you really expect from Snyder movies.Visuals were nice and acting was fine I guess.It looked more complete from the first one, and the antagonists looked more engaging and dangerousNow If i talk about this film directly, it's nothing amazing like dune 2, but it stands alone as a descent film.Kudos to Snyder for trying create another cinematic universe, but he still needs to get a better writer in my opinionIt's worth a watch if you have nothing to watch on Netflix.

title: Better than people think
text: For reference I gave part 1 6/10.Slower start to this one but it feels like the story came together very strong between the first two movies. A lot of character development and back story. You get to know the warriors and why they fight for what they fight for. The villain is a force who shows he can square up when need be(given he's not to busy taking out his anger on his own people). The battle scene was awesome, next level awesome. If you like sci fi then I don't see the need to complain about that (extra long) scene. I'd watch the movie just to see the battle. Can't do a review without mentioning how great Hopkins is as the jimmy! Feel like that's just a given at this point in his career. Ending is sufficient, not necessarily a cliff hanger but definitely open ended.I'd recommend to anyone to give it a watch with an open mind! Hope we get a few more.

title: Rebel Moon: A Spectacular Disaster
text: "Rebel Moon" is graphically impeccable, and the main antagonist is quite impressive, but that's where the positives end. The script is a disaster, feeling like it belongs in the era of "Idiocracy" with its complete lack of logic and incessant nonsense that seems to bother no one.From the get-go, with the lengthy scythe reaping of grain, I found myself wondering whether this was a film or an attempt to hypnotize the viewer. Worse still are the chaotic fight scenes where heroes waste ammunition shooting at each other from close range and missing, reminiscent of the worst clichés from "Star Wars" - but without any charm. Really, continuously charging headlong into machine gun fire is true torture.Another issue is the pacing of the narrative. "Rebel Moon" stubbornly turns every potentially exciting moment into a test of the viewer's patience. The action slows are so predictable and artificial that instead of building tension, they merely prompt yawns.In summary, "Rebel Moon" could have been a cinematic hit if only someone had devoted more time to refining the script instead of allocating all resources to special effects. It's a production that, despite a dazzling facade, is internally empty and irritatingly absurd. For fans of special effects who can overlook the lack of any narrative coherence, it might be tolerable, but for the rest, it's nothing more than a frustrating waste of potential.

title: Good movie
text: Very good and it is like first Star Wars but actually better. Difference is Star Wars came a long time ago and was new and pretty fantastic when it came.This isn't new, but pretty much the same storyline and much, much better actors, CGI etc.It is a pitty this wasn't released in cinemas. Streaming is destroying the experience since I'd say half of the experience of watching a film like this os lost not watching it on a silver screen.Really enjoyd these two films and hope there is a third one coming... like the first Three Star Wars the story needs a third episode to wrap it up.So give these to movies a chance. See it undesturbed in a dark room on a big TV set with good sound.

title: Seven Samurai but 7 hours without any emotion
text: This is a prolonged and I do mean that because there are no less than 20 slow motion shots at every chance they get. It is a colossal waste of time effort and money. They spent the money on effects but didn't bother to write a script didn't bother to develop characters didn't bother to make the viewer emotionally invested.Yet another bloated Hollywood / Netflix streaming hoping to capture your attention. Don't bother and watch the far superior original seven samurai from which this was ripped off. Or if you want to watch a Western then watch the magnificent seven or even the terrible remake the magnificent seven is 100 times better than this prolonged agony.

title: A lot of fun.
text: A lot of harsh reviews here, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. I liked part 1 and this is bigger and better. Action from start to finish. Excellent FX and the characters are given more of a back story. It's rushed in over a quick group confessional, but it's enough to give them reason to fight and a reason for us to actually give a damn about them. I like Snyder as a director and I enjoy his style and story telling. It's not a perfect film, but it's a good story and left open for more, which I hope happens. There's a whole unverise out there for them to explore. You can tell Holkenborg has worked with Hans Zimmer. The score is strong and emotional. Sit back and just enjoy the ride.

title: Disappointment
text: During the total run time I could only think that the director of this movie created "300". How could a guy who created 300, deprived of creativity this much. Unnecessary forced slow motion cuts. Dumbest script. Flat & long emotional scenes that nobody invest in. Cut & paste old action scenes with space weapons..low levels of creativity. Bad acting as the top icing. Literaly first hal of the movie was without any action, just main characters TALKING about how sad thier lives were and trying desperately to attache us to the characters but failing.I don't know maybe they made it so fast as a cash grab after the first one for NetFlix. What do I have to give to see another movie like 300???

title: Epic war movie
text: Watched it in the special Toronto screening thanks to Netflix.There's a lot I can talk about how much I love Pt 2. One can see "300 war sequence era Zack Snyder" return in the Normandy invasion inspired battle, recharged. Minute references to snyderverse done in new ways. BvS UE and this, Zack. Snyder's "absolute CINEMA" sequel.If this was mind-blowing I can't even imagine what the directors cut of Pt 2 is gonna be. Especially can't wait for more of Jimmy.The duel in the climax is the best sci Fi lightsaber battle since Revenge of the sith.People have to understand Snyder's long form storytelling and how he split a four act structured movie into two parts instead of a traditional 3 act movie, which is in itself innovative. Many issues people had in Pt 1 are addressed.In conclusion, if you love action and missed 300 era Snyder watch this movie.

title: Honest #RebelMoon Review
text: I rated part One a strong 6 to 6.5. Sure that's Average or "Mid" (not a bad thing). The PG13 cuts are slick corporate products at the end of the day.Part Two is a strong 7 to 7.5.Yeah the slow motion is cool, the music bangs, the visuals are legendary, sure, sure. We already knew Zack would deliver in these areas. The protagonists story, that's is where Kora stands apart from her contemporaries.Snyder is doing stuff that no other director has the stones to do. Kora is the one.As the battle wrapped up, I couldn't shake the feeling that this still feels incomplete.Not sure if it's a marketing trick or I if simply need more cowbell.In summary, "It gave what needed to be given"The next re-watch will be a 4 hour experience.Bring on the Snydercut of these movies.

title: Unwatchable
text:
It's been almost 2 weeks of repetitive attempts to watch this movie, even though I strongly disliked the first movie I've decided to give it a shot. It says something about a movie when already on 15th minute stops being watchable..
My honest opinion: The scene with the royal family assassination is a copy paste Ceasar movie scene, only very bad one, the 7 samurais in Star Wars movies, the read servants and Bene Gesserit Sisterhood cheap knockoff (Dune), the Vikings rip off in harvesting village- and somehow he managed to "get inspired" by the Witcher the origin story and Star Trek strange new worlds (there's probably much more but it was too painful to watch)
There's this idea of The rebel moon being a new universe, but the reality is it is a very bad mashup of all old well known and respected universes (movies) Music is not corresponding, scenes are forced and very badly organised, dialogues seem written by kindergarten kids exercise, slow motion is exaggerated and unnecessary in 99%, the story is unrelatable and inconsistent (ST strange new worlds CAN have this jump from highly developed planet to one from Stone Age BECAUSE THEY ARE JUST DISCOVERING THEM, it doesn't work if they're the part of the same empire !) the acting is very sadly bad, surprisingly so for the quality actors. I still haven't finished the movie, cannot convince myself on torture. There are people dying from hunger and Netflix decided to spend millions on bad references to already existing good movies.

title: Not perfect but honestly enjoyable.
text: So many scathing reviews but I think it's an enjoyable watch. Sure, it's not perfect: a couple of clunky maneuvers in fight scenes here and there; a handful of scenes that could've been acted with more emotion; and certain characters could've benefitted from more development. But for all of the aforementioned flaws, there are double the successes. The story is better fleshed out than a fair amount of other sci-fi action flicks; the fight scenes are overall pretty good; the acting in the majority of the film was good; and the graphics quality is really strong. This movie got me emotionally invested in the story and the characters: I found myself rooting for the protagonists and some of the supporting characters, and hating the antagonists. If the movie elicits an emotional response in me, it's doing something right. This isn't gonna win any awards, but it's not nearly as bad as some reviews would lead you to believe. I, for one, honestly liked it and am looking forward to the next installment (hopefully we get another installment). Give it a shot and decide for yourself.

title: Completely pointless.
text: DON'T watch this.. just watch Part one.To be clear, Part One was NOT great by any means, but it was much, much, MUCH better than the second film.This is a lesson in how to build an entire multi-million dollar film with no forethought and just because you had an idea for a cliffhanger at the end of the first film. This isn't a 4 hr story broken into two films... it's a mediocre story told twice, under the guise of being two parts. Part Two is quite literally nothing more than a different way to tell Part One. (A la ChatGPT's second generation for the same prompts - ya get the same thing, just slightly different)Part two serves no purpose. It just retells part one for the most part... mixing in FAR too much harvesting, grain production and literally retelling character backstories which were told in Part One. (WTF???).Just like part one.. this is a mix of 7 Samurai (aka Magnificent 7) and Star Wars.. but oddly the two worlds never actually intertwine. Space ships faster than the speed of light.. but still need a sickle and scythe to harvest??? A sentient robot, or a hologram communication device, but no simple machines to sort and store grain.. m'kay. Looooooong slow motion flashbacks to re-establish characters that were already established in part one.I quite honestly don't understand anyone that would read this script and think it's worth millions. But it could possibly be Snyder getting one over on Netflix.. Netflix pays to have it made, Snyder ultimately delivers trash (Like most of his films).This is bad... on par with Sy-Fy/Aslym film writing. "Rebelgeddon!" .. "Rebel Moonado!" --- Nonsensical, full of plot holes and pointless, poorly acted, wan-a-be-dramatic character building regarding cardboard cutout characters you've seen in any one a thousand films over the past 40 years. But at least Asylum knows they are making "schlock". Snyder thinks he's making gold apparently..... but it's pyrite in reality, looks shiny, but is worthless.Apparently grain/wheat only grows on ONE planet in the entire universe..... And this huge high-tech multi-planetary army can't figure out how to feed itself unless they conquer a bunch of farmers with shovels and rakes???So much more, but I'm avoiding actual spoilers.VERY typical Snyder... pointless, nonsensical plot holes, and focusing on CGI far, far, FAR more than any story.---- PASS -------

title: Great film
text: The film boasts a strong ensemble cast, each delivering compelling performances. The protagonist, played by a rising star, brings depth and vulnerability to the role, making her journey both relatable and inspiring. Supporting characters, ranging from seasoned warriors to eccentric aliens, are well-developed and contribute significantly to the narrative's richness. The chemistry among the cast is palpable, enhancing the film's emotional resonance.Rebel Moon is a triumph of science fiction cinema, offering a thrilling and thought-provoking experience. Zack Snyder has not only created a visually stunning film but also one that resonates on an emotional and intellectual level. Whether you're a die-hard sci-fi fan or new to the genre, "Rebel Moon" is a must-watch that promises to leave a lasting impression.

title: My mind is going, there is no question about it
text: Pretty sure this film has caused psychological and neurological damage its that stupid.Yes the costumes look great, yes the special fx aren't half bad but damn... 7ish Samurais In Space Do Stupid Things....The other thing that grates is the music. Tropey and painful.The whole opening hook with the princess... Just shoot them all and there's no more problems but the plot armour saves these main characters but not the rubbish storm trooper knock offs who are bullet fodder galore.I feel sorry for the actors for having to deal with this level of stupid, but I suspect they've learnt a lot of their paycheck so you know... Not gonna worry that much.If you like Snyder other film you'll probably like this one. If you find yourself over encumbered with brain cells then won't.

A very shallow, very tropey, very cardboard space opera that takes itself with great seriousness and pathos. There are some pretty visuals and prettier actors. If you're tired and feel like switching your brain off for a couple of hours, or if corny, ridiculous space operas are your guilty pleasure, you might enjoy this. I actually did :) Even though I don't think that's what the director thought he was creating.But (speaking of the director) someone please tell Mr. Snyder to cut down on the slow motion scenes. I imagine he means them as deep or philosophical, but they just look so painfully pretentious.

title: Laughable and trying way too hard
text: Oh boy.After part 1 I genuinely thought "it can't be worse than this". Well ladies and germs, it somehow got worse.I used to be a Snyder fan. I really enjoy 300 and Watchmen, and I think Man of Steel is a very underrated superhero movie. I even appreciate BvS in spite of its clear flaws, and I like The Snyder Cut well enough (though on a recent rewatch it didn't hold up as well as the first viewing). This, and part 1 before it, seriously make me question if I can get excited for a Snyder film again.Some positives to start with, there are some cool visuals (SOME, we'll come back to that), I like the design of the robot character and his entrance to the fight is pretty cool, and the space shots have a pretty sweet look to them. There are also a few cool fight moments scattered about amongst the chaos.Now, that aside, there really isn't much worth your time in this thing. To start with, and honestly kinda the most disappointing for a Snyder flick, I really don't care for the visuals. The CGI is fine, I wouldn't consider it glaringly bad really, but the film is unpleasant to look at most of the time. I respect using some old and dirty lenses, but Snyder's insistance on using them wide open the whole time (and in this case on a sensor way bigger than they were built for) just creates a muddy and mushy look with so much distortion. Beyond that the costumes and sets aren't terribly impressive either, they're perfectly fine, but not super impressive, and the bland color grade doesn't help either.The action as well is pretty lackluster. Constant (like bordering on parody level) slow mo, and when it's not that it's just poorly choreographed and choppy. So many times that someone without a gun stands in front of multiple armed attackers and not a shot is fired at them.I won't talk much crap on the actors, cause they're doing their best with arguably the weakest aspect of the film, the script. The dialogue (little that there is) is bland at best, laughable at worst. About the time that the main characters all sat around a table giving their DnD character introductions for like 10 minutes straight I knew we were in for a world of hurt.I really could go on and on about all the nonsense (like this ship that can travel through portals being powered by coal in a Titanic like engine room), but really the simplest way I can describe this film is that it feels like a movie made by a 12 yr old boy who's trying to make it not feel like a movie made by a 12 yr old boy. It's 2 (or 4 as a whole) hours or Snyder trying so hard to be cool that it just ends up over the top and goofy as hell.Maybe the director's cuts will improve them, I don't really care and at this point I'm sick of him making us all watch marginally better director's cuts to make up for appalling theatrical (if this can be called that on a straight to streaming movie) releases.

title: Remember fun?, Pepperage Farm remembers.
text: Ok, first I'll review the movie. It's a Snyder film, you should know what to expect. It's gonna look great, be action packed, contain slow-mo, and veer towards style over substance. It delivers on all counts. These are the components he uses every time, it ain't gonna change. If you expect anything else you should know better, that's YOUR fail, not Snyder's (unless he came over to your gaff and made you watch the film at gun point). It's a solid, entertaining two hours and a decent way to relax your way through an evening. 7.5 outta 10 rounded up to 8 for IMDBNow let's discuss the one star reviewers and 'worst film of all time, burn him at the stake, cut off his manhood, ban him from ever using a camera again' clowns who need to get a grip. I'm no Snyder fanboy. I will say that visually I do think he's a cut above the pack, but also think in other aspects he's definitely lacking. What I am a fan of though, is entertainment. Not every piece of film or TV has to make complete logical sense, or be grounded in absolute realism. Breaking down and critiquing the logic in an ACTION sci-fi film makes no sense. We are not talking about hard sci-fi here. This is no 'Arrival' or 'Interstellar' and neither does it claim to be. Stop being a killjoy and remember what it was like to have fun watching a film again. If you can't do that, then at least remember that if you see Snyder's name attached to something that you should know what to expect and if you don't want that, to give it a miss.Lastly, let's stop pretending like Star Wars has more than two great movies (one of these is a prequel, which I'll leave unnamed just to annoy the worst breed of fanboy), and two great seasons of TV. Everything else is literally the same quality as the two parts of Rebel Moon, or considerably worse. I would watch this over ANY of the sequel trilogy any day.

title: Weaker of the two but still good (just about)
text: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver is actually weaker than Part One. It's a film of two halves as it spends the first half focusing on slow motion farming instead of character development which really hinders the stakes of the final battle. However, that second half is just an hour long battle so it's worth it overall.Sofia Boutella is still able to give Kora a level of depth that exceeds what's on the page. Djimon Hounsou gets so much more to do and the added depth that he, Bae Doona and Staz Nair get is welcome even if it still isn't enough. Ed Skrein might be the best though with his thoroughly evil performance.Zack Snyder's direction remains as visually stylish as ever. He's at his strongest in the second half when the focus is on making cool action scenes with his trademark slow motion but the use of that is really beginning to border on self parody. Flaws and all, it's still nice to see a Netflix blockbuster that feels like it was made by a human more than an algorithm.When it was first announced that both parts were made for around $160 million it sounded so impressive and it still is but this one being set almost exclusively on the one farm makes this universe feel real small. Tom Holkenborg's score has the required bombast and sincerity whilst coming dangerously close to copying his work on Batman V Superman.

title: Unyielding in it's badness
text: It is like watching a car crash in slo-mo. Literal slo-mo.And the car is a clown car... and it's on a bridge... and a bridge is falling down... into a septic tank.I like to imagine Zack Snyder typing this movie by himself on a most expensive MacBook known to man, thinking how much of a genius he is. A true wordsmith. Nonchalant smile and a self asserting nod to himself and his level of humble supremacy in the smarts department.Dialog is vapid and cringe. Snyder thinks his writing rivals Shakespeare. It does not.It rivals, barely, a five year old child that has a faintest understanding that written words exist. Email spam is better written than this.Action is empty, not interesting and without stakes, in short - boring. Music is hilariously serious and without merit.Plot is embarasingly stupid. Acting is either bad or .. well, worse. Characters are wasted, villain is the same dude as in the first movie, but somehow... less. Oh, lord, oh no. I'm having flashbacks to the endless slo-mo harvesting scene.Also, she cuts her hair to look like in the olden days of her glory. Dude shaves, looks like a goober, promptly exits the "franchise".Visually unimpressive, yet expensive.I thought "telling and not showing" is bad, but somehow Zack Snyder managed to make "show and tell and narate it at the same time", and it's worse.Only thing that can challenge this netflix trash is, well, a first Rebel Moon movie.Zack Snyder is truly and most probably the worst overpaid director at this moment. Everybody says he should do photography in a movie, not direct or write. Man, I wouldn't give him my phone to take a picture of me on a vacation in front of a monument, let alone a movie.Again, don't support this. Watch paint dry, stare into a blank wall, do nothing, sleep, sit on a cactus, but don't watch this.

title: Tired and stereotyped
text: Countless clichés have been employed, making the viewing experience somewhat predictable and tiresome. However, without presenting any new initiative or fresh perspective on this genre. Despite the performances of some of the actors, the film somehow couldn't escape its clichés and carve out its own place among the films in this genre. The main characters are depicted in an unrealistic and predictable manner, making everything feel like it has been seen before. The story is highly predictable and lacks any originality, merely repeating common patterns. It's an action film that unfortunately relies too heavily on genre clichés.

title: movie is actually better than the IMDb rating. Don't get influenced
text: Minuses (first hour). Before I cleared my mind off the rating on IMDb:Break. Movie after 59:20..You almost never see a tert in movies have at it, not to mention, destroy not one, but two enemy ships. One character even did challenge Atticus Noble to one-on-one combat; died, but still an achieve.Edit: Damn...Overall:It's a 7, final, for me - that's an upper limit, though.

title: Everything but the kitchen sink. Literally. And not in a good way...
text: This is what would happen if one mixes a hefty dose of LSD with equal portions of Star Wars and 7 samurai, seasoned with a kick of 300 and even a sprinkle of Avatar, Dune, and the Robot.This unfortunate hotchpotch ultimately goes down as some sort of half-baked delirium fantasy that valiantly tries all and brilliantly fails at everything.The whole story basically revolves around just one man's madness, and that tyrant (Balisarius) doesn't even act (literally or figuratively). Instead, he has some sort of puppet (Atticus) do his bidding.Nothing makes any sense, whatsoever. The characters are still underdeveloped, there is no tension or any ideal at stake.Even the number of heroes casualties is disappointing... It is almost like Zach envisions spinoffs, which is not visionary. It is just lame...At the end, I was waiting for Anakin to show up or at least for the single character that died doing the right thing to rise as a Force ghost...Did I say "lame"? Perhaps head-scratching is more adequate. That acid must have been good stuff.

title: Why the HATE. I made my own mind up.
text: Like everything I watch films, series and even music, I ignore the reviews, its my taste. When choosing what to watch I decide on the theme, content and who is casted. I watched both Part 1 & 2 back to back in one day. And I was engrossed, totally enjoyed the films.The first was better than second and there was an element of Magnificent Seven/Fifth Element/Star Wars and video game Wolfenstein. Make your own mind up. The reviews are way too harsh and everyone is trying to be a critic, there opinions and I'll make my own. P.1- 8/10. P.2- 7/10.I liked the World's created and the visuals were well done. People just seem to rip media apart. The plot was simple and that's enough I just enjoyed the ride and I felt the characters pain, hope, drive for peace from war and find a place called home.

title: Zack Snyder Haters
text: When a movie called Icyclone has. 6.1 on IMDb, you just know that these 2 movies are getting bashed by Zack Snyder haters.Is this Star Wars? Absolutely not.I went in to these movies not expecting too much but I did enjoy them. The acting was okay. I thought that Sofia Boutella and Djimon Hounsou did a great job with the script they were given. The special effects were astounding and the finale was awesome. Yes, the slow motion could have been toned down a bit, but it wasn't as bad as everyone makes it out to be.So when I see ratings for terrible, terrible movies like Icyclone, with it's photoshop effects getting higher scores then Rebel Moon Part 1 and 2... something's going on.It's the haters!!! Lol.

title: Thank goodness Lucasfilm turned Zack Snyder down to direct a Star Wars movie
text: I know that some long running franchises like Star Wars or Star Trek or even Marvel are having problems right now. But for right now...please...do not hire Zack Snyder until he gets himself straightened out.Zack Snyder has become a parody of himself. There is way too much slo-mo used in the action scenes. I guess there are some wide CGI shots that look passable even for a Netflix release. But even after a while, the action scenes get boring fast. Thank god this was only a two hour movie.The dialogue is trying so hard to be serious and meaningful that it comes across as shallow and pretentious. Almost every line is some epic speech or flowery claptrap that wants to be cool or memorable that it just goes in one ear and out the other.The robot (voiced by Anthony Hopkins) is the one likable character while the villain (a wildly over-the-top Ed Skrein) gives the most entertaining performance. Djimon Hounsou tries to add some resemblance of gravitas with his performance. But even he gets one-note after a while. This movie made Djimon Hounsou boring. Shame on Zack Snyder.Sofia Boutella in supporting roles can be a captivating screen presence. But I'm afraid she is not yet leading lady material. Her romantic scenes with an embarrassed looking Michael Huisman are pretty dreadful. And even that turned out to be a waste of time.I don't fancy myself as someone that even dislikes Zack Snyder in general. I liked some of his work. I liked Dawn of the Dead, 300, and I actually really enjoyed Man of Steel.But he needs to hire better writers and to stop taking himself so damn seriously. Just have some fun for once.

title: Enjoyable Sci-Fi Flick with decent battles
text: I just watched the movie and i felt quite entertained the whole time. In my opinion this installment doesn't get boring and is enjoyable to watch. I had a harder time with part one.It's not an all time favourite movie but the bad reviews doesn't fit for me. I had fun watching it. The action was mostly on point but sometimes quite overloaded with effects.The bad part of it is the background of the characters story. It felt overrushed and not quite understandable. The reason why the main character acted like it did was nowhere in the near of clear because it just was explained in maybe two lines of text. On the other hand, the backstory of the general gave me chills.Overall an enjoyable Zack Snyder Movie. It will not be so easily forgotten. Definitly an improvement of part 1.

title: Wow this was bad
text: Rebel Moon Pt1 was pretty awful but had some basics of an opening so I was hoping maybe Pt2 was fine tuned and more entertaining. The answer to that hope was a hard no!There were so many terrible elements to the movie it's hard to focus. As I was watching all I could think was, did AI generate this script? It was so painfully predictable and cliche. Like the Wish (or Temu?) version of Star Wars mixed with every other SciFi movie of the past 30 years. There's literally a death star explosion scene with a character saying "you may fire at will" just as the ship explodes! Like WTF?The acting is atrocious as well. The pauses between lines gives the audience time to correctly guess what's coming next, the emotion is wildly superficial (line delivery is comically dull), and 90% of the characters just have blank stares most of the movie.Seriously, I could rip on this trash heap all day but I can summarize by simply saying, avoid this one. There isn't even campy charm to it, it's just a waste of time and of course they leave it open for a third movie, ugh. I apologize for any typos in this review, I promise I dedicated more time to writing this than the writers of this movie spent on the script.

title: So bad... mind numbingly bad.
text: I had to write this review mainly so I could tell people to stay far away from this movie. It might have beautiful, visual effects and stunning depictions of reality but this is the worst mindless trash I've seen in a long time. And I mainly wrote this to vent. My head is hurting. Please stop...NOW.It's clear to me that they spent all the budget on CGI cinematography and casting, which was actually really good, But I think they stopped short of hiring a script team. I mean, I don't know what's going on in the first minute or the last minute or any minute in between. I hope didn't have to sit through this like I did, but if you did, know there's someone else out there who feels the same way as you.

title: Omg. What a cr*p
text: Great actors. Such a dumb screenplay and writing. This was pure torture to watch. Suffered almost every minute and it was never-ending. Such a waste of pretty much everything. Hope they won't make any other movies, or at least with a different director or proper writers. I just watched it to see if there's anything potentially surprising. This was such a pain. Save your time from watching this and rather go see friends. Those characters are nobodies playing as if they were epic. Most laughable are the Kens with axes who battle against laser weapons 😃 But surely they must look cool in the first place 🙄

title: A slow-mo, cringe-fest nightmare. All style, no substance.
text: It is little wonder that this ended on the most derivative and unoriginal streaming service.It is even worse than the first part. From the slow motion being over used, even in the harvesting of wheat (!!!), to the feeling that this could have perfectly been the last 15 minutes of a 90 minute movie, and not four bloody hours.Ed Shrkein is cartoonishly evil, Sofia Boutella seems to have the range of a constipated beetroot, and Zack has seemingly relegated the writing of the script to ChatGpt.And that ending... Zack obviously wants to keep churning more episodes of this tripe. Let's hope Crapflix sees that it is really not worth it.

title: Entertaining with some downsides
text: This movie is an odd mix between cringeworthy bad moments and spots of awesomeness. It certainly is not what I would call great but it reaches an overall ok/enjoyable and there are aspects I really liked. The visuals are stunning yet overblown - like in 300 or in an Anime. But once you accept that, it is fun to watch. Too much slow-mo for my taste, but it's Snyder. The style is coherent and well designed - I enjoyed the overall looks. The acting had huge variations. Some great moments, some really bad ones. I liked the interpretation of the 7 Samurai theme but the characters did not get the development they would have needed. And I definitely would have chosen a different character to die in battle. But overall my inner scifi-geek had a good time in front of the screen. Hence a 6/10 instead of a 4/10 (which would be my movie critic vote - but with that metric I would have had to vote the last two Star Wars movies 3/10).

title: Bad acting and worse dialogue.
text: Every bit of dialogue is a speech with little to no meaning. No one talks like any of these characters in real life. The romance is unbelievable and completely unnecessary. The story line is not interesting, and far fetched. Villagers propose a deal that would ultimately result in their destruction because they trust the opposing party to keep their word when they have shown over the course of two movies that they never keep their word. Simply a terrible movie.The fight scenes are much worse than the first movie and are improbable to say the least. People die from what appear to be minor wounds and other characters make full recoveries. Characters that fought for the empire seem to have no clue of its capabilities. Makes absolutely no sense.

title: For a popcorn movie it is excellent
text: I don't get all the whining about this movie. Considering it was originally written to be a Star Wars movie.The plot is actually too good for Star Wars, as are the dialogues and the action.If you're looking for an intelligent, plot driven, epic scifi movie, watch Dune.If you just want to have fun and watch an above average popcorn movie, watch rebel moon for what it is.Is everything in this picture consistent? Off course not, the primitive harvesting of the grain. The fact that a couple of villagers would harvest enough grain in this way to be of importance to an empire. That is quite ridiculous and could easily have been avoided.

title: Perplexed by the hate
text: I'm still trying to wrap my head around the intense backlash surrounding this film. While the first installment had its fair share of flaws, but I believe this sequel has made significant strides in improvement. While it's not a flawless movie, it has its own unique strengths. The CGI is impressive, the cinematography is stunning, the soundtrack is engaging, the performances are decent and the story is passable. If you enjoyed the world Snyder created in the prequel, you'll likely appreciate this sequel to be a worthy follow-up. It offers a glimmer of hope for future projects that are coming down in the Rebel Moon universe.

title: A film to be avoided!
text: Like the first part, the movie is very weak, the intellectual level is kindergarten-level. The actors' lines are of rare stupidity, the story likewise, the script seems as if it were made by young children.The characters lack true motivation, the decisions they make are nonsensical, except for relatively good cinematography and some fairly okay CGI special effects, the rest is below the level of a DVD movie.Zack Snyder disappoints once again with a cinematic production of the lowest caliber at all levels.A very bad film from all points of view.If there were a rating lower than 1, I would give it, because no one will ever bring back the hours lost watching this cinematic garbage... I'm glad it was on Netflix and not in the theater, so I could fast forward through many boring scenes.A film to be avoided!

title: It's possible , it's worse then first
text: Trash tier movie with some nice visuals , obvs stolen for every other sci fi movie/franchise . Wants to be space seven samurai . Instead it's the planet junk without Eric idol . Studios please stop giving this person money to waste . Plot awful makes little sense . Dialogue is also b movie level junk . Couple of actors work far above the quality of rest of movie . Cool that the main baddie looks like a commissar leading a unit of imperial guard. Let's make a strong sci fi female , eermmmmm let's just have vasquez clone as lead, but less badass . Movie would probs be about 30 mins less if not for all the annoying slomo .

title: Not gonna review the movie for what it's not
text: Let's be straight and honest. It's Snyder's movie with all of its bells and whistles. Will you get great acting? No. Will you get dramatic plot and storytelling? No. Will you get great action and stunning old-school visuals with tons of bullet time? Hell yes. Tons of it.The plot is not the greatest, far from it. It's not Dune. It doesn't have well thought out lore as Lucasfilm's Star Wars. And to be honest, I find it kind of refreshing. A movie you won't remember for anything but amazing CGI and great fight scenes. I'm not expecting anything else from Zack's movies.People may compare it to Star Wars, and to be quite honest, I was much less insulted by Rebel Moon 1 and 2 than new trilogy under Disney's all-seeing eye.RM is its own thing. A great, ridiculously high budget B-tier thing. Its plot is cohesive so far (at least that little bit of plot that's hiding there), even though a little bit too easy to digest for my taste.In my opinion (for which you can downvote me all the way down), Rebel Moon franchise is now amongst my top 10 action focused scifi franchises. Because I simply like what it is, and it doesn't give me any space to dislike it for what it isn't. That's how simple this movie is.If I should compare it to something from real life scenario, Rebel Moon is like an A-class hooker. It's beautiful, it's not the smartest and you won't find there the meaning of life or your next wife. You visit it just for visually stunning fun that you might regret visiting 2 days after you're done with it. And I find it beautiful.

title: If I could, I'd give it a zero.
text: As if the first one wasn't bad enough, Zack had to do a part 2? Was this even necessary?! Eh I think I've found my worst movie of the year! I can't believe this was directed by the great Zack Snyder. The same guy who did Batman vs Superman and Justice League? This is shocking.Everything about this movie, and I mean everything, but especially the cast, was HORRIBLE. The lead actor, Sofia Boutella and villain, Ed Skrien was awful. And the whole premise was just a cheap copy cat. It's like Zack wanted to create his own Star Wars but he didn't have the budget to go full on. Even the Creator, which I felt was horrible, was far better than this.

title: Better than the first installment
text: I was pretty scathing about the first film, but watched this hoping for something better. It is better, although it still has its problems.The last half of the film is a spectacular battle, which certainly helps. Zack Snyder delivers destruction and pyrotechnics on an immense scale and we all know that he can manage stylish action with aplomb. So much so that you forgive the film for lapses in common sense and coherency.Unfortunately the first half of the film is less assured. An attempt is made to make us care for the village community our heroes are striving to protect. The most obvious example is an extended community harvest scene on which much care has been lavished, but it just doesn't work, perhaps because it does not "fit" within the overall narrative and so feels like it's forced in to the story.Also, an effort is made to round out the characters of the band of heroes, but with a similar lack of success. Nevertheless Sofia Boutella, Djimon Housou and Bae Doona manage to bring their characters to some sort of life, without much help from the script or the director. The other heroes could almost disappear from the screen.So the final battle is the key. Enjoy that and you forgive so much else. I did anyway.

title: No this was not good.
text: I despise zach snyder. I despised the first rebel moon, however I thought maybe since the spent a whole two hour movie setting up for the next one, I'll give it the benefit of the doubt and maybe it will be worth watching. It was one of the worst pieces of fiction I've ever consumed. Credit where its due some of the scenes were cool looking but i was so uninterest I didn't really care.No hate to the actors because they were all brilliant but the characters in this film were despicable. They were all diabolical. Literally all the development we get on the characters is a conversation where each character takes turns explaining their backstories. Can you get any lazier than that???? As a result whenever there was a character death I didn't really care because I'd literally no idea who the character was.One of the worst 2 hours ever. The whole plot is an incoherent mess with stupid little cuts that don't make sense. NO ONE WANTS THE SNYDER CUT FOR REBEL MOON. As soon as the extended editions come out (if you're gonna release a film and be like it'll get good when the extended edition comes out ur either high or really stupid) I'm gonna trash them too. Literally the whole movie was preparation for a stupid battle scene. Might be the least progressive action movie to ever exist. 0.1/10.

title: Let's go!
text: I didn't understand the negative reception for part one. I definitely won't understand if it's the same for the sequel. The Scargiver takes all of the world building from the first, adds significantly more to the story and characters, and tops it off with an epic battle sequence.Everything great about the original is continued here. The beautiful visuals, amazing music and goosebump-inducing slow-motion shots. It's more Snyder being Snyder, and I'm nowhere close to being sick of it. For me, it's delicious.The part that stands out the most is how ridiculously invested I was in the wellbeing of the characters and the outcome of the story. I was on the edge of my seat, legitimately nervous and worried. And to make it even more impactful, this movie is emotionally powerful. It gave me the feels more than once.In conclusion, The Scargiver is highly entertaining, awesome, intense and fun.(1 viewing, 4/19/2024)

title: Leaves a Scar in the Cinematic Experience
text: The Scargiver is a visually stunning sci-fi epic that immerses viewers in a captivating interstellar adventure. The film's second half is an exhilarating rollercoaster ride of action, drama, and breathtaking special effects that make it a must-watch for fans of the genre.While the movie delivers an enthralling second act, the first hour might test the patience of some viewers, as it seems to drag on with a somewhat slow pace. However, once the story gains momentum, it becomes an unforgettable cinematic experience. The character development and world-building are commendable, but the initial sluggishness detracts from what could have been a consistently engaging narrative.Nevertheless, Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver ultimately triumphs with its impressive visuals, compelling storyline, and thrilling action sequences. It's a worthy addition to the sci-fi genre, providing enough excitement and intrigue to satisfy even the most discerning fans.

title: Don't waste your time
text: One of the worst movies you could ever see. Deserves walking out. The movie just can't stop with the slow-mo scenes, which honestly feels like a rerun from Justice League's special edition. And let's talk about the writing-it's like they threw spaghetti at a wall and hoped it would stick, but didn't even look at the result. Sure, the costumes and spaceships look cool, but it's missing that emotional punch that makes you care about what's happening on screen. Dull, repetitive, generic, uneventful. Just another action flick and moneygrab scifi. Not realistic, not captivating, like watching a fireworks show without anything you'd ever care about. Looks nice, but will bore your brains.

title: Two hours of a hot mess!
text: The first one was horrible, I didn't think it could get any worse but this one outshines it. Where do I begin? Jack snyder should just quit story telling at this point. I actually feel genuine pity for the actors, they must have endured alot having to enact such a disaster. Firstly,the movie could have been way shorter than two hours, absolutely nothing happened in the first hour of the movie, you might as well skip a full hour if you decide to sit through this torture because you won't be missing anything at all. He just combined stories of different plots and combined it together to make a movie. The movie was such a drag,nothing exciting,lacks creativity. Just sit this one out.

title: Pulp sci fi, enjoyable, ignore the haters
text: What is up with hating on this movie and in particular Zack Snyder? It's a sci fi action inspired by dozens of other movies/games and best to describe it is: Seven Samurai mixed with pace opera. It's a ton of fun and the only reason I am giving this a 6/10 (gave the first one a 7) is the cringey dramatic non sense, reminded me of Return of the King with all the crying. It's taking itself too seriousy amidst all the fun action and explosions. Zack Snyder is definitely working on the next one and I will be there to watch it and so will you and others. They'll hate it but it will still be the nr. 1 movie on Netflix just like this one and the first one. So Rebel Moon 3, let's go!

title: Bad as it gets
text: Review is only for the first 45 minutes as that's all me n the lad could suffer. The first film was a watchable mess, this one's just embarrassingThe good - it's in 4k ?The bad - no story, wooden acting(no one seams to care), constant unneeded slow motion shots, non stop dramatic music, NO STORYSorry, it's only my (and 11 year old son's) opinion, but everything is bad about this film - even the zero atmosphere effects. It's hard to imagine how it got the go ahead. Hopefully it doesn't do the numbers and studios get cold feet on spending mental amounts of money on s##t like this. Painfully bad stuff.

title: Predictable and Boring
text: Kora (Sofia Boutella) returns to Veldt with the farmer Gunnar (Michiel Huisman) and the warriors Titus (Djimon Hounsou), Nemesis (Bae Doona), Darrian Bloodaxe (Ray Fisher) and Tarak (Staz Nair). Titus commands the defense of the farmers and asks them to harvest the grains and use them to protect their homes. While waiting for Atticus Noble (Ed Skrein) and his men, they disclose their pasts waiting for the showdown with the mother world's force.As I mentioned in my review of Part One, Rebel Moon uses the storyline of "Seven Samurai" adapted to a sci-fi. "Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver!, however, is a predictable and boring adventure that follows the Netflix's standard (one black warrior, one Asian warrior, one gay warrior, a powerful - but this time, not beautiful that looks like an androgynous man - lead woman). The plot entwins the past of each other in order to complete the two hours' time schedule. The pacific farmers win the empire, with weapons, tanks is a little too much, isn't it? The worthwhile thing to see are the magnificent special effects. My vote is six.Title (Brazil): "Rebel Moon - Parte 2: A Marcadora de Cicatrizes" ("Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scars Marker")

title: Appalling
text: Again Snyder's Cinematography is appalling.The whole look and feel is something akin to a 1970's episode of Dr Who and compared to a film like The Creator is risible.The universe created is a cross between Vikings and The Teletubbies, with Michael Huisman looking frankly bemused through out when cast in, the humble farmer in need of help,role.At least Charlie Humdrum has gone, but there is a reason why Huisman replaced Skrein in Game of Thrones after one episode.He is two dimensional and has a very limited range, hence the sparse number of appearances over the years, but at least he doesn't attempt some Kind of dodgy accent.The rest of the cast are not great and even Djimon Honsou seems lost with the sub Henry the fifth dialogue.That hits on another major issue.Not since Lucas's terrible Star Wars re-boot has a "major" film contained such terrible dialogue which at least Anthony Hopkins avoid looking embarrassed by, being a robot and all.All in all a saga to be consigned to the same bin as The Revenge of the Sith etc.

title: Not amazing. Not terrible either.
text:
Beautifully shot. The actors were great. I feel like where Snyder always seems to fall short is in how he develops his characters. It was the same with Justice League. It just never feels natural. Something about the way they monologued their stories all at once was just weird. I know we're trying to quickly establish a reason to care about these people and their backgrounds but it just didn't work for me. It's not a bad popcorn flick and I would probably watch it again in the future but I'm
Just not sold on his execution of action films anymore. It would take a lot for me to spend money at the theaters to see anything Zac Snyder puts out anymore.

title: I laughed so hard watching this movie I couldn't give it less of a score
text: What is this universe? They got intergalactic ships with slow cranking cannons, guns that shoot lava, tanks with diesel engines, but no farming equipment? Seriously the first half of the movie was people manually harvesting wheat. Did they forget about the friendly robot roaming around contemplating its existence?!The whole premise "give me your harvest or we will kill you" is lame and they carried it over from the first movie. Yikers. There is zero indication from anywhere in this garbbo universe that anyone or anything needs or wants that wheat!Ok ok, chill, remember this is an action flick not a two brain cell storyteller. Enjoy the theater system and eat your popcorn right? Nope, the action is brutal to watch, everyone misses their shots! All the action is slow-mo and zoomed in so you don't notice the poor choreography execution and terrible aim. These people are clearly shooting 5-10 feet away from each other with no cover and the only tactic is to show up, everyone line up in a row and start shooting.Enjoy the laughs, this movie is ridiculous.

title: Considerably better than the first part
text: Second part of "Rebel Moon" has noticeably improved over his disappointing predecessor, and that is mainly because of two reasons; one, the characters are more fleshed out and presented with opportunities where they can shine and stand out, and two, the action set pieces for whatever reason seem more polished than the last occasion.All those big explosions, gunfights, and hand-to-hand combats looked more pleasing to the eyes. The issues with the CGI and editing still linger, though, they have been managed slightly better this time around. And in case you're wondering about the Slo-mos, yeah, you still have plenty. It is made by Snyder after all; you know he has to put those slow motion into work.

title: This movie is SO BAD i had to create an IMDB account to write about it
text: Honestly, I am amazing at the level of *(#$(*$ that this movie represents. It is as if the directors took every single worse movie-making skill and plug it into a single creation. The movie has almost no plot, random characters, long intros about nothing, sad moments that are totally not sad because you as the viewer are so upset that you don't feel sorry for the characters but are rather cheering for them to die.I can't say the acting is terrible because you can't judge an actor when they appears in a movie this bad. I just feel sorry for the people who participated in making this.The only thing that was pretty decent were the special effects but I'm still giving this a 1 star (I wish I could give it negative stars but that's not an option) as this is a movie and not a special effects portfolio for a studio.Please do yourself a favor and stay away from this unless you like pain.

title: And I thought the first one smelled bad...
text: Get that line? I cribbed it from The Empire Strikes Back. Why not? Every single idea in this terrible, boring, too much slow motion film is cribbed from another. Star Wars, the Last Samurai, 300.... The list goes on and on and on and on and on and on. Why so much repetition? Well it equals all the Snyder Cultists insisting how great a filmmaker he is. Here's a Clue: He and Shymalan should never be allowed money ever again to make a movie. A galactic empire needs to loot a planet of grain? Really? That's right from the Seven Samurai where the bad guys are coming for the harvest. I can understand this in medieval Japan, but a GALACTIC EMPIRE? The dialogue in this mess is beyond corny. Beyond bad. Beyond beyond. Snyder doesn't have an original idea. I don't know how much Netflix sank into this trash, but this must be where their decision to move away from big budget came from. This is just a laughably bad movie. It almost makes Sucker Punch - I still want my money back for this - look good.

title: Haters gonna hate, such is our world now, sadly
text: May people find some satisfaction in hating with a passion. So many reviews here were obviously written in a state of rage that is completely outlandish. Too few people with an acute psychiatric disorder haven't seen a doctor and don't take the relevant medication. In the past, they were just shouting in their car or home or in a pub. Now it's getting "slightly" overwhelming.Rebel moon part 2 is quite ok as an action movie. The CGI is excellent. The story is the umpteenth rehash of the Magnificent Seven. The characters are no more developed now than then.It's not a masterpiece but it is entertaining.

title: Its a 300 movie again but in the future sprinkled with bad dialogues all over
text: Brave underdogs who goes to fight a superior power in monochromotic, muted color tones slow motion scenes.Characters lacks depth, they all have horrible past and its sad but unable to emotionally connect. Everything is in place to establish the connection but something doesn't bring it out may be its the dialogues. At the end they band comes together and the punch line we can come up with is "To find her and to fight" come on!!My man Zack, I get it monochromotic slow motion scenes are super cool and we do enjoy it but you got to know by now its over used and am sure man of your talents can come up with something else to go with your cinematography.

title: Worthless watch. Save your time, skip this movie
text: This movie was so boring, uninteresting and waste of time. There are no fight scenes till 1 hr in a 2 hr movie. The dialogues are so boring, there are silly songs happening in the background which are so cringy. The special effects at places look terrible. There are set pieces in the movie where everyone shares their back story, which was so cliched. If Part 1 was terrible, part 2 is terrible 2.0. How much money was spent on making this movie. Zack Snyder is not a good director, he can make good set pieces but cannot write a good story or direct a great movie. STRONGLY ADVICE TO SKIP this series. NETFLIX WASTES so much money on this unnecessary trilogy. Instead they can make a whole series on WARHAMMER.

title: Better than the first one.
text: Both movies feel like it was made by AI if it was asked write a Star Wars movie but different. I think they could do a better job of developing characters and their relationships to one another. Things are to happen fast and without explanation in regards to this, it's like all of a sudden these warriors are all best friends for no reason. Not too say this movie is a bad film, I thought the action scenes were fun and the movie has a simple plot to follow. I think this franchise is slowly finding it's rhythm.Some things that I liked, I thought the Jimmy character was cool,.it would be nice to see more of it. And I think they finally got the relationships right towards the end of the movie. It definitely could use a little tweaking.

title: Zack Snyder added twice the slow motion because everyone complained about it
text: Knowing that he tried to pitch Disney that this would be a great star wars movie simply by copying seven samurai just tells you how creative he really is. Julius Caesar scene? Really? The entire village is about to burn to the ground and Zack Snyder is adding immense amount of slow motion, giving enough time for the bad guys to do invade. The entire village would have been obliterated due to the slowness of cutting crops and running very slowly. On top of that the amount of sun glares, light flares... everything is flaring and hazy. How can you have both of them at the same time? Either the entire universe is polluted and hazy but crispy enough to provide immense amount of glare/flares. It doesn't make sense. When Lora and the general was talking the sun didn't even match their conversation, horrible attention to detail. Useless scenes. Call it what is is... Copy seven samurai and add space and star wars. He added more slow motion in part two than part one... I think he did on purpose due to the amount of people complaining about it. Viewer discretion advice. The amount of slow lotion and flares is appalling.

title: A sci-fi epic that hits hard.
text: Rebel Moon 2: The Scargiver is an electrifying sequel that delivers on all fronts! From its gripping storyline to its breathtaking visuals, this sci-fi adventure keeps you on the edge of your seat from start to finish.The characters are well-developed and relatable, and the action sequences are nothing short of spectacular. Director Zack Snyder has once again crafted a masterpiece that will leave audiences wanting more. I especially liked the tanks and the final battle.It reminds you in part of a Star Wars tale. The fight scenes were very good. I can understand if it does not appeal to everyone.You either get it or you don't. Zack's style is slow motion heavy sequences filled with heavy actions scenes. If you are expecting an award winning script you won't find that here. It's more about world building and creating something fresh and new. A must-watch for any fan of the genre!

title: Suitably watchable
text: Weaker, but still suitably watchable.'Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver' is a more action-packed entry to the franchise, despite that I didn't hold as much interest in this as I did for the previous installment. I did, mind, like seeing the battles commence, both in terms of action and effects.Sofia Boutella is enjoyable once more, but Ed Skrein isn't as interesting this time around; I would've preferred a new villain for this one, to be honest. Djimon Hounsou does have more to work with on this occasion though, which is only a positive thing. Bae Doo-na has a few nice moments, even if she is underused for the majority.These movies work for me, what can I say? Kinda mad, however, that they're seemingly planning to make six of these in total... a bit much, even for someone that likes these opening two. I'll be there tho.

title: Why are these films being made?
text: Part 1 was an absolute crime against filmmaking. Why is this being allowed to continue? Netflix are just taking peoples cash and burning it right in front of their eyes. Zak Snyder is an absolute dud, who wrecked DC, he tried to wreck Star Wars and was denied the opportunity and this is the excrement that came from that.If anyone can name me a Snyder film that is good I'd love to hear it. It's a funny coincidence that a "Snyder" in the uk is something that is just absolute trash. This guy would struggle to serve a hamburger to you, let alone shoot an epic space opera over a reported 6 films that absolutely NO ONE wants to see.

title: It's so far from common sense, it's painful.
text:
People say rom com movies are bad... you haven't seen this sequel. As much potential it has, the screenwriting is so dumb and boring. It seems as if it was high school assignment.Somehow in a village that created an impression a maximum of 150 people lived... for a war of that size at least 2k must have died...
In 5 days they achieved so much as if they were gods from Marvel not farmers.The emperor needs the grain when they have machines to revive dead brains?! Somehow they invented that but couldn't make fertilizeze...
And what's with all the slow motion every 10min of fight?Oh man, it was painful to watch.

title: Enjoy the nonstop action sequence (minus the slow motion) like in part 1, still generic tho
text: It seems like I suffer from what I call "Post-Dune Effect", in which every sci-fi/space opera I watch or gonna watch after I watched both part 1 and part 2 of Denis Villeneuve's adaptation of Dune becomes kind of generic, and this movie is no exception, tho I admit I kinda enjoy the action scenes in both part 1 and part two of the Rebel Moon franchise. Like there's no difference between this series and the entire Riddick franchise aesthetically (except maybe for the amount of slow motion lol, and more modern CGI too), whereas Villeneuve's Dune creates its own style with some "Lawrence of Arabia" polishing. There is almost no stake at all, thanks to the plot armor that amplifies the fighting prowess of the good guys (even though most of them are not built for that) while at the same time, dumbs down the supposedly well trained bad guys (tch, classic). Snyder is said to have a plan for at least 6 movies of this series, but the overall first two movies are enough for me to move on and demand Denis Villeneuve to give me Dune Messiah already.7.5/10.

title: A missed opportunity to clean up the first bad movie
text: The latest installment in the franchise arrives with a sense of déjà vu, not because it evokes the original's charm, but because it inherits its predecessor's flaws and amplifies them. The sequel, much like the first, is a hastily assembled narrative that struggles to stitch together its plot points into a coherent tapestry.Where the film does manage to shine, albeit briefly, is in its action sequences. These moments of adrenaline are choreographed with a finesse that almost makes you forget the story's shortcomings. Almost.It's perplexing that the studio greenlit a sequel given the lukewarm reception of the original. Yet, here we are, and it seems the franchise is set to continue its trajectory with another follow-up. One can't help but wonder if the decision-makers are too deep in the franchise to course-correct.In conclusion, this sequel is a missed opportunity to redeem the series. It's a film that will likely be watched out of loyalty or curiosity, but it won't be remembered for its artistic merit.

title: Glorious Slo-Mo Action & more!
text: Yes, this movie received way too much hate, more than likely from a Star Wars crazed audience. I've never liked that series for it's dated look and trashy sci-fi tropes. This was something new and different.Sure there was some repetitive stuff and not the greatest of acting but the CGI and slomo cinematography made up for any lack.I do feel someone's obsession with shaved heads was a little overdone in this movie and it distracted from what was already an arguably weak story...Do we need a complicated plot in order to follow a movie today? I don't think so. At the end of the day, a movie should be fun and entertaining.Rebel Moon is all that and more.

title: Too Much Taken from other films
text: A lot of the scenes reminded me of other movies. Like all the battle scenes reminded me more of 300 than it actually being it's own movie. And a lot taken from Star Wars of course and just a whole lot of nothing to be entertained. A lot of the reviews say to ignore the bad ratings I would say ignore all the higher rates because it was pretty boring even if it was in the middle of a small war for grain or wheat. Also the supposed expert fighters they have help the village end up not really helping at all which caused the village they were protecting to die regardless of the help they were given.

title: Blank continuation
text: Since I defended Part One in my review of it, I feel obliged to also write a review of this. I even rewatched A Child of Fire to assure myself I still like it. And I do, which I can also say the same about Part Two.It's a direct continuation of Part One, picking up from where it ended. As a standalone film of course it won't make anyone go "wow I just watched a really decently fun movie". It's pretty much all action because that's what A Child of Fire led to. Hard to squeeze in some nice scenery shots on a battlefield, that's why it is lacking those compared to the prequel, understandably.Another thing this lacks are further exploration of the Rebel Moon world and characters development. I thought we'd get those in sequel if not in the first part. Because of it the movie feels blank. A no-brainer, just science fiction fighting.I'm not even gonna bother watching the making of (Creating a Universe: The Making of Rebel Moon), because they haven't created anything out of ordinary (hopefully YET) to see a documentary about it.Whole movie (both parts) feels like it's too long and also too short to get a sense of development and depth in many parts of new Zack Snyder's world.Giving it a 3/5 but only as a continuation of Part One: A Child of Fire. Alone it's surely a lower ranking but still fun.

title: All action romp, special effect bonanza
text: Loved it, don't care what anyone else thinks!Its a perfect follow on from part one and in my opinion makes part one better. This was great in every way, yes it's still cheesy, clichéd and has hints of things you have seen before but it's delivered in such a brilliant way that who bloody cares!The bad guy delivers, the lead delivers, the supporting cast, the plan, the technology, the scenes & settings are all absolutely spot on. Yes, yes, the back story is flimsy at best but it is what it is, accept it, move on and you will enjoy what is an amazing follow up to the mediocre part one.Action, action and more action, yes please, thank you very much.

title: Terrible movie
text: It took me 3 tries before I managed to finish this movie. It is horribly written, quite boring for at least the first half of the movie and filled with too many slow motion scenes. Some scenes already had slow motion and then he proceeds to add even more slow motion them, completely absurd. Not to mention that some of the action sequences were poorly choreographed. The big reveal at the ending was so poorly executed and underwhelming, I couldn't believe how lame it was. Overall, if you really do chose to watch this movie, just remember to switch off your brain. Otherwise, you will be like me, getting frustrated every 15 mins.

title: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver Was An Ok And Entertainingly Enough Action Packed Film
text: I think the most important thing when you want to critic a movie is to be fair, and i'm here just being fair and straight honest that i actually quite enjoy Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver, and i know a lot of people hated it, and that's without saying that the movie was indeed not without it flaws, lots of flaws from the performances, the story, some sequences, and the bad special effects/CGI in most of the part, i must say that the film has just way more than enough to actually entertained me the whole time, compare to my experience with the first movie which i also didn't hate but i was still not a big fan of it, i was really bored in the middle of that film, and in this one i just have a better time and especially for a 2 hours film, the build up scene was more than enough for me to enjoy, and the whole action packed was pretty enjoyable to see for the most part, it was all more than enough, it wasn't amazing but it wasn't terrible, and that's why i appreciate it more and ended up in the positive note, there is still a thing that i don't like, but the whole movie overall i thought that Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver was an ok and entertainingly enough action packed film, and it was better than the first one in my opinion.

title: Awkward tempo at times; anticipating 3rd part
text: Part Two of the Rebel Moon series.I enjoy these Netflix productions.The cast is amazing and they are well accomplished as is the crew and director Zack Snyder.Easily outstanding set design and production, location shoots, cinematography, creature FX (yeah, griffins really exist).It is not boring, just slow in places such that it feels like a strain to follow the tempo and flow.The battle scenes on the back half begin are epic. The 300 meets Star Wars. The bad guys are truly bad and the good guys battle hard and struggle to triumph over evil.One special effect that I really enjoyed from Part One, which continued into Part Two, the close up of the blasters as the director uses slowmo type of bullet-time, whereby you can see the lava laser bolt with the red glow of the round leaving the chamber and traveling away from the blaster. There is blowback sufficient to provide excellent suspended disbelief that blasters are actually being fired and exist.The light swords appear to be lava for red lighted weapons and ice for blue lighted weapons and made of glass. It is like a lightsaber but different, ice/lava sabre, with the great illusion of actually penetrating bodies during combat."Green screen" is well executed in this production. There is definitely no "low budget" feeling at all.I recommend this movie for its combat scenes, pyrotechnics, cinematography, and visual FX!Pay attention during the slow scenes as you may lose the overall perspective.

title: Slow motion
text: I have never seen more slow motion scenes in one big budget movie. It's almost like the film only has 0.5x playback speed enabled. That's the only reason it's 2 hours in length.The story is horrendous. The need for grain has never been more overstated than in this film. And yes there are slow motion scenes of people gathering grain. And boy are these scenes excruciatingly looooong.The looseness of plot is unsettling. Sloppy writing all over the place. The number of times the main characters could have simply ended the movie by easily finishing the villain was wild. The inability for entire squadrons of modern infantry to get even on shot on a character wielding only axes and a six-pack, is staggering.The special effects, the ships, the weapons and the effects showing weapon blast effects are incredible. But those are the only aspects worth rating positively.

title: Regret watching this film, should have watched somebody play farming simulator on YouTube instead.
text: For starters this film is absolutely atrocious. From the 2 hours of farming with 1 hour of it being in slow motion, to the antagonist's obsession with wheat? I get some people love their morning weetabix, but is this too far? Furthermore the main characters seem to be invincible with not a single bullet touching any of them and the soldiers being brain dead and oblivious to any plans despite their 'thermal aerial tech'. Overall terrible film, those who rated this film about 3 might have watched a different film? I'm not too sure, will have to ask whether they have an obsession with wheat too..

title: Is it an 8? No. Is it a 2? No. It's a high 6.
text: I enjoyed this better than the last one because the movie knows what it is and does what it's best at, being a visual grandeur. The action, visual effects and stunts are all A+ for a Netflix movie. This isn't Zack Snyder's best nor worst.Someone compared this to Madame Web and I hope they have a child whose doesn't go to bed unless they watch Madame Web.Djimon Housou is great and other actors do fairly well. We aren't looking for some acting masterclass here. If you're looking for some cool looking CqC, gunfu, big and small ships go boom, pew pew storm trooper aim, good guys win bad guys eat dust all for a lazy Saturday evening then this movie is perfect.The movie is weakest in the beginning. Zack missed the character development in the first part and tries to catch up in this half but fails. Once that's out of the way it's all badassery.Some day I will come back to this movie after I have forgotten about it just for the second half.

title: If you liked Part One (set-up), you'll like Part Two (showdown)
text: Aside from the visuals, I was quite underwhelmed by Part One -- I gave it 5 stars. Part Two is an improvement in that we learn more about our merry band of "Seven Samurai", as they share their formative background stories. The upshot is that these previously one-dimensional characters are now two-dimensional. In addition, I think Part Two is less blatantly derivative. This may sound like faint praise, but I honestly appreciated the improvement, and some credit is due. However, the characters in these films are merely there to provide sufficient story context for a bunch of CGI.The visuals are good, just like in Part One, but with more explosions. The defensive prep of the village was well done. It's nice to see people use their brains and come up with a plausible strategy (kind of rare in movies). So more credit is due.I enjoyed this movie; I think it rates 6.5 stars on that basis. However, I'm deducting a half-star for semi-predictability. That makes six (6) stars total.PS The lack of powered (or automated) farming tools (aside from a stake-bed hover-platform) is puzzling. It's supposed to show some pseudo-Amish quality-of-primitive-life, but anyone who has actually done that kind of work will tell you (better) TOOLS give you quality of life. Granted, they had a mill, but carefully avoided showing the power source (hmm). Anyone who thinks subsistence farming is "fun" is delusional; mechanized agriculture is responsible and necessary for modern (middle-class) life; without it you have a neo-feudal society at best (which GRANTED is what they're depicting, but better tools would be in EVERYONE'S best interest, and are clearly feasible in a society that can make dreadnoughts, sentient/sapient robots, and hover-boards).

title: Zack Snyder, What Were You Thinking Here?
text: I find it sad to state that the reason the films aren't getting great reception is because the studio wanted their version released and your own has been vaulted. It may have worked for "Justice League" but I don't find that any version can save these. The screenwriting was tough and lacked a lot of depth, and I found it so easy to not care for a single character. Zack Snyder attempts to bring heavy emotion into the story and characters but it never lands. The editing was painful especially with the use of slow-motion and how overused it is, I got to the point where I was ready to turn the film off multiple times.Overall, there is very little to say of this film that I enjoyed if anything at all. A lacklustre, poorly inspired, wannabe Star Wars that I never had the time to care for, was just a disappointment.

title: Best movie evar!
text: ChatGPT & Midjourney united made top-notch motion picture out of cheap, old and boring stuf previously made by stupid humans.Piece of StarWars, chunk from WarHammer40k laid to storyline from Seven Samurai (or Magnificent Semen if you prefer cowboys). Alien, Westworld, Game of Thrones, Days of Heaven - i can't even rember all stolen... mmm, mean all references to real movies. And all this richness flavored by cheapest CGI you ever saw and most generic design of everything. I mean it. Every single piece of cloth, weapon, vehicle (oh, hello Ghost in the Shell!), ship, lanscape - it feels like the designers weren't even juniors, but dudes who complete their first 3D course. Looks like only Antony Hopkins "robot" was made by someone who can remotely call himself an artist.P. S. THIS IS SO BAD, YOU GONNA LIKE IT! I'm, presonaly, was dying laughing almost all this 2 hours of generic bull****.

title: Lousey part 1 and Part 2
text: Zack Snyder, known for his visually stunning films, has a mixed record when it comes to delivering cohesive and compelling storytelling. While some of his works showcase impressive visuals, others fall flat due to repetitive elements and weak narratives. For instance, "Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice" received criticism for its convoluted plot and lackluster character development. The film's action sequences, while visually striking, often lacked coherence in choreography, leading to disjointed fight scenes that failed to engage viewers effectively.Another example from Snyder's repertoire is "Sucker Punch," which suffered from a disjointed storyline and overreliance on stylized visuals at the expense of coherent storytelling. The film's attempts at blending fantasy elements with real-world drama resulted in a muddled narrative that left audiences perplexed rather than immersed.Moving beyond Snyder's films, there are numerous instances in the realm of Netflix originals where budget constraints have led to subpar productions. One such example is the series "Iron Fist," which faced criticism for its lackluster fight choreography and uninspired cinematography.
