The show's action sequences often felt staged and lacked the dynamic energy expected from a martial arts-based storyline.Additionally, Netflix's "Death Note" adaptation received backlash for its departure from the original source material, resulting in a weak storyline that failed to capture the essence of the beloved manga and anime series. The film's pacing issues and underdeveloped characters further contributed to its overall negative reception.In terms of cinematography, Netflix's "The Ridiculous 6" is another example of a poorly executed production. The film's visual style and editing choices were often jarring, detracting from the viewing experience and highlighting the limitations of its budget.Overall, while Zack Snyder has delivered visually impressive moments in some of his works, the lack of cohesive storytelling and effective choreography has been a recurring issue. Similarly, budget constraints have led to shortcomings in various Netflix originals, highlighting the challenges faced in balancing visual spectacle with narrative depth and technical execution.

title: Is it possible to blame the visionary Zack Snyder? I can't...
text:
It's so bad that it's delicious at the same time. It's unbearable to watch, but you watch."They came from other worlds to fight for us, to die for us. May they find peace. We will honor them as best we can..."
Well, how can you not admire the childlike spontaneity of Zack Snyder, how can you hate him for his hilarious fantasy? I can't. And you?How many times, per view, I covered my eyes with my palm ... how many times, I exhaled tiresomely, looking at the clock ... Yes, a lot!This idealized test can test the strength of any cynic. This is a stylized poem that only a real dreamer can write. Well, how can you blame it? And for what? For a grain of rye, or for a mug of ale? For the desire to be free, or for that notorious love? Love is fleeting, the rules are changeable, and people will always remain people, with their weaknesses and passions, but what will remain? Memories, or maybe a legacy? Whatever you call emotions, feelings, we always turn to the past, it is there that the origins of our motives, which inspire the ideas of incorrigible dreamers, restless storytellers, cheerful cranks. It is these strange dreamers, discoverers, innovators, inventors who make our lives more interesting, more diverse, richer.The author is not afraid to create, make mistakes, fall and get up again. Is it right to condemn yourself for a harmless creative impulse and be afraid of censure? Maybe it's better to pretend to be someone you are not: put on a fake mask and be like everyone else... to agree with the one-voiced majority and march in step with someone else's will...
Probably not! That's what the author thinks: he talks about freedom, home, family, love. He says it's worth fighting for! He speaks as he can, as he sees, as he feels.Is it possible to condemn for this? No, I CAN'T!"Next season, and in 100 years and continuing to live..."

title: a complete nonsense
text:
Hollow characters , nonsensical fights , pointless storyline , pointless slowmotions , laughable decisions
you can not find a single lements that makes you to watch till the end protagonist and antagonist didn't made it to a characters , zack snyder just want it to stretch the movie with unreasonable fights and slow motion and yelling and explosions ! I gave it 2 just because of 2 scenes that even that two scenes was mediocre. You can not find a single element of movie and cinema in this title that you can rely on it and say YEAH let's not be that harsh on it . Unfortunately this was a disaster !

title: AN EPIC CLOSING...?
text: Now streaming on Netflix is Zack Snyder's (Sucker Punch/Dawn of the Dead) follow-up to his mega-opus from last year which wraps up his Seven Samurai homage (poorly constructed theft?) as the heroes make a stand against the evil Galactic Empire, sorry Imperium, on a moon whose people are trained to fight the good fight w/the ultimate clutch between the good Sofia Boutella & evil Ed Skrein taking place on an imperial cruiser. Snyder at the outset never did himself any favors by espousing how 'original' his take on Kurasawa canon was when others like John Sturges & recently Antoine Fuqua managed to take his samurai epic & transplant it to the old West but even if you're argument leans on his melding samurai adventures w/a sci-fi aesthetic, sorry Roger Corman got there first w/1980's Battle Beyond the Stars.

title: Is this for real?
text: Oh boy...it felt like a 2 hour long meme.Rare is the clumsiness of this movie, the basic concept of story telling seems to be foreign to mr Snyder. Saying "this is what my personality is" does not count as character development. Exposition through a daisy chain of flashbacks does not mean you're following the golden rule of "show, don't tell".If farming in slow motion and vomit inducing "cinematography" is your thing, you're in for a blast.To give credit where credits is due...some of the actors tried very hard to have fun with the material, but this is beyond salvation. For a quirky alternative to star wars watch Krull instead.If this is a dream project for Snyder, call Freddy Krueger.

title: You people are crazy for not liking this movie!
text: I wasn't sure how I felt about part 1. It wasn't that good. But it was also only half the movie so you don't really get the whole picture til you see part 2. But holy cow is at good. I was on the edge of my seat the entire time I watched. All the combat sequences were done really good. Yes, there's not really much blood or anything. But the fact that a small village of farmers take on an entire empire, every single character is really well cast. And you can definitely see the Star wars influences mixed in with some seven samurai. I can't wait to see the directors cuts of these movies. We should support movies like this because they are rare.

title: Entertaining and uninspiring
text: This movie is beautiful, from the cgi to the set design everything is great to look at. Intriguing worldbuilding helped keep my attention, it would have been nice to see more of the universe that serves as this movie's backdrop. It also has a great cast that did their best with what they were given. And there ends the positive things I have to say about Rebel Moon.The dialogue was predictable, shallow, and just oh so weak. Speeches meant to be inspiring left me feeling slightly embarrassed, it really is as if they were written by a teenager, and not one of the talented ones. The plot was flimsy at best, the motivations of most characters took an extreme suspension of disbelief.And the terribly unimaginative clichés! The Korean sword master from a fishing village? How could they proudly display such little creativity?Overall, I'm glad I watched this movie but I would never recommend it. It's good to watch on a lazy day, the action and visuals are pleasing, but please don't watch this movie expecting to feel something deeper than entertainment.

title: Horrific! Terrible! Pointless!
text: I've never seen such terrible films ... I'll put as much effort into this review as they did into the film ... To many slow motions, to many sweeping camera views of just people starring into nothingness, to many back stories of people we have no interest in.The ending of this film was nothing short of a mass of all the cheap gimmicks of every 80's/90's and Z list movie combined into a useless story.The tech is all over the place. The clothes and acting all over the place. The fact a superior elite fighting force being bestest by a couple of dozen farmers ... is hilarious! Clearly they have never seen a platoon of trained soldiers fight.Also the knock off lightsabers .. well i actually quite liked them.I noticed an alien (non-human) at the end. Things are just thrown in these movies like a child throwing colouring crayons at a wall..

title: A lot of people have to die for a little grain..
text: This is part two of Rebel Moon, the epic space saga.In part two the story begins back at the village where everything begun in part one.🙂 The story goes that the ruler of the empire have to get the grain from one small village of a few hundred people on a desolite planet, bcs aparently grain isnt cultivated anywhere else in the universe. Thus the ruler of the empire is taking his dreadnot starcruiser to this village even though he could easily travel at lightspeed around the entire universe.. Just to clarify, there is nothing special with this grain, its just for food.If this doesnt make sense for you, well you have only got an apetizer of what is to come bcs this is how the entire movie runs. Another example of this is that the farmers are using simple hand tools to cut the grain while having starships and equal technology at hand for example.The CGI is fairly decent though.🙂Well, I wont say much more, I dont want to ruin the experience of this masterpiece of contradictions, badly written scripts, acting, and so much more.3/10.

title: Bad
text: Very disappointing, like part one of The Creator. Nice cast and premise but weak plot and undeveloped characters. This show steals from Star Wars as The Creator steals from Ghost in the Shell, and both fail to get even close. Like the directors don't understand what made those movies great in their time.Having an asian looking actress to be the "ninja like" character, the black actor to be the "african warrior like" character and so on, are just the cherries on the top of a terrible script and forced back stories.Still the cast does a good job. But those lame dialogs and slow motion fights with cheap epic music is just cringe. The fake beards look terrible too.

title: Disappointment.
text: It's a film that far fell short of my expectations. How much worse can a movie be made. It's worse than the first movie. I thought they were going to wrap it up. The script and acting are very bad. It was the most amateur movie I've ever seen in my life. In particular, the role of the swordsman woman is greatly exaggerated. The lead is constantly crying. Charlie Hunnam was the only actor to spice up this film. I was sad that he wasn't in the second movie. In summary, I can say the following. For both films. How did you manage to make such a bad movie with such a budget? Did a 12-year-old write this movie? It's a pity.

title: Magnificent
text: I enjoyed the scenes where Kora tells her story about the assassination of the princess and how conflicted she was for her loyalty to her Balisarius and the Royal Family. The background music in that scene with violins and viola performers on that scene was magnificent. This is where she gets to understand why Balisarius spared her life when she was taken from her world when she was 9yrs old. My other favorite part is the scene is where Titus discussed the preparation of their defense and strategy. The other scenes I enjoyed was when Titus and the other warriors told their stories and their reasons why they are determined to fight for revenge for what they all lost. I believe Ed Skrein role as Admiral Atticus Noble as the villain, he performed it superbly with passion. He deserves an award for his well played role. And to add, it's so amazing how the director choose the casts who are qualified as actors, and well experienced in theater acting. And majority were born in the 80's just like me. 😜

title: Nice Film
text: In my opinion, rebel moon 2 better than dune 2, first of all, this is not a film made for awards, and this is felt from start to finish, have some scene similiar with star wars, it kept me in suspense for the entire duration and I must say that the special effects are well done, some excess but not much, the film is enjoyable and action nice, outstanding and what an ending, unfortunately, it doesn't have any overwrought superheroes, so I can see why most people are so upset by a film they weren't forced to watch, but much better than expected, with tons of action and great acting, the movie was great with intense moments and really stunning effects. Enjoy the movie, without any bias and you will have a splendid time!

title: Magnificent 7 badly remade with lasers
text: I like Snyder sometimes...I thought 300 and Watchmen were excellent.His output since has been very mixed. Not just in the overall finished films but scenes within films.And the two Rebel Moon films are exactly this.Some scenes are superb, exciting, spectacular and great to watch. Others are screamingly awful, badly shot, rotten dialogue and characters doing plain stupid things. And Snyders usual slo-motion shots are so overused that it just becomes annoying.There are so many inconsistencies in Rebel Moon that it so often just becomes completely jarring.For example have Space ships with powerful weapons, but those weapons are seemingly targeted (very slowly of course) by turning a pulley wheel and looking through a visor....no laser guidance or even fast motor-drives on these space ships. Oh no.The characters are attempted to be given backgrounds and depth but they all still appear as cardboard cutouts and real stars are the special effects which as superb & spectacular of course.It really is just The Magnificent 7 with space ships and lasers but is less involving, more shallow and just left me empty after watching it.Shame.

title: It's... aiight.
text: So, I see a lot of people dumping on this movie. I will start by saying, it is better than the first, which is maybe why my rating is generous. There are reviewers I listen to, but though they may hate it, I tried to set aside their biases and looked as to whether I enjoyed it. I did. I do like Zack Snyder's filming style. I do personally like his filmography and yes, I do like the special effects.Now for the negatives, the story is... meh. I thought some of it was exceedingly corny. The music with the lyrics, well... I kinda felt they were very very juvenile. I personally feel like Zack Snyder enlisted his children to write the lyrics. Overall, I'm glad I didn't have to pay for this in the theaters. If you've seen everything on Netflix and this pops up... its an ok way to kill a few hours.

title: Less emotional engagement than a 1 night stand
text: We begin with a half hour of harvesting wheat that make Derek Zoolander's coal mine work scene look naturalistic. And finish with a battle in never ending slow mo where the smart thing to do is run at thousands of gun carrying bad guys with an axe.The story is profoundly bad (a battle over bags of flour). The character development written by a 4 year old and it covers every used up trope from heartwarming smiling blonde haired kid to maniacal bad guy with super strength. And then you add the by-the-numbers plot and background reveals to really loosen the bowels.It makes the Star Wars prequel trilogy seem like compulsive viewing. I was left sitting there at the end just thinking WTF. A waste of time, money and resources. Embarrassing.

title: Not too bad, but such wasted potential
text: I've read a few reviews and find a lot of them too harsh, or too negative. Sure, there's a lot of things that are tacky, and not that well thought through...I think this is the first time that a SciFi movie have spent 20 minutes on harvesting... Some of the choices for providing backstory is just cringe, like "hey, let's go round the table and tell our life stories".A lot of the added scenes to make it look "cool" are even more cringe, lite someone running head first into a shower of bullets (lasers really) and then tosses an enemy over his shoulder... Said tossing over the shoulder leaves all hundreds of charging enemies so stunned that they forget to fire any more...The number of slow-mo scenes makes this movie about 40 minutes longer that it would have been without them.Conveniently for our hero's fighting with swords, when the enemies show up, they too have forgotten all rifles and firearms and come bearing swords too...There's a scene for several minutes about riding an elevator while looking fierce by wrapping a sword handle that must go to the history for being the most ridiculous time filler ever.I also question a lot of the logic, I mean if you are dressed as an enemy soldier to blend in but then you decide to ditch all of that advantage to be able to instead walk the hallways in a white top, really sticking out like a sore thumb to the enemies... It probably looks better to reveal some skin and shiny muscles, but come on!So, yes, a lot of bad choices form the director and waaaay too much effort to try and spice the scenes up, and unnecessarily I might add.The actors are doing a good job, but the script is too weak, too little plot and "finess" to be able to carry two plus hours.It's like they had only like one hour twenty minutes of good movie, but Netflix had ordered at least 2 hours so they had to add a lot of extra (=cringe) scenes and a ton of slow-mo to boot to stretch it out.Over all it's a good and viewable story, and I am actually looking forward to the third movie (because there will be one, trust me!) but I really, really, hope that they come up with some better storytelling and some more character development as I now have a hard tie rooting for the good guys...

title: Failed
text: It is just another failed Star Wars wannabe movie. The different thing is very bad version. As an action movie it is okay, but when we want to enjoy good story then I consider it as B-.When I read from some articles, the story is ment to be an adaptation of Kurosawa's 7 Samurai and Star Wars. I should say yes, however Snyder failed to develop the story. Snyder imagination to make the audience able to sit for 2 hours is totally wrong. A very boring movie. Big budget one but feels like as if a very cheap movie.The special effects are average with present technology. Can't really help to reach certain 'wow effect' as I expected before.

title: Messy Steampunk Story - But better than the 1st part
text: The story is silly and messy, but it's good/ok entertainment. No masterpiece, for sure. However, let it flow and relax while watching. If you miss a dialog or scene, it's uncritical, and you won't be more lost than watching it end 2 end.I'm always wondering if everyone involved doesn't see the story gaps or doesn't care. Maybe it's related to our brain's inability to follow/handle complex stories while watching the movie. So, either CGI or story, but not both.And it became CGI, trying to compensate for the thin story, which it does pretty well. Mix Star Wars, and Mad Max, starship Troopers ... and you see the result in the Rebel Moon movie. What's missing is a bit.of Aliens...

title: A movie only for the short-minded
text: A movie that shows you how we have taken for granted the story tellers for the likes of George Lucas, Peter Jackson, James Cameron and so and so... just as we thought these guys were getting mediocre, now we know that all those movies they did is hard to accomplish.This move is so poor on character establishment, lazy screen writing, failed to make an emotional attachment because Jack Snyder do not know what it takes to establish them. Over glorified characters in the end meant nothing. There's no story creativity in this movie at all.With all the money spent is this all he can do? They could have made a far better story than this. Such a waste. O.

title: Rebel Reviewer
text: This film is in by no way perfect, however an overall rating of 5.2 is a disgraceful misjudgement! For a straight to streaming sci-fi, this is an epic. An all out action thriller with great performances, superb special effects, and all our resistance war.Yes there is some slow-Mo (less than the first) - This seems most reviewers problem - I'm fine with it and in some cases, added beautifully to the action.Not enough in the film to love the characters etc (bar the robot) but a fun ride all the same. Would have loved this to have been a series beginning with each warriors story as an individual episode.Enjoy it on your own terms and ignore the Star Wars fan boys.8/10.

title: It is even worse than the first part
text: In this film there are no any idea, absolutely. In the case of first part the creators tried to invent something, although with little success. But in that movie there was a man-spider, griff, etc. This film doesn't even try. It is a a bunch of scenes we have watched a thousand time, but these scenes appear more like parodies to me. There is no story, no characters, not atmosphere, no world, not style, not interesting planets, only starships are interesting a little bit.When lightsaber appeared on the screen, I hardly believed what I was sawing. This idea is so iconic and belongs specially to Star Wars that stealing this weapon is so impudence I could'n imagine before.

title: It would have been a better star wars story
text: This should have been made into a disney star wars movie instead of those disastrous stories where they killed all the old heroes to switch them up with terribly written characters. In this movie even the robot had a more interesting background story than any of the new star wars trilogy characters had.This should have been made into a disney star wars movie instead of those disastrous stories where they killed all the old heroes to switch them up with terribly written characters. In this movie even the robot had a more interesting background story than any of the new star wars trilogy characters had.

title: Awful
text: The whole film doesn't make sense. In our universe there is 3 trillion planets we can see. In rebel moon I'm sure there is similar. In rebel moon they have advanced ai robots who can do far more than any men, without food drink or breaks. For some reason, they decide to have a tear up as the evil empire wants their grain which about 10-20 people do painstakingly by hand. Why wouldn't robots do this on an abandoned empty planet? Nothing makes sense!What a load of tosh!I didn't feel any connection with any of the cliched, 2-dimensional characters so didn't care when any of them died.However, it gets a few stars for great visuals and CGI, the satisfying splashy-lava effect of the blasters, and the light-trail effects of the light sabres. The coolest moment was the James the mech with his cloak in his One Punch Man moment.Half the movie was the farmers harvesting wheat and after one day of combat training got a better kill-death ratio than any of the veterans.The other half of the movie was a guy turning the little wheel to aim the Dreadnaught cannon.Remind me never to watch any more Synder movies on Netflix. Plasma guns were cool though.

title: Not that bad at all part 1 and 2 togheter
text: Was it a great movie? NO not really.Was it really bad? No not really.It has it flaws and could be a bit shorter if you put 1 and 2 together.I'd love Holkenborgs score and with some food and beer it was enjoyable.I love most of Zack's movies and this is not his best but absolutly no 2 or 2 score movie.Maybe a lot of people hoped for a new star wars universe but No that's not the case, although those new movies weren't that great either.I would like to see a third installment and drop the slomo, learn from some faults and than we have a fun new scifi movie. I did like justice league as well and got better over them.

title: Laughably appalling
text: This film is the perfect compliment to part 1.I didnt think the first could be topped but Zach Snyder has outdone himself with this effort!Incessant slow motion shots, poor;y written dialog so awful you pity the actors who have to recite such tripe,numerous afterthought ADR lines. Its basically a terrible film on every conceivable level.There is a scene mid way through where all the main heroes relay their individual back stories, and they sit around in a convenient semi circle, 2 of them placed awkwardly on 3 sides of a rectangular table, presumably to make it easy to film them together. Thats the level of film-making on offer here im afraid. I would say this is not worth 2 hours of anyones time to be perfectly honest. 1/10.

title: WTH with the bad reviews
text: I thought both movies were great. I'm easily entertained but I thought both movies had great acting and great special effects and great dialogue and great storylines. There's not much that holds my attention nowadays but these movies absolutely did.To get to the 600 word count:I thought both movies were great. I'm easily entertained but I thought both movies had great acting and great special effects and great dialogue and great storylines. There's not much that holds my attention nowadays but these movies absolutely did.Do a Diddy Diddy dum diddy do do . Do a Diddy Diddy dum diddy do do.

title: The Magnificent 7 in Space...again.
text: First The 7 Samuari, then the Magnificent 7, then Battle beyond the Stars, Rebel Moon, one and two are really just the same. But that doesn't make them bad films, quite the contrary, the story is familiar, and it lives up to it's predecessors. All the action you want, a great hissable baddie, heroes, heroines, even a robot with a conscience. Worth watching both parts, although hardly original, still, if action and battles are your thing then this is for you. Think Battle Beyond The Stars with a massive budget. Recommend you see part one before part two, even though they are stand alone movies, and if you can, give Battle beyond the Sars a look as well. The 6 score is overall for both films.

title: Snyder and his fans need an intervention
text: I do not know how Snyder fans continue to gas up these movies and try and boost something that clearly is subpar to a franchise that isn't even doing all that great currently. That's actually sad. The pacing is worse than the first film, the exposition is insanely forced and spoon fed, and it just feels basic. To kind of balance it out, the movie does have some great action sequences, but dangling some shiny keys in front of a pile of trash doesn't make it more appealing. Junkie is back at it again with trailer music score, sounds just like 3 of his other films. Do not listen to these reviews giving it 10/10, see it for yourself and judge.

title: Unbelievably bad
text: Everything is bad, the acting, the dialogue, the effects, the cinematography. Everything. It looks like a amateur college student project. Even the score is bad. There are several shots in the film that are so bad I think because of the frame rate but honestly not sure. Also just tons of pointless b roll shots and cheesy scenes. The casting is also terrible. The characters are awful. The premise is so stupid. Did I mention the acting is bad? It seems like they never did a second take. Whatever happened they just rolled with it. I honestly feel bad for all the people that were part if it that wanted to make something great and this is what happened.

title: At the end actions are quite impressive
text: Not the best actions I have seen in movies but to be honest I felt to give 7 stars becaise action directors have done a good job. Far better actions than part 1. Story line is actualy let's say no story line at all apart from defending the moon. Only one thing regarding the story line, the main characters are talking about their past and why they are against the main kingdom. So you can know the history of them which makes a sense of why they are fighting against the kingdom. It has some more behind the stories than protecting the moon village.Anyways as an overall I would give 7 out of 10 because part 1 has been leveraged by this and mostly this obe has better actions. Just to spend your lesuire time with an action movie this is quite a good one and also if your are into future galactic civilization things like "Foundation" by Isaac Asimov, then this movie is not that bad but start from part one.

title: Does this not remind you of...
text: Battle Beyond the Stars? That one had more charm. This one shows just another small female warrior wiping out a bunch of men who are twice her size and number. Enough already. Whatever happened to the capable male warrior? Thankfully, Braveheart won big at the Oscars as it brought back the real man, as we have been subjected to the many clones of Ellen Ripley. Still, the story is simple in the David versus Goliath style. But enough of trained uniform soliders falling prey to a bunch of simpletons. Yes, there was the Viet Nam War, but by know you should know what to do and what to avoid. Clear? Peace always.

title: Here's the secret to enjoying this movie
text: Yes, the plot is very basic, you've seen it before a bunch of times. The acting is pretty bad and some of the costume choices are questionable. But the visuals and the action scenes are very good. Watch on a good TV with a good Sound system. Keep your remote handy and fast forward through all the Various montages (you'll recognize them when you see them). That way you don't have to tolerate the ridiculous dialogue and can enjoy action and visuals that Marvel used to do.I'm not sure what Zack Snyder was trying to do with this movie. We've got western, sci-fi, steam punk etc. It's all a bit strange. He should definitely stick to his day job as a Director and give up on screenwriting. However, I found the fight scenes well choreographed and the CGI and visuals actually added to the movie. I will say that Ed Skrein stands out in this movie as the evil Admiral. He steals every scene that he's in. He knows he's in a cheesy sci-fi movie and plays it perfectly.Sure, I would've liked a better story, better acting, etc, but it's a decent Saturday night popcorn movie. Just don't feel that you have to waste time on scenes that slow down the pacing (and there are more than a few). I think that's what most people are complaining about. Just skip them. I promise you will not lose the plot by doing this. It does culminate into a pretty decent finale.Anyway, that's my take. It's a two hour movie that I watched in less than an hour and a half. I would apply this same strategy to part I, though I spent less time fast forwarding through that movie. Obviously, it's been set up for a Part III. I'll have my remote handy. 😉

title: 2 hours utter boredom in slow-mo
text: Snyder is the parasite of Hollywood.I really don't know who let that man to direct anything.Honestly I don't know what was the plot of this crap!2 hours intense torture with too much unnecessary slow-mos featuring CGI....I bet this movie would be about 40 minutes without those.Boutelle should stay with dancing...The acting was horrible in many ways.Definitely do not recomment to watch this to anybody!There were times i literally have to find something doing in between some scene like crocheting or playing phone games. Yes I was this bored by this crappy movie!Every time I thought, I couldn't be less entertained the movie proofs me wrong.It felt like the worst movie I have even seen in my life...This crap will NEVER beat Star War, nor Star Trek!Instead of directing, Snyder should try writing....

title: Best sci-fi action movie for 2024 so far
text: Rebel moon part 2 takes it time to build characters further, kudos to the general to actual go into the action. It makes the rouge team trustworthy and makes you love the underdogs they are.Smart relation building so you actually care if some dies trying!Final action scene are next level with crisp clear sword fights, in slow motion so you can enjoy the details. Then each kill group are given in waves to enjoy, which gives you time understand the timeline. Finally a big finale that will make your sub woofer jump across the floor.I rarly write reviews, but this movie actually needs some positive love. To the film, sfx, 3dfx and actors, great job! Looking forward to part three!

title: Somewhat formulaic and relies too much on vfx and audio to carry it.
text: I enjoyed the spectacle of both movies, but felt the storyline relied too much on common tropes, relying too much on VFX and sound to carry it.Think the magnificent seven in space and you're halfway there.If you don't have a fairly big TV and at least a basic surround sound system, it'd feel flat. I have a fairly decent set up with a moderately high end TV and 5.1 surround, which I only use early evening as the sound carries and I don't think want to annoy the neighbours. I started watching too late one evening with just the TV speakers and it didn't hold my attention, so I waited until I could watch with the full home cinema, and then i was rapt.

title: Not recommended.
text: Another bomb by snyder. He continues to be a disappointing director who only focus on visuals, superficial stuff and making things look "cool" instead of being a genuine storyteller with compelling characters and script. The acting and dialogues are horrible. Scenes feels like it was plagiarised from something else. Netflix is just burning their money if their funding for more BS like this. As for Snyder, he needs to do some self analysis, self criticism and remove himself from the cult of 'yes men'. It's quite sad seeing once who was an underrated director now only tries to stay relevant by talking about dc characters and other stuff from a decade ago.

title: Zack Snyder Is the King of sci-fi films
text: Rebel Moon creator Zach Snyder praised Part One: A Child of Fire as an exciting new dawn for the sci-fi genre, featuring a two-part story involving a bustling galaxy ruled by a militaristic regime. However, after two hours and 15 minutes, Part One proved unsatisfactory and half-baked action movie cobbled together from parts of more inspired genre fare. Rebel Moon Part Two: The Scargiver offers only a slight improvement, thanks to its simpler story and more enticing climactic battle, but two more hours of the same shallow characters and plot. The plot of The Scargiver plays out like Seven Samurai/The Magnificent Seven meets Return of the Jedi, with the warrior crew returning to the moon of Veldt to protect the villagers from the Imperium army. With a ticking clock counting down until an Imperium dreadnought arrives, Snyder spends a gratuitous amount of time showing the villagers and warriors harvesting the land. The voiceover of Anthony Hopkins' mechanical knight, James, is confounding and provides little value to the story, except for a late tag-team entry into the fray. "Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver" is the second installment in Zack Snyder's sci-fi series, featuring a group of space-Amish farmers who face off against cartoon baddies with jackboots and glowing swords. The film's trademarks, such as extravagant lens flares and slow-motion shots, are used with abandon, and while Sofia Boutella delivers a balletic elegance in her fight sequences, it ultimately lacks a uniqueness. The film draws from various influences, including Star Wars, Mad Max, Caravaggio, John Ford, European art-house cinema, World War II propaganda flicks, steampunk Victoriana, cottagecore girlies on Instagram, and Wagner's "Götterdämmerung." The score features two types of choirs and a single frame might include a robot dressed like the Green Knight and a Conan the Barbarian clone. Despite its generic content, "The Scargiver" is a delirious, pulpy mishmash of knockoffs. The first "Rebel Moon" was released on Netflix in December and featured a farm boy named Gunnar and a secretive assassin named Kora. The story picks up five days before the squad must defeat a vicious army led by an admiral (Ed Skrein) with a bad haircut and worse attitude. The script by Snyder, Kurt Johnstad, and Shay Hatten is a mix of exposition and soliloquies, with no authentic conversations. The film features primal, pitiless, and agonizing carnage, with Snyder excelling in his ability to kill anyone, even nice people and grandmothers-turned-guerrilla warriors. The film has plenty of death, but little life, with Boutella, the lead, being listless until she can stabbing. Slow motion footage is used in scenes where actors seem to be ordered to ignore food. Snyder's ostentatiousness is unmatched, with his refusal to dial down any of his impulses, such as dramatic smooches and priestly hats. The film's moral debate is reminiscent of Kevin Smith's "Clerks," where the moral debate revolves around the never-seen workers who died building the Death Star for Darth Vader. Snyder shows their faces and mows them down, making it a more realistic portrayal of the battle.

title: The Sleepgiver
text: Using a device called fast forward rather in an excessive way you may get some entertainment before falling asleep. I'm not a great fan of Rebel Moon Part One, but it was acceptable. Part Two, however, is mostly just bad and boring. If Zack Snyder's intention was to produce a strong sedative, he accomplished the mission with excellence. I consistently had the impression that someone had a script with lots of checkpoints, and that's it. On top, just imagine for a moment that some skilled warriors and some peasants want to fight the forces of the USA or NATO... Anyway, the production is solid. If you don't mind a mind-numbing story and only watch the action sequences (especially the prolonged battle in the last act), you may find a little entertainment while saving some of your lifetime. In my opinion, Part Two is a new all-time low in the oeuvre of Mr. Snyder. Is this still the same director who made movies like the remake of Dawn of the Dead, 300, Watchmen, and Sucker Punch? If yes, what happened to his skills and taste? One last note: the most fun I had was discovering which scene or idea was borrowed from which other movie...

title: Snyder can make action boring
text: First of all, I don't love nor hate Snyder. I don't care about him, I'm only judging the movie. And the movie is really, really bad.The premise is stupid. Snyder wanted to adapt the 7 samurais but... he adapted way too directly. The fact that an advanced sci-fi empire needs grain from a village is profoundly stupid. At least, pretend they need some.rare earths or something...Action scenes are really really bad too. I was bored to death while watching them. Also annoyed. You know, it's this kind of movie, where people think guns are swords. They charge the enemy in plain sight, literally running towards a row of rifles.To be honest, I have nothing more to say, because there's nothing more in the movie. It's empty action scenes filled with unnecessary slo-mos. The worldbuilding is broken. Just taking antic names into a scifi universe doesn't make it clever.Anyway, just don't bother...

title: Netflix paid director first then there was no effort to get up from a bed. If you give this salad 5 or above you must've said Dune was boring and slow movie :):):)
text:
It could've been possible ONLY ON NETFLIX! If people paid a fee to see this salad in theaters there would be a revolution. Those that loved this movie, which is 1% said Dune 2021 & 2024 was boring, slow and terrible. 0.99% of those were children and people with bad vision and hearing problems.Everyone else over 15 years old would leave and ask for a refund.It looks as if we see a case of pay me first then I make movie later. Because there is no way Netflix gave $160 M for this B rated movie with A list actors.Scriptwise it's like torture, did a 10 year old wrote the script for this movie? Everything in the movie is just like a salad of hot mess. It looks as if director cherry picked from dozen of sci-fi movies and planted it all here withiut any direction, timeline etc. He just shoveled cut offs from stuff he'd seen and decided hey it will be ok here. Watching this mess for 2 hours was a torture on my eyes, ears and my brain had to emergency shutdown for the rest of the evening.Story +0.1
Script minus -10
Computer Animation +8
SlowMo minus -1000 like what???I want to stress about my rating, we love movies, we watch tons, we are movie buffs. I do not leave low reviews, like nothing ever lower than 5. Mostly I give 8,9 or 10. But those are movies not a salad with slowmo everything and zero story with horrific script. No its really that bad.

title: An achievement of sorts...
text: I suppose it is an achievement of sorts when Rebel Moon 2 somehow manages to be worse that the first part.The movie starts off with what can only be described as clichéd filler scenes of preparation and training for what is close to a half an hour, along with what I consider a genuine attempt to somehow convince you that the nonsensical premise of the whole thing actually has some logic to it. You begin to think maybe there is hope. And then right at the 40th minute mark (i.e. Almost the middle of the SECOND movie) a character stands up and asks that he wants to know the people he's about to fight side by side with. This in turn prompts a montage that is narrated by each character reading his or hers wiki page. That is of course in case the poor viewer has already forgotten the first movie and the fact that the same characters have already fought side by side with one another and have had the same introductions except the first time we didn't get a montage. I guess Zach Snyder knew that for part 2 WE ARE GONNA NEED A MONTAGE! Montage....After this action begins to ensue with all the tropes you can think off - from dumb evil guys being dumb and evil to the power of friendship that beats everything.Oh, and slo mo, because where would we be without it.

title: Stupid, formulaic, paint by numbers, ugly looking.
text: So, let's start with the good things.At least Snyder didn't put us up with another 4 hour "epic" as he did with his version of the justice league.But it's obvious Part 1 and 2 were supposed to be a single movie. Instead of "epic" he gave us an inflated, color by numbers, slow motion boring fest.Stealing every idea from every sci-fi movie he could, including obviously The Matrix ideas and palette, the whole Star Wars universe, and The Magnificent Seven and A Bug' s Life, Snyder fired up his video editing suite, lowered brightness until nothing could be seen, added HDR, lens flares and color, and then thought he had made a great movie. Sadly, his kindergarten-grade storytelling abilities betray him everytime he tries to direct.He could be an amazing videogame cutscene designer, or an interesting director of photography. But writing and directing? They are so above and beyond his capabiities it's not funny.

title: Refreshing movie on visuals alone
text: Theres something that you get when you watch a Zack Snyder movie, and that is a quintessentially knowing you are watching a movie that HE made, in all aspects.The visuals are stunning and visceral. The story purposefully simple. The music endearing and moving. The characters, especially Ed Skrien, not purposefully funny but somehow able to be "real" in both their terrifying portrayals and grounded takes.Is this going to appeal to everyone?No, it shouldn't either, Zack makes movies he loves, for his fans.2 hours flow by easily simple because it settles in at its own pacing, the visuals are realistic and easy on the eyes, every frame of every scene is beautiful whether you like it or not, and I wish it was longer, but I enjoyed it thoroughly.Zack also includes an understanding of various things, thought provokingly that you dont normally consider or see in other war/sci-fi movies, such as the farming on the outskirts of a outgoing war, is actually essentially for troops, the sabers cutting through air and the hilt burning your hands, are just a few of these.See this movie with open eyes, not wanting it to be like everything else.

title: What happens when you give a director power to do anything
text: Zack Snyder is an amazing director. This is a man who went from making a Kia commercial to getting a shot at directing the Dawn of the Dead reboot. From that movie to 300 I've followed this directors evolution. The DC films I enjoyed. Suckerpunch wasn't the best but it really was unique. Once he made an open ended deal with Neflix though it was too much. Just like Shyamalan with Sixth Sense he was able to basically do pet projects. M Night came out with a few stinkers until he was humbled a bit by fans. Honestly even Nolan's Tenet was just too much to be enjoyable. Ridley Scott's Napoleon was equally horrible. Now it's gonna happen but I sense it happens more often when a director is completely unrestrained. I feel between Snyder's goofy ass Army of the Dead which was a horrible mess of comedy, no edge like Dawn of the Dead to his recent terribly written and poorly cast Rebel Moon films. So cliche sci-fi world building just so bad. It like a fabulous looking gourmet meal but tastes bad and has no flavor. I mean at least add some edge to the film, some extreme violence or nudity. I mean I would expect this from JJ Abrams (except with lens flare and not slow mo). Very disappointed again with Scargiver. Some directors should explore their roots again and realize they can't always create fabulous source material from pet projects. Like what Peter Jackson did with LotR or Villanueva is doing with Dune please Zack get some awesome screen writers and build off their material. I appreciate your work Zack good luck with your future projects.

title: A Complete Misfire For Zack Snyder
text: If Rebel Moon Part One felt like Zack Snyder trying to make a self-parody, Part Two just feels like a total squandering of the talents I know he possesses with all his worst trademarks as a director on full display. The film doesn't do anything to build upon the few things that intrigued me from the first part and it just makes this whole "experience" feel like a complete waste of time in retrospect.Part One felt like a complete exposition dump to set up for this film yet the first hour is still devoted to filling in the blanks of this totally uninteresting world and characters. The dialogue is at best forgettable and at worst completely self-serious without a hint of self-awareness that made a lot of the character interactions cringeworthy more than anything. That first half was excruciatingly boring without any kind of tension building, the actual plot essentially revolves around farming grain and it's about as interesting as it sounds. When the war both these films have been building towards finally comes to ahead it feels like a relief in all the wrong ways because I was just happy to see something meaningful finally happen.When I say the second half was an improvement that's not really saying much but at least I was moderately entertained. The last hour is essentially a non-stop battle and while it can devolve into visual noise after a while at least it feels like Snyder in his element. The pacing finally picks up and there's actually a few interesting visuals on display with some genuinely entertaining sequences. But after a combined 3-hour build up I think it all came a bit too late for me. Writing really isn't Snyder's strong suit and in future I'd prefer to see him either stick purely to directing or adapting material because that seems to be where all of his best work comes from.When all is said and done, Rebel Moon represents a colossal misfire for Zack Snyder as a director. I didn't think Part One was a good movie but I had a modicum of hope that The Scargiver would give us some good pay off that would make these movies feel worthwhile. The whole thing just ends up being a massive slog and it's not nearly entertaining enough to make up for how hugely derivative it is. Rather than feeling like a complete story, this movie ends with set up for yet another sequel that I don't know if I have the energy to endure, Snyder fan or not.

title: Such a poor movie
text: A movie with very little,if any,redeeming qualities. The first one was bad,this is potentially worse. I find it incredible that studios continue to hand over huge sums of cash to Zach Snyder projects,he hasnt had a decent movie in years with 'Dawn of the dead' & '300' been probably his only good movies followed by a raft of movies flip flopping between poor & downright awful.All in all i wouldnt waste your time on this,or the original for that matter.a pair of movies that is all style over substance & where a big portion of the movie is in slow motion.its been done before & done a million times better as well.

title: Zack Snyder should stay away from writing
text: Zack Snyder should stay away from writing and storytelling.Yet another display of bad acting cringing dialogues.Too many blur effects and fisheye throughout in the movie and too many slow-motions effects. I had hoped the second part would have been better, but the story seemed to be more meaningless.Zack Snyder should not write stories and should limit himself to filmmaking or in envisioning other writers stories. Rebel Moon stands in great contrast to Dune, which is more artistically simplistic and aesthetic.I felt it to be another waste of time. I did not enjoy part II of Rebel Moon.

title: Not as bad as some of the reviews make it out to be
text: Rebel Moon - Part Two was definitely not as bad as some people make it out to be. To be frank, the first part of the movie was extremely boring. Lots of story and character building, which might intrigue some but the acting wasn't all that great. The character building was decent, but just not that entertaining.Where the movie shines is definitely the second half where the action begins. The war battles was A++ and that's where all the fun begins. There are similarities compared to the rest of the sci-fi war movies, but meh what can you do? At the end of the day, this is not Star Wars, but I wouldn't go to say this is the worst action sci-fi movie ever. Wouldn't recommend it in a theater setting, but at home? Sure.

title: wow that was bad
text: I could probably write a thesis on hiw bad this movie is but I don't feel like spending the time.When it comes to the tech and spaceships, we got better visuals in 1977 from Star Wars. That alone, with all the new film technology is a travesty.The actual movie. I'm sorry.... but a few acres of wheat grown on a "moon" is needed to feed an entire spaceship with thousands of personal? They have plasma weapons, spaceships that can enter and exit orbit but they need hand cranks for their cannons? Lets talk about the warship.... it needs to be fueled by humans shoveling a substance into a furnace like a Steam Engine? All the tech and the farmers have to farm like it's the 1700's. They can heal a near dead and broken person in a "crystalist" including having a back of the head splayed open but they can't save anyone who has been shot or stabbed?These two films are so horrible that I am shocked the plot/script managed to get approved by anyone.

title: Garbage
text: The first of these was horrible and I gave it a 3. This movie, which I was hoping would be better, is not. It deserves worse... but I'm being kind.Basically is just a crappy remake the Seven Samurai, or Magnificent Seven, if you prefer the American versions. The story is weak. The writing is horrible. I can't actually believe that this was purchased by a studio for anything. Since usually the movie is worse than the book, I can't even begin to think of goes bad the book is.Overall, the actors are good and I expected better from them. But, there is only so much you can do with a crappy script.

title: Just... doesn't cut it
text: The visual and world seem like a huge missed opportunity. Unfortunately, the movie barely holds by a thread. The scenes follow each other without much logical sense. Feels like the writing was rushed and lacks continuity. If it were a college project, it'd be fantastic. But for the production, this just falls short. If anything, it feels like a video game. Cutscene after cutscene.And to all the comments that claim that this was Schneider's compromise with the studio: Netflix's requirements for the film were set. Failing to meet those requirements and claiming the film is bad because of those requirements is a cop out.

title: Well played zach
text: Always go in with an open opinion on zach I love the way he directs yeah there's slow mo, but the guy brought this into cinema and nobody complained about 300, rebel moon 1 and part 2 have had great world building so far, unlike most movies making a franchise. I look forward to the next installment. If you love movies with a rag tag crew and a Sci fi setting look no more you won't regret it, all these low reviews are just part of the I hate zach bad wagon it's pretty sad of them. Set designs are amazing the visuals are breathtaking and the cast play there characters to the fullest, I hope you all enjoy :).

title: One star is too many
text: This was like watching a movie of a toddler telling a 3 min story for 2 hours. The slow motion is like the child saying "um" every 6 seconds. I can only assume the budget was blown solely on SFX and slow motion. Story sucks, direction sucks, and at that point you can't really blame the actors. Or can you? Someone should have been able to tell it was bad while making it.How does something like this make it to editing without a single person mentioning how dumb it is? Then, how does the editor not catch it and say, I know we're almost done but we need to start over?Gun smoke from laser guns. Sparkle dust from laser swords. Smoke from futuristic flying vehicles. Bad fake hair all the way around. It makes the new bad Star Wars movies seem really good.

title: Will give you boredom
text: Rebel Moon Part Two: The Scar giver: Will Give You BoredomMaking multiple parts to a movie before the first one even comes out, does not always work out the way directors hope. This is the case for Rebel moon, the series of movies were announced, even before the first one came out. Now, Rebel Moon Part two: The Scar giver is out, it is directed by Zack Snyder, and stars Sofia Boutella from Kingsman: The Secret Service, Ed Skrein from Deadpool, and Michiel Huisman from Game of Thrones.Kora (Sofia Boutella) goes back to her hometown; there she and the rest of the villagers prepare to fight against the mother world to keep their grain.Back in the day, Snyder wanted Rebel Moon to be a Star Wars movie for Disney. Luckily, Disney did not go along with the idea, especially since Rebel Moon is a bad movie. It is boring, and there was no reason to make Rebel Moon two or more parts.Part one of Rebel Moon was not particularly good ither, all Kora did was go to different planets, to get warriors to help fight along side the farmers. I was hoping part two would be a little better, since they would have to have a battle. Yes, towards the end there was fighting, but I do not care about any of the characters. The only two characters that had a little intrigue were the little boy and the robot. The boy, for some reason, has a connection with the girl that has a light saber looking like weapon. In part one Jimmy (Anthony Hopkins), also known as the robot, was on the wrong side of the fight. As the movie went on however, he changed sides, which was one of the only interesting things in a boring movie. In the first half of part two, I wanted to fall asleep. All they did was farm, which seems like a waste of time, especially in a movie.Snyder has made it clear that he wants to make an entire Rebel Moon universe, with six films. I find this very funny, since these two movies do not have anything in common with other good franchises, such as Star Wars or Lord of the Rings. These movies provide world building and take time to get to know the characters. Whereas Rebel Moon Part two: The Scar Giver will only give you boredom.

title: Thought it was going to be so much better than the first but again FAILED!!!
text: Thought it was going to be so much better than the first but again FAILED!!! Besides having some good action scenes this Movie was just as bad as the 1st Installment. First ENOUGH with the CONSTANT slow motion scenes. I think half of the entire movie is in slow motion or at least felt that way. The writing was once again terrible, and with so many good actors/actresses it still can't make up from the story telling of this Movie. I don't understand how you can have such an amazing cast & still come out with such a horrible film. I was very excited for both the first film & this film, but both have been a HUGE disappointment!!!! If a 3rd one gets made I'm not going to continue to waste my time watching it, and I DEFINITELY won't be watching the MUCH LONGER directors cuts to waste even more of my time!!!!

title: 🌙 if you even think for a second about the actual premise, it's an absolute Embarrassment of a film, it's utter Buffoonery 🤦🏻
text: Just got out of a Screening of Rebel Moon Part 2 : The Scargiver.This Could Go Down as one of the Most Intellectually Insulting Films ever made.🌙 - These 2 Films Premise is that a Intergalactic Empire of Huge Scale, need this Wheat 🌾 from a Small Village on a Planet called Veldt. Q. Is the Wheat Superpowered and gives you temporary Superpowers every time it's eaten, so that you can continue and make it even easier to conquer other planets? A. No it doesn't do that, it's just Regular Wheat. Q. What? That's it? Wait, Hold on a Minute....🌓 - Q. Can't this Intergalactic Empire Make other types of food? Can't they find other food sources somewhere else in the Galaxy? A. No, they can't, but there's something about that wheat though, I'm telling you.🤦🏻 - The Village has around 200 people. Q. Well that's good, should be an easy defeat if things go sour right? A. Well no, the Villagers have Better Battle Tactics, such as digging ditches underground, and making underground tunnels, so they can surprise attack the Empire. Q. What? I thought this Intergalactic Empire has Superior Weapons, Equipment, Armour, Land & Air Vehicles and Tactically Trained Soldiers? A. Yeah, but the Villagers have Pitchforks, a couple of Rocket Launchers, Some Musket Guns, Axes and Swords. Q. What? Are you joking? A. No.Do you get the Picture?More Buffoonery -🙇 - The Final Battle was Ridiculous with the Numbers and lack of numbers on the other side, and it also turned into Star Wars Point Blank Misses by Storm Troopers Stuff.🤦🏻 - The Bridge Battle with Tarak, General Titus & The Villagers was an absolute Embarrassment of a Watch. Watch the Celebration Aftermath 🎉of that battle, with the villagers holding damn Melee Weapons in their hands after beating Assault Rifled armed Soldiers. 🤦🏻🤦🏻 - Tarak is running around with 2 damn axes, whilst Red Laser Gunfire Beams are flying all around him and not a single bullet hits him? It reminded of how stupid the Storm troopers were in the Star Wars Films.😂 - It got to a point where it became an absolute Laugh of a Watch. Atticus Noble decides to destroy the grain 🌾 because Kora is there at the village? But what about all that fuss noble kicked up at the village in part 1?Things I actually liked about the film -🌌 - The Visual Effects During the Battles were Great, I really liked the shots and the choices of the framing and it looked Stunning at times, with Smoke, Dust, Lighting & Slow Motion. The Hallway Gunfire scene with kora was good and the Jump by Kora in Slow Motion with the Handgun was Great to see.👍 - The Backstorys of some of the characters, I would like to see more of that because it's actually better than this current time line.👘 - Again on the Backstorys, the Costume Designs were Eye Gazing, absolutely beautiful costumes, coupled with the gorgeous cinematography & Visual Effects.👱- So Princess issa was the one to dismantle all War Operations of the Motherworld, but Balisarius was not happy with this New Direction at All. And made Drastic Plans with Many other Nobles within the Empire. This Plot Point is so good. Is Princess issa the Key to a New Motherworld? "I Forgive You" - Did issa say that to Kora, knowing of Koras Forced Betrayal, yet also knowing the true extent of her Powers, Knowing the Pull Through and that all is not Over?🎁 - I liked the Gifts scene when the young villager girl gives Kora & her companions gifts during the party 🎉Overall, other than some of the Visual Effects and Close Shots(which I liked) in certain Scenes, the actual premise is so laughable that it turns into sheer Buffoonery. Get some drinks and some of your friends around. And there's that side of the entertainment factor.

title: It's basically Heaven's Gate in outer space
text: I was properly entertained, I must admit that. But there are so many boring scenes of the little space Irishmen dancing and singing and congratulating each other. This put me to mind of the other magnificent flop movie Heaven's Gate, which had musical and dance sequences way out of proportion to the main body of the film at hand. So many heroes and we must also sit and listen to their backstories which go on endlessly. I'm glad they didn't have a DOZEN heroes, or the movie might have been 4 hours long.The final battle was capable, though. There hasn't been quite so much slow motion since 1999 (Matrix). The battle CGI was of higher quality than some of the other places where, like the resuscitation of Noble (which looked like a Residents video, incidentally), it seemed added as an afterthought. They don't scratch film any more, you know.The plot is quite turgid and people formerly though killed keep reappearing healthy, including a princess (we learn at the end). Clearly a device to make a 3rd episode possible.It's clearly worth a watch just for all the ultimate noise and commotion. My one disappointment is that Anthony Hopkin's robot doesn't get to do a whole lot in the 4 hour runtime of the franchise. I was hoping he'd turn out to have unexpected powers or hidden secrets, but he's just another cast member of a too large cast.I will watch the next one, if it shows up. Once.

title: AMAZING!!! It was better than the last 3 Star Wars
text: I thought it was amazing a fresh new take of space sci-fi or space opera. It has an amazing plot/storyline, and the cast is literally the best chemistry I've seen in a long time. Idk how you can not like this amazing piece of art because I want more, this is what Zach Snyder does when you let him be him!!!. The man is an artist and it shows in his work, (Rebel Moon) probably won't get the love it deserves because of other people being jealous. It's nothing like star wars but still brings the same type of excitement & intrigue for the characters & and leaves you wanting more, it's a must see WATCH IT.

title: Feels like a Uwe Boll film
text: Wow! Was quite looking forward to this movie. But OMG! So slow and boring. Feels like a low budget, direct to dvd, Uwe Boll film. Really struggling to get through it after enjoying Part 1. Terrible writing, terrible directing, terrible score, terrible acting, terrible effects and so incredibly cliched. There's a semi decent story in there some where, I'm sure, but it's lost and buried deep under too much exposition and fluff. Even Anthony Hopkins' voice over at the start was horrific. The guy hasn't got the right voice for it anymore. Sounded like he was reading. Over 2 hours of your life you won't get back. Wouldn't recommend.

title: Someone tell Zack to stop using slow-motion!
text: Star Wars meets Steampunk: visually Rebel Moon Part Two is great, but nothing we haven't seen before. Actors are ok, but unfortunately the story is a predictable by-the-numbers Seven Samurai/The Magnificent Seven/Rogue One: A Star Wars Story/etc etc good guys vs bad guys flick.And the movie could have been cut down to watchable 90+ minutes if Zack Snyder wouldn't insist on using slow-motion all the time (even using slo-mo during slow moments like the harvesting scenes - oh come on!). Fortunately you can watch the movie on double speed.The ending leaves the door open for a Part Three - let's hope they don't make it.

title: This movie is the reason...
text: I will cancel my Netflix account.Look, Netflix makes a lot of great stuff. I really enjoyed Ripley as the most recent example. However we, the consumers, need to vote with our wallets and the fact that Netflix spent 200,000,000 USD on these two movies (not sure it's the exact number since I'm quoting second hand knowledge here, but it's a lot) is absurd. My mind boggles with what Netflix could have done with that money instead.Now, this movie is absolutely absurd in all ways. I've seen some people quote "amazing sci-fi action sequences" as a reason to give higher ratings but they cannot have been seeing the same movie I saw. The obsessive use of slow motion, lense glare and utter stupidity in every situation makes every action sequences a parody of itself.I loved 300, I think Watchmen is still underrated. This is a travesty of a movie, and a provocative waste of money.. Do not support this, please.

title: Rebel Moon - struggling to care
text: Zach Snyder returns in his droning sci-fi opus to once again make us all glad he was never allowed near a Star Wars movieThe first hour of this will test the patience of even the most dedicated Snyder fan boy with its endless, senseless exposition with large segments dedicated to the slow motion harvesting of cornWhen the "epic" final battle finally arrives with its bland not magnificent seven characters in place it's all flash, bang, fizzle where we're supposed to cheer when Antony Hopkins bot arrives to shoot some stuff.It also contains such ridiculous moments as the big bads intergalactic spaceship being powered by coal(?!) and an engine that has a face or somethingThe most horrifying moment comes right at the end when the audience is teased with the prospect of more adventures in the Zach Snyder Clicheaverse to comeEven it's intended audience of 14 year old boys won't be swayed by this pretentious, overlong bag of cliched garbage.

title: Awesome New Universe
text: These trash reviews don't make any sense. The hate is incoherent tbh and there seems to be a lot of fabricated hate toward Zack Snyder. Both Rebel Moon movies are really great.This is a new universe, it's all an original new plot where we have to organically learn from.I enjoyed the story, the team-building, the hardcore war action scenes and the emotional impact from their stories which also has some mystery because of course, it's a new universe, we have much to see and learn about🔥 📛I've never seen any other director being hold accountable or put under the same standards and lenses, as Zack Snyder. As soon as Zack delivers, the internet is inundated with hate opinions and critics. Nobody is expecting a perfect film because there is no such things, all movies lack in one area or another, but people lose their minds when it's Zack Snyder related. Calm down.

title: A little better on the action, but still terrible on the character side. [+38%]
text: Lately, Zack Snyder films come across as dubious, "what-if" case studies rather than entertaining popcorn blockbusters. The Rebel Moon sequel that no one except Snyder asked for, is currently streaming on Netflix. It quite seems like the next batch of bland, forgettable films that'll enter the same league as the dreadful Transformers sequels. Part Two begins with Sir Anthony Hopkins' voiceover summing up the events of the first flick in a few lines. Snyder then takes a long time detailing Admiral Noble's resurrection (yawn!) and the village of farmers going about their business of cinematically harvesting grain. Snyder (who also puts on the DOP's hat) shoots them like music videos, lens-flaring the hell out of everything. Unlike the first, the action here unfolds mostly during the day, so the dark industrial grey aesthetic is almost replaced with what looks like a dusty, twilight-hour palette.It takes exceptionally bad writing for the screenplay to focus less on what was supposed to be a "battle for grain" and turn into a Star Wars knockoff. That was already an issue with the first film, and nothing really changes here. The warriors supporting Kora in her quest to defeat Noble each get five odd minutes of a music-video-backstory, and I couldn't wait for the (long-ish) first act to just get over and move on to the action. The story arcs are terrible, the character development is bleh, and none of the performances are rousing. The film stays emotionally flat from start to finish - the stakes feel next to none, the deaths of key characters leave no impact.Again, with writing this derivative and barebones, there's nothing Junkie XL could've done to make the proceedings any better. While nothing to write home about, the set pieces in the sequel feel less choppy (a typical Netflix trait) and even the excessive slo-mo didn't bother me all that much. In 2024, the same year where Dune: Part Two exists, it'd take a beyond-superlative effort to mesmerize audiences with a colonial space-warfare story. I acknowledge that Snyder is purely a "visual" director, and his writing efforts have been atrocious for the most part, but can the man learn a thing or two from his earlier big-budget mistakes, maybe?

title: Why is Anthony Hopkins in this Movie?
text: "It's one thing to be comically inept, its another thing to be boring and tedious and its another thing to be completely derivative, cliched and unoriginal but it takes a special kind of cinematic anti-genius to bring all these things together into one movie. Luckily for us, Zach Synder has just the right combination of flawed vision and completely unjustified self-belief to pull it off."Because good Lord, this movie actually left me impressed with how bad it is.It's baffling to me how so many cinematic absent minded people give this movie anything more than a 5 out of 10. I mean really? You honestly think this sci-fi wet fart of a movie is better than the greats out there like Star Wars etc? He's literally stealing all those works and putting it in his movie!The climax of this "film" is the same climax of Return of the Jedi!And don't get me started with how absurd the sci-fi elements are with this film:A highly advanced race who has mastered interstellar travel and found ways to raise the dead but somehow still needs WHEAT for sustenance and their ships run on COAL?Yea, that makes sense...The antagonist looks like evil Lloyd Christmas from Dumb and Dumber. I've watched both movies (I'm embarrassed to even admit that) and I still could care less about all the characters due to LACK OF CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT.30 MINUTES OF POEPLE DOING NOTHING BUT HARVESTING WHEAT...IN...SLOW...MOTION...Please DO NOT make a third one Zach. You've done enough damage to your career already.I'm done,Zach, please retire...

title: Looks great but that's about it
text: Rebel Moon part II... I watched it so you don't have to.You're welcome!A few bits I took away from it in no particular order.Game of Thrones original Daario Naharris' hair cut is so bad it's distracting.Space wheat is really hard to grow, apparently.Zach Snyder loves Slo-Mo. Seriously during the second scene of slow motion scythe harvesting, I went onto IMDb where the first review I read was on about how there are so many slo-mo scenes in the film!I realised after the first hour that I didn't really know who half of the characters were or what the plot was about.Worse still, I realised that not knowing didn't bother me a single bit.I reckon AI wrote a chunk of this, if not all and if so SkyNet is a long time off.I will end on this note. If RM II was made as some kind of sci-fi parody, I think it'd be one of the funniest films ever.

title: Take away the SFX..and there's nothing left.
text: Seriously, was is Snyder thinking? 'Hey I have this new fast anamorphic lens and big sensor! Let's make some random b-roll, with the shortest depth of field and put flares everywhere. Ow yeah, let's have the lens orientation just a bit off for some shots. It ads to the already extreme distortion!'Script is so bad, far from realistic (for as far we can expect for a si-fi). Characters are simple, the cliché in several scenes is just extreme to the point that it's even irritating me.So I decided to continue watching for the SFX because those were nice ..but I did grab my laptop after 30min watch time to go edit my own video project while running this movie on the background.I'd say, don't waist 2 hours ...watch something else.

title: Anything from Zack Snyder is a flop
text: Half the movie is slow motion and the plot is just barely done. Characters are not fleshed out and seem more like they belong in a brothel from GOT. We don't ever feel like any of the character is worth liking or binding with emotionally. Everything is so robotic.Typical Zack Snyder movie - plot, characters and storyline fell short. And the CGI is below average. Feels like a Star Wars rip off.So many scenes were irrelevant to the plot. Why do we need 10 mins of farming slowmotion? Please can we all petition for Zack Snyder to never make a movie again?!!! We've had enough flops with his DC movies why now Netflix?

title: Loved it. Epic.
text: Highly recommended. Incredibly well made.The pace that grew in intensity as the movie progressed, the deeply sincere acting, the legendary music, the battles - the atmosphere and action were superb!The harvest scene is so emotional and beautifully filmed, like a short movie within the main movie.I wouldn't say it is an original plot, but then again, it is a story told in many ways that is still great to live through and the authentic costumes and the steampunk-esque spaceships were a joy to behold in this good old traditional sci-fi war movie.Great sequel to the first one, and it seems more is to come. Hooray.Jack Snyder does it again!

title: Strong Contender Ford Razzie awards
text: Worst movie I have seen in a long while. A interestelar destroyer fueled by coal? Really? That basically summarizes the technical aspectos of the movie. The script is just a rip off of 7 samurais (or the magnificent seven if You like the wéstern versión), the acting is abysmal, specially the Main carácter, her spectrum of fake emotions is infuriating.75% of the movie is in slowmotion. There is a naked conan the barbarian running around the Battlefield but somehow nobody shots him.There are so many good scripts waiting for funding and they spent 90 millons on this crap, don't waste your time.

title: What more do we want?
text: A story. A story would be nice.I don't write reviews but I read them and I've never wanted to respond to one as much as I have to half of these. So here I am, venting.I'm a Snyder fan, too. I would give my life savings to see him finish the DC Synderverse. That doesn't stop this film being an utterly empty void of nothingness.4 hours across 2 films and I literally couldn't tell you the name of a single character. Couldn't care less about any of them. Not sure why most of them are even there.It was nice to hear Anthony Hopkins voice for a second, then I just felt sad he got behind such an appalling script. I didn't even think the acting was that bad - they just barely had to do any. AI could have written better dialogue.The entire premise = when the music is atmospheric, emotion is being conveyed. No idea what about but just go with it.One star for some pretty visuals. One star for Anthony Hopkins voice.

title: Don't waste your time!
text: Don't waste your time. The second episode is full of clichés, we have in this film, the water girl with her angelic hair, the prince who needs a kingdom, a depressive swordswoman, a gladiator general, a friendly robot, the evil one that doesn't die. There are so many ideas that have already been seen in other films, that if Rambo appeared I wouldn't be surprised. Kora is a boring, depressive character, played by an actress who should go back to theater school. Always with his head down and looking up, breathing heavily even when it's good morning. He is very boring. Do not waste your time. The director made a mistake in this second film.

title: On a rainy day, I would rather watch grass grow
text: I truly enjoyed the 1st Rebel moon and thought it had potential to be excellent with the next chapter. I can't even make it through 30 min. It's poorly put together and all over the place. What happened? If you enjoyed the 1st and anticipate the same gripping story line and action with a mix of politics, don't bother- you'll be disappointed just like the rest of the reviews. I'll say this, if you adore bad movies like BATMAN starring twilight...you'll just be captivated by this atrocity. Thankfully it started raining so I can focus on actual entertainments of watching bottles fill up with rain water. Can we make cinema entertaining again? This ridiculous format towards movies isn't working these days and one would think it's such common knowledge, changes would occur.

title: This proves it
text: How much of a hack Snyder is, if it doesn't please seek help in the nearest medical center near you because you've been indoctrinated into a cult of Snyder.300 / Watchmen those are pieces of work I'll give credit for but anything more is a no go. Especially this, I'm not even sure what to write because he clearly had no idea how to write a script for either of these parts.I'm all for new universes be it modern, scifi, fantasy, whatever.. but his films here have helped decrease the chances of them getting funded anytime soon.The characters are all over the place with their bland cliche backstories which I guarantee you didn't need flashbacks for every single one.Michael Bay looks like a more competent director and all he does is explosions.

title: Enjoyable Watch
text: Absolutely enjoyed every bit of it. Can't wait for the extend cuts of Rebel Moon.You could tell they had to edit out a bunch of stuff for the 2 hours run time and this hurts some of the characters a bit as we aren't able to form an emotional connection and attachment towards them. Other than that, a 2 hours war movie and more action packed than the first installment. Lots of slo-mo but hey, actively choosing to sit down and watch a Zack Snyder movie then complain about slo-mo is like going to the beach and getting upset that there is sand. It's his thing, he does it, get over it.Can't wait to see what else can be built from this Rebel Moon universe.

title: Significantly Worse than Part One, If You Can Imagine It
text: This movie is pretty much an unwatchable bore-fest.Slower than dripping molasses. With every "action" scene filmed in even more boring slow motion.Oh, yeah the actors are good and the movie has a "look" to it, but it's also derivative and steals from every sci fi film ever made. Especially Star Wars, which this movie was supposed to be a part of. Or at least Snyder, who seems to ruin everything he touches thought it would.It was rejected. Then it was supposed to be a theatrical movie. Nope. Then Netflix got it. There's reason for this -- it sucks.Boring scenes that have nothing to do with forwarding the plot go on and on just to pad the movie's length. We have to sit through maybe a half hour of people getting carpets as gifts, with each having a story, then ridiculous meaningless dancing and then an idiotic song and as if that's not enough there's an additional segment tacked on where each person has to verbalize some jerky back story that again does nothing for the movie or story-line except to put you to sleep.It's horrible and Zack Snyder needs to be drummed out of Hollywood. He has no talent.

title: No wonder Star Wars turned him down
text: Not denying this film looks polished as does the majority of Snyder movies but just as common it lacks substance.The nods to another franchise in space with a ruling empire just makes the flaws here even more noticeable as it lacks a decent story.
