Even comparing to the sequel trilogy!The acting is sub-par at best as the main character's here are at their best in other roles as sideline characters.I would say don't bother with a part 3 but as it's Netflix and this will get a lot of views a 3rd part will follow while superior Netflix content will hit the chopping block to pay for it!Snyder needs to go back to adapting quality stories and making them watchable.

title: Too much slow motion for a single movie
text:
Well .. without the slow motion, the movie length it's about... 70 minutes... But.In the other hand, the dialogue it's dull.Not a single twist, not a single good acting...
I was really bored.The first one was ok... But this one is hard to watch... Not a single character is likeable or generates enough empathy....Of there is a continuation... I'm not going to watch it.... It's hard enough to finish this one... I'm watching it 15 /20 minutes at day... I can't tolerate more than that....An advice? Please, don't lose time with this movie... There was a lot better out there.Best regards.

title: It is true, this is a cheap Star Wars knockoff.
text: Horrible plot. Terrible acting. Weak characters. Storyline is a ripoff of Star Wars. Even has lightsaber type swords and a rebel force. Don't waste your time. I love movies and like many others hate. This one is the exception. HORRIBLE!! The last lines of the movie are silly and it leaves itself open to a part 3. I hope that doesn't happen. How much more of this can people tolerate. I also don't know why reviews are required to be so long. The movie sucks the end. I have 125 more characters so I'll tell you about my cat! My cat hated this movie. I saw a mouse in the corner watching this and the mouse walked up to my cat and put itself in my cat's mouth. Don't bother with this junk.

title: DESERVES TO BE A TRILOGY
text: Rebel moon 2: The Scargiver is an action/sci-fi bloody well done. This movie is a lesson on how to do an entertaining action/sci-fi feature.Haters may hate but this movie certainly deserves to be a trilogy.It's amazing how everyone involved has put in their ultimate best and it shows, especially the lead actress Sophia Boutella. I've seen her in a couple of action roles in the past but nothing as intense or as incredible as this. She's solidify her place as an action star to be reckoned with.Now for the movie itself, although the story is a bit thin, but everything else from the acting to breathtaking visuals and the heart pumping action at the climax (which by the way is one whole hour) is a pleasure to behold.I sincerely implore Mr. Zack Snyder and Netflix to ignore the haters and please give us the third part of this sci-fi action fest.

title: Rebel Moon fails to leave a lasting impression.
text: "Rebel Moon" presents a visually captivating world, but falls short in several critical aspects. Sofia Boutella's portrayal lacks credibility in the lead role due to her physicality, she has no muscle in her very thin frame, and would not be able to take on two bigger men in the real world, this visual issue undermines the character's believability. The film suffers from a lack of depth in character development, leaving viewers disconnected from the story. While some scenes excel in visual appeal, others fall short, contributing to an overall mediocre experience. Despite its potential, "Rebel Moon" fails to leave a lasting impression, ultimately rendering it an underwhelming cinematic venture.

title: Cheap Star Wars Rip-off
text: Rebel Moon takes place on the edge of the galaxy where rebel/resistance forces fight against a tyrannical government with weapons including laser blasters and glowing swords. The protagonist turns out to be the daughter of ruthless ruler. Sound familiar?Character and plot development were severely lacking, especially considering that Snyder had four hours across both movies to do so. The viewer is left will little-to-no emotional attachment for any character and, although the costume and special effects are impressive, they ultimately are not good enough to make up for lackluster acting and cheesy lines.

title: Snyder should stop making movies
text: I love zack's justice league.I appreciate any movies in netflix even its not so good, but at least watchable. Because we all paid netflix monthly so whenever any movie or series dropped, i appreciate it.But this. This is kinda the worst movie ever i watched recently. Totally lost respect how can a person have so tiny brain to create such big project.I wonder what did snyder hope in this stupid slow motion or those wheat or those stupid character stories? Aweness? The hell! They're all sooooo dumb! The part one, it was not good enough. But i appreciate any pretty scifi in netflix. But this? This is whole new kind of time wasting.A real dumb movie for kids who never watch any good movies all their lives. This is not art. This is ego. Please realize this before you create another mess.This is definitely down there with madame web.

title: Unrealistic
text: I stopped watching about 10 minutes into the movie because it starts out with Kora plowing a field with a horse drawn plow but then when she goes into her house the door is an automatically closing door? With also what looks like LED lighting. I know its a sci fi fantasy film and that sometimes you have to dispel belief a little but I just thought that didn't make any sense. I then read some of the reviews mostly 1or 2 stars and decided not to waste any more time. I was actually hoping it was going to be better. Maybe if I have some more time to waste I'll give it another chance. Isee some of the reviews say part 2 is better. I certainly hope so.

title: An entertaining series thus far
text: I will start this off by saying this movie has its issues and agree with some calling for Snyder to stop with the excessive use of slow motionSome additional issues I had is plotholes in the story and the lack of elaboration on some story elements. Some of the character development and dialogue was also pretty weak.Overall though I found this movie to be entertaining. Yes the first half of the movie is slow and does a lot of recapping from the first movie but I didnt see that as a bad thing. The battle was long and looked visually nice.The lack of a conclusion was honestly my biggest gripe with this film. After 2 movies with no 3rd movie approved they left a massive cliffhanger. I am guessing they did this intentionally hoping there would be enough of an outcry of support for the studio to green light another one.This is one of the main reasons I dont watch tv shows anymore as they constantly are cancelled and never finish telling the story. I wish studios would stop with this nonsense and just tell the whole story or don't bother at all. I find myself getting less interested in films overall as time moves on. If no one is going to tell a complete story then I don't want to waste my time and money on any of it.I do hope there is a 3rd movie to finish off the story but based on a lot of the reviews and the amount dislike of the movie I have seen, I would wager it wont happen.

title: Looks good but the acting is horrible.
text: Its a classic Nextflix movie.All the bad guys are white men with robots putting out hugh black fumes clouds into the atmosphere.All the heroes are mix race, asian, african and well, pretty much evry other race then white.Evry dialogue is horrible, the voices just doesent match the scence.They try putting out emotional speaches with amazing music but no, just no. I was using headphones and i litterly took them off during several scenes. It just so painfully tragic that i just couldent even lisen.Only netflix whould found a movie like this, i like Znyder but i dont understand how they pickt this actors..

title: Zack please listen
text: First things first. I have enjoyed some of Snyder's work. Watchmen to an extent and 300 to an extent. That's pretty much it. The rest of his work sucker punch, man of steel, BvS, justice league, army of the dead, and now a maybe saga of Rebel Moon. They all have the same problem. His writing sucks. The equivalent of a 13 year old smashing action figures together eating crayons. Lame, loud, and no substance. I'm done. At this point I'm pretty sure so called fans are just trolling this man and Netflix hard. A big joke. Terrible dialog, way too many back stories thrown in, not to mention over abundance of slow mo. It's a ridiculous film that trys so hard to be new but it's impossible when everything in this movie is a rip off of at least several other properties and fails to even copy and paste. Like a child cheating a test and still fails. Stop watching this Garbage. And you won't be served Garbage. P.s I canceled my Netflix.

title: Slo-mo indigestion
text: First of all : I did like the first part being fully aware of its flaws.Part 2 is made of everything that was bad in the former iteration : soulless dialogues, poor character development (Why do the evil ones have to be purely evil?) and an orgy of slow motion action scenes that are way so long that you could take a leak and come back in the same scene realizing you didn't miss anything.Everything is in this movie is predictable. I have rarely watched a movie stacked with so many action scenes while being totally bored.If you are not a Zack Snyder fan and need more reasons to hate his work, I highly recommend that you watch Rebel Moon - Part 2.I gave the first movie a 6.5 because I was entertained.This one is a 4.5 at best.

title: Epic
text: What an amazingly epic second movie! Maybe the universe has some Warhammer 40K vibes, but I don't feel that's a negative point. I loved the analogue aspects of the technology/weapons/ships ect makes it feel like a more down to earth more real science Fiction adventure, it has great characters going through the age old story of the fighting for their home and their family found or otherwise. After setting things up in the first movie, part 2 is all out battle! Absolutely zero disappointments here. Can't wait for the next one!!Not sure what's up with all the hate... if you like an adventure, epic fights and battle scenes, then you will enjoy this movie/universe!

title: Worse than the first one.
text: Regardless of disliking the first film, I wanted to give the sequel a shot, thinking maybe the conclusion of the story would somehow improve these films. I was wrong, very wrong. It is exactly more of the same. Here Kora along her companions barricade themselves in 'Veldt', Kora's home, and prepare for the attack of the Realms forces. With cringe worthy dialogue, an unbelievably annoying villain and yet again a predictable chain of events, this film flopped miserably.I am guessing both films were filmed simultaneously for there were no improvements whatsoever from the backlash of the first film. Most performances were weak and over dramatic, a lot of which in my opinion is due to the writing. I had numerous points in the film where I laughed uncontrollably while supposedly serious scenes were taking place.Kora's narrative for this entire film was to earn herself redemption for her previous actions and by doing so maybe start a new, peaceful life. That's why in her moment of truth she completely abandons her moral plans and has a change of heart. Her character was written to be a selfless hero, but to me came out as a pretentious bore.More of the same. Visually boring, bad writing and bad performances. Again, the ending is meant to set up more sequels that I believe won't happen. Not recommended.

title: Who funded this dumpster fire?
text:
You remember that kid in High School? The one that loved Star Wars and wanted to be a film maker? He might have told you about this amazing concept he had centred on Wheat? Then you totally forgot about it and he went to College to study Geopolitical Accounts of the 15th Century, with a minor in French Revolutionary Architecture? Yeah, that one.Some one gave him millions upon millions to make this absolute masterclass in plagerism (homage) and poor plot construction (use sooo muuuch slooow moooo). It's arty right? Right?!?!There is no point trying to plot this thing out, or find any semblance of even bare bones reasoning for it's barely there plot. So I'll surmise the whole thing with 'ugg men bad, woman good'Yours sincerely
A woman demanding a time machine back to 90s cinema.

title: Not even memorable enough to leave a cinematic scar.
text: 'Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver (2024)' is essentially that episode of 'Game Of Thrones (2011-2019)' season 8 where everyone sits around for an hour waiting for the Night King to arrive, followed by that episode where the Night King does arrive and there's that big battle at Winterfell, except none of the preamble is entertaining and the battle takes place in the day but is no more compelling just because we can actually see it. Following a brief recap by Jimmy the robot, the film picks up with the surviving members of the ragtag rebel crewn/ croon (see what I'm trying to do here?) arriving back on Veldt thinking they aren't in a sequel and won't have to defend the village that hired them after all. However, it soon becomes apparent that they are in a sequel and that the baddies are coming not only to take the grain they were promised but also to capture some high-value targets and likely kill everyone in the community as well. The team must prepare the farmers for the upcoming battle; the supposed 'training' mostly consists of slow-motion farming montages and one or two brief scenes that establish the farmers are somehow completely competent in the art of war despite the fact that most of them have never even held a gun (seriously, these sequences don't show anyone failing at any time, instead portraying them all as just instantly as gun-savvy as John Wick). The movie's first half culminates in a laborious scene in which the main warriors sit around a table and take turns trauma dumping their dreadfully generic backstories that are all essentially the same as each other. I don't think it's a spoiler to say that the film's second half is where its big battle finally kicks off (that's what one-and-a-half film's worth of buildup has been about, after all), and - to be fair - the skirmish itself is fairly entertaining in its own generally subpar way. That sounds like I'm hesitant to admit that it's good, but I just want to make sure I'm not making it sound better than it is. In a more competent film, it wouldn't be up to par; here, it's more enjoyable than you'd expect. Still, it struggles to balance its various elements and plays out like a string of loosely connected vignettes rather than a cohesive sequence. The characters feel like they freeze whenever they aren't on screen and there's no sense of stakes because the movie has never really done any character work (even when it thinks it's doing character work). We just don't know any of these people and the spectacle isn't spectacular enough to truly hold your attention based solely on its aesthetics alone. Like the first film, the experience is entirely inconsequential. It's empty fluff that somehow cost millions of dollars. Its incredibly limp and bizarrely vague sequel-tease ending (which, by the way, does the opposite of get you excited for a potential follow-up) feels entirely contractual and devoid of any real energy on the part of anyone involved. It's emblematic of the odd oxymoron at the feature's core: it's a passion project that seems to lack any real passion. Zack Snyder has butchered his own work here, and it's hard to see how his long-promised "director's cut" (which makes no sense considering he seems to have had full creative control from the moment Netflix got involved with him) will make any of this any better. The problems run too deep for that. This may be better than its predecessor, but it's still not good enough.

title: Painful to watch
text: Where do I start? One of the worst films I have ever seen if I went to a cinema I would have walked out. Acting, terrible might as well place few mannequins in the movie, wouldn't made any difference, the main characters have shallow and cheesy storylines. I had to sit and watch each one of them telling their life story that was exactly the same as previous one, only character has changed. The script was probably shredded first and then glued together because it just didn't make sense. Zack Snyder brought Cheesy to another level which I didn't know it was possible, the slow motion scenes lasted for almost half of the movie I found myself skipping movie forward. The technology, apparently movie is set in the future, yet they use analogue buttons and switches and the rocket engines leave trail of smoke like a Russian Volga car from the 80s, I have even seen an empire soldier contacting his superior over an analogue phone with a cable. I hope Zack Snyder will give up making movies for our sake and save the actors their shame.

title: Naah. Sorry.
text: I feel a little whiny but I really did try. I really like space epics but this isn't one I'm afraid. Sure cgi is good, it doesn't feel cheap, but the plot line is, the dialogue is so damned corny and actually makes me embarrassed at times.Like a lot have said, it is consistently predictable- and sooo much is stolen from far better stories than this one, I'm sorry. A little Star wars here and a little Trekkie refs here- and the inconsistency with which they have tried the whole steampunk vibe- no sorry. Modern weapons and sentient robots- yet they use a hand crank for cannon targeting?? Nope. Sorry- found myself doing some shopping the last half instead just to get through it.

title: Awesome
text: I don't understand the people who are complaining about both Part I and Part II. It's as though you have nothing better to do than to knock movies down simply because you do not have the capability to grasp it. From the very beginning this story has given us a whole new and expanding world different from other sci-fi worlds, and giving us a whole variety of characters to learn about, love and root for. Personally, the first part left me wanting more. The second part was action packed from the get-go. I was standing up from the anxiety of what these characters were going through, rooting for and crying for them to the end. I cannot wait to see what the third installment will bring, how the remaining heroes will fair, and how our hero will bring peace to this entire galaxy.

title: 5 Minutes of Footage Stretched to 2+ Hours of Slowmo?
text: Maybe a bit of an exaggeration, but it really did feel like Netflix paid for a feature length production and they shot an episode length story and had to figure out how to stretch it, so they just made 40% of the scenes slow motion and then went to the cutting floor for every single frame of battleground setup, grain harvesting, and contrived "moments" they could for the other 60%. I really wanted to enjoy this, but if the third movie is as bad as this one, I'll probably skip the last 3.The special effects were great, and the slow motion was cool in the context of fight scenes, but slow motion grain winnowing? Why?!?!?

title: It's really that bad.
text: It's a movie without any identity of its own as it plucks scenes from a half dozen other movies from Avatar to Serenity to Gladiator, and of course Star Wars. The costumes look like something from a high school production.The dialogue is equally bad, the kind where you feel embarrassed when someone walks in to the room and hears what you're watching. Plot? It's equally bad. At one point they are digging trenches to "surprise" the enemy?? How do trenches do that against an enemy from the sky?Then there's the endless slow motion scenes. It's an effective technique but the movie can't go five minutes without using it.And if that's not reason enough, how about a coal powered spaceship? No joke. Lol.

title: Is it this bad on purpose?
text: Does Snyder make these atrocities on purpose so he can then release a 5hr Snyder cut that makes maybe 5% more sense in b/w and adds at least 45min of slowmo montages?This movie is bad. Not fun bad. Just pure unadulterated bad.It's like they fed multiple AI writers and then had a 3rd AI writer randomly place the scenes.It's terrible. It makes no sense. There is nothing compelling that happens. The first half hour is multiple slowmo wheat harvest montages.How does this guy keep getting to make movies? If this is the script they sent out and actors read it and said oh wow I need to be in this movie. They should hire someone to slap them every time they feel the same about another movie.It's so bad. So so so so bad.

title: It's not a movie, it's just time killer
text: I think you're confusing two things together here, if you want to rate a "fun", happy and playful time, it might pass, but if you want to rate this "work" as a movie, it's just terribly bad. Not only does the script not make sense, it contradicts itself in some sequences. There's no character development to speak of, not only do they behave oddly and against their characters, it's written objectively, they just serve as tools for the next big scene. And that I think is the biggest problem with this film, you have no one to identify with, it's impossible, Mr. Director has made a moving poster for how he would imagine a sci-fi soap opera. The dramaturgy is absolutely non-existent, there was no one there to not only watch over the characters, the dialogue, but also the setting and the complexity of the scenes. The music is dysfunctional, absolutely monumental in the banal scenes, and conversely, in the powerful scenes, either weak or completely unemotional. It's sad to see the director of such a seminal pop culture film as Watchmen get to direct Rebel Moon. I hope no one gives him money for a third sequel... I don't think I can bear to see another slow-motion scene of an early-dead princess walking through a wheat field, and Mr. Snyder will be in the category of directors: hands off.

title: Not great, but definitely not bad - a decent watch
text: I would say its a solid 7/10. Nicely relates to part one. Its not Snyder's best work. But its not so bad as some of the other reviewers are making it.I didn't have much expectation from a Netflix production. But its way better than an average Netflix movie. The movie could have been way better with a big studio and production house behind it. The story is solid but again could have been much better. I heard WB turned it down. I feel it could have been a great movie series with more investments, writers, producers, dialogues, a little more touching portrayal (the story is there but lacks representation). Maybe will get to see more in the extended cut.Overall, the movie is very good in my opinion. Watching the two movies together back-to-back is better. Don't suggest listening to those giving 1 or 2 rating. They just have some personal vendetta against Snyder. Without any bias, its a solid watch without any nonsense or stupid jokes.

title: I dont know how Snyder keep getting work
text: I thought the first one was bad.........If part one was the bar it still was set below it - but damn this "movie" is horrible. I mean absolutley horrible. Now imagine if you actually went to the theater and had to pay for the ticket.People thinks its horrible and no money was exchanged (its included in the Netflix membership)Snyder was never the greatest story teller - great visually. But he could def get by. Its just got worse and worse with every movie.A friend needs to talk to him and tell him to stop making movies or at a min stop directing these turds.I feel so bad for him."Release the non-snyder cut"

title: expensive garbage
text: It was almost as dreadful as its title, a shameless rip off of "Star wars", which sank to even stealing lightsabers from that classic film.Horribly pretentious, and laughably somber at times, its only redeeming value were a few decent battle scenes, but even those were ruined by the director's tendency to suddenly slow down the action to extreme slow motion, and to linger on melodramatic shots of supposed mourning and sacrifice, which nobody really gives a damn about in a film like this.The director seemed intent on making a classic, but instead he simply revealed himself as a pretender with no original thoughts, who only understands the surface of great films and attempts to mimic them, but is incapable of pulling in the audience to actually care about the characters.A study in how to waste $166 million on worthless trash.

title: Super exhausting and boring at times
text: "Rebel Moon Part 2" attempts to carve out its own niche in the space opera genre, clearly drawing inspiration from the "Star Wars" franchise. Unfortunately, this effort falls flat, leaving much to be desired.The movie is bogged down by excessive flashbacks and backstories, which consume a significant portion of the runtime. These prolonged sequences of dialogue and drama detract from any potential excitement or engagement. Instead of building depth, they make the experience tiresome and monotonous.The main villain is a disappointing stereotype, lacking originality and depth. His character feels recycled from countless other movies, adding nothing new or compelling to the narrative. This familiarity only adds to the overall sense of redundancy.Rebel Moon Part 2 is a frustrating watch. Its attempt to emulate iconic space sagas results in a tedious and uninspired film. Save yourself the time and skip this one.

title: How can these films be made?
text: I am a teacher in Germany. I work entirely on my own, and no one can verify what I teach in class. That doesn't mean I talk nonsense, but otherwise, no one really sees what goes on. Nonetheless, I studied for this, and my teaching has a certain quality. Occasionally, the headmaster visits to assess the quality of the teaching. Then I receive a grade and can work in the future to improve. However, I wonder how someone like Zack Snyder, who repeatedly makes such disastrous films that are publicly available to everyone, still gets multimillion-dollar projects and executes them to a terribly catastrophic quality. And what does Netflix do? They throw more millions at Zack with no expectations. The second thing is that so many people worked hard on this film, only to produce crap in the end because Zack had free rein. This is just mind-boggling to me.

title: It's just bad, not even funny bad.
text: The first movie was meh, but this one is just painful to watch. If Snyder had made this movie in the 80s, it could have become been a classic. Filming this in nowaday, it's just embarrassing.This movie is so dumb that I lost a few brain cells watching it.I think this man is completely out of touch with modern filmmaking and reality in general.Natural character development - nah. Here is a table, 5 minutes and we will pour all our backstory on you.Some sort of logical military combat - pew pew. Oh, sorry. We forgot to clean up the glass on the enemy's helmet, they are completely blind. We also gave them a lot of sedatives so we wouldn't have to film them in slow motion.However, the grain harvest scene was top notch. Zack should make documentaries about farming. That is his strength.

title: It's a good movie.
text: I think it's about peer pressure. Certain influential people that seem to have been tasked with spitting on everything Snyder does have set the tone, and the entourage is following. They don't want to seem uncool.It's a good matinee movie, the way they were made once upon a time.The first part was disappointing, too messy, but this second part makes up for it. Apart from some pacing problems, it's good. The fight scenes are amazing.There were several films that failed at the cinemas, Waterworld, John Carter, but became cult classics. This one is a future classic.And I'd rather see an evolution of the Snyderverse than the commercial garbage that Star Wars has evolved into.Go, Zack, go.

title: So I actually liked the first movie haha.
text: I feel like I'm in the minority here, but I actually watched Part 1 several times. I thought it was pretty good despite all the characters coming together feeling rushed and not fully developed. It was probably a 7/10 for me. Flawed but fun.I fully expected Part 2 to pick up on character development and was genuinely excited for it. But this was truly a trainwreck. I felt frustrated the entire time having to watch it and I couldn't wait for it to end. Me being emotionally invested in the characters never happened, so when people started dying, I could honestly care less.Zack Snyder doesn't have the best track record and I truly think this cemented such a low opinion of him now that I will never be able to shake.

title: Makes 'damsel' seem like an orson Welles masterpiece
text: Wow! Netflix just have money to burn financing drivel like this.The script must have been written by A. I from 1997.Slow motion cringe .Characters that have zero charisma or personality; terrible exposition and just boring scene after boring scene.Not sure how it ended because I couldn't bear to watch it to the end.Zak Snyder needs to stop surrounding himself with 'yes-men' . How can anyone who saw this release it ??Terrible dialogue- delivered badly and not even a case of 'style over substance ' visually. It's bland unoriginal directing by someone who thinks using slow motion changes a badly shot and acted scene into art.

title: Zack Snyder has Become the New George Lucas
text: I'm sorry, but no one should write, produce, direct, and be the Director of Photography on their own movie.It seems to me that the same thing happened with Rebel Moon (both parts one and two) as happened with the Star Wars prequels. No one told Zack "NO, THAT'S A STUIPD IDEA" once during the entirety of pre-production, production, and post-production. The first movie was at least a 7 Samurai rip off. The second one didn't even have that going for it.I literally found myself watching YouTube videos while it was playing in another tab, it was that boring.The dialog was terrible. The pacing was terrible. There was character development, but that character development was so formulaic that it was almost comical. Yet, I think that what bothered me the most was the juxtaposition of sentient androids with WWII style naval guns on a SPACESHIP!I mean, what sort of civilization can build sentient androids and build faster than light spaceships and still can't build a decent targeting computer!? Who?!And the grain as a plot device!? Sure, sure, grain worked as a McGuffin in 7 Samurai, but that's because the film took place in an agrarian society! If a civilization can build robots and spaceships and has a power source capable of traversing lightyears of distance in mere days, then one would think that they'd be able to automate something as mundane as food production.I can't tell you how many articles I've read about lab grown 3D printed meat in the past few years. Not to mention the fact that you can buy Impossible Burger at the supermarket for the same price as real meat (of course, real meat would probably be twice the price without the corn subsidies...).My willful suspension of disbelief has hereby been revoked. It looked pretty though... I mean, maybe Zack should just stick to cinematography?

title: Zack Snyder tries for a Disney contract it seems
text: Unfortunately this shallow plot is even too simple for children, so I guess his go to get a Disney contract will not work out.Just having a robot that is invincible, many children that look scared when around them killing is happening - but stay unharmed and a lot of drama in slow motion with artificial emotions from a huge background orchstra ... Looking back, even as a 10 year old I sure wasnt that hmm simple to find such "thing" he calls a movie interesting.Sadly I wasted my time with this hmmm thing....Or did he just take all the money and have AI create this 2 hour CGI animation - and now he's laughing at the money giver ?That would be my only hopefull conclusion...

title: Excellent saga (don't listen to the bad reviews)
text: Kind of like "batttle beyond the stars" with a touch of Star Wars. This second helping is packed with action, great fights, lots of booms and bangs, great character development and story. You really feel for these rag tag bunch of rebels as they attempt to take back their lost kingdom from the bad guys. Finished up the first episode nicely and set us up for what's coming next. Really enjoy the intricate plot and story as it builds. A few good twists and turns to keep you on the edge of your seat. Sofia Boutella is an excellent actress and plays the main very well. She brings a lot of feeling and emotions into the story and we learn of how she became who she is as well as all the others in her close circle of warriors. If you want a good clean action sci-fi this is it. Can't wait for the next installment! No questionable content, nudity or a lot of foul language, no real gory parts but they are inferred. So safe for the kiddies. Enjoy.

title: Boring, weak plot but great visuals
text: Worse than part 1. Visually it is very good, but too many slow motions shots. The storyline is slow and dare I say boring. In many ways it views more like a draft, long harvest, drawn out group therapy (let's all try and get the audience to know us) and the obvious get ready for a big battle and who you will root for! Sadly I struggled to connect with any character. Even the base of the story I struggle with, why would a galactic empire use so much resources and give so much attention to a wheat harvest (maybe if the whole planet produced wheat! But a small village... come on). If you need something to have on in the background while you scroll TikTok, this is the film for you. Also useful if you can't sleep and need something to dull your mind.

title: Worst movie
text:
Had very high expectations, lot of money spent but no script, not engaging at all.It was slow start, I thought it will pick up pace,
Kept waiting, picked pace only at the end. They did not have to make Part 2 for the small amount of content. Either should have added more substance or should have combined part 2 and 3. I waited for this movie and it was so disappointing. If not part of unnecessary content, this should have been a short movie. If not far so many slow motion sequences, it should have been a short movie. This should have been a 30 to 45 minutes movie.I hope Netflix does not keep throwing money and has some quality control.

title: Hope you like slow motion
text: I was looking forward to part two of this story, mostly because I was hoping that it would somehow save the first one. Oh boy was I wrong. The movie is extremely slow, every ten minutes I find myself sitting with my phone scrolling on social media because nothing happens. It's not until the one hour mark that things start to move forward.Also, I really hope you like slow motion effects. The movie is just past the two hour mark in length. Without slow motion scenes it would probably barely touch 90 minutes. Yes, it's almost as if the director just discovered slow motion and has to use it everywhere.I'm not going to go into spoilers or anything, there are plenty of plot holes and tons of question marks. Basically, if you didn't like part 1 you won't like part 2. If you did like part 1 you'll most likely be disappointed of part 2. Slow, dull and uninspiring.

title: I really wanted to like it
text: This movie is a rare beast. Actors are good, CGI are good to look at, photography is superb, storyline is nothing you haven't seen before.It lacks a little something. It seemed like Zack just wanted to create a slideshow without any cohesion. At no given moment are the hero's in any sort of real danger. Bullets are raining from every corner of the screen and never connect with them. Houses explode everywhere and yet everyone is fine.Exploding tanks will decimate enemy soldiers but would only refresh the hero's with a breeze from the blast.Please Zack, don't grace us with a 'Snyder's cut' for this movie.

title: Movie is so bad they should teach it in universities
text: So badly written, so badly executed, so badly directed, so full of B category lame clichés that it is very hard to process. Hours and hours of analization would be necessary to figure out how could so many people, producers managers and CEOs let this garbage to go through and spent so much money on and advertised as something revolutionary, when it is nothing more, than a Readers Digest quality nonsense. Upon all that, even the CGI is terrible, the camera is out of focus more, than in an amateur video made on a birthday party. The story has nothing to get attached to. The characters were put together from stories we've seen million times already. Actors are very poorly directed, therefore their acting is unratable. Everything is so bad, that you would think they will at least nail something based on luck, but no, even the music is lame and mostly based on Gladiator. Absolute garbage.

title: Great movie, epic, beautiful, row and highly entertained
text: Zack Snyder's latest film is an absolute triumph! With a blend of stunning visuals, epic storytelling, and breathtaking action sequences, it delivers an unforgettable cinematic experience. From start to finish, the movie immerses you in its beautifully crafted world, leaving you on the edge of your seat throughout. The sheer scale and ambition of the project are awe-inspiring, and Snyder's vision shines through in every frame. It's a rollercoaster ride of emotions, keeping you engaged and entertained from beginning to end. And with the promise of Heavy Metal versions to come, the excitement only grows. To those who doubt Snyder's genius, this film is a definitive answer - a masterpiece that demands to be seen. So, to the haters, as the saying goes, 'su*** it, Gunntars!' Get ready for a cinematic journey like no other, because Zack Snyder has once again raised the bar.

title: The scar screecher
text: A second part even more tasteless than the first which brings nothing new with its false remake of The 7 Samurai accompanied with a lack of originality even more apparent than part 1.Snyder prefers to focus on picking grains of wheat in slow motion than refining his story and worldbuilding. Where the first one made us discover crumbs which could have given rise to a fairly interesting universe, this second part is flat, without any flavor and quickly becomes forgettable after watching it.There remain a few nice shots (especially the part with the origins of the different characters) and a fairly decent AD at times which leans towards Warhammer but all of this underused along a basic and lazy scenario.By boasting its space opera, Snyder's Rebel Moon looks a lot like its Frankenstein creature. Bloated, useless and poseur even though it doesn't have the makings.2/10.

title: pplleeaassee mmaaakkee iiiittttt ssstttooopppp
text: This film, like the one before it, takes slo-mo to ridiculous excess. It is not needed and becomes a total chore to sit through. It seems to have become Zack Snyders one-trick-pony and is really overused.If that isn't enough the first half of the movie moves at such a glacial pace nothing of any interest happens. The actors are all mediocre to bad and I didn't develop any affinity to any of them or care about any of the characters at all.Many of the plot elements make no sense at all, people have primative farming tools and advanced weapons, it's just badly thought out nonsense. Apparently this franchise was handed around and even supposed to be a Star Wars spin-off, its clear to see why nobody wanted it and I'm surprised Netflix hasn't cancelled it already.

title: Like a Ferrari without an engine
text: Looks beautiful, but once you get in it & try to start it, something is absolutely wrong. You open the hood & get back out to check - NOTHING IN THERE. So you walk away, saying 'oh well' .. THE END.An incredible movie except for the characters, the plot, the script, the pacing, character development. The kind of movie that you MUST fast forward to get through, in the hopes that what happens next might be slightly more interesting than slo-mo shots of the village people HARVESTING FRICKING WHEAT.There is absolutely no way this is the finished, final film - that the producers and studios watched, after which they said YEP, all done! NO WAY.

title: Rebel Moon 2 The somber task at hand
text: This awaited chapter in the tale of the mother world and the depradations against the galaxy and Kora's story, has been vilified for plot dialog and maligned for simple language and story telling. I find those opinions lack the insight to think about what drives these characters and that brings all this heart to the screen in a very underwhelming way at the beginning of this grim tale.And say what you will about Zack Snyder but he knows why these basic simple responses and lingering silences portray a deeper meaning other than what a undiscerning viewer cant be bothered to understand in the bigger picture. In that way he adds a nuance that many miss.These are sophisticated world killers brought down to the literal earth by the wisdom of those who cultivate it. There is no need and it would almost be insulting to do other than the best they can to face what they know better than all those around them is:Certain death.The villagers empathy and the warm bosom of this village that will stand with them against annialation touches them all and those that know death so intimately are humbled by their stolid hope.This is the emotional tone set early on that brings all together in a last bid to save all that these humble people are. Then when the dreadnsught arrives everyone knows as the viewer now knows what folly the resistance they will mount is. The killers never were in doubt from the beginning, but they steel themselves for the work at hand!Then the vision of Zack Snyder takes over. What transpires is one of his best David meets Goliath battles put to film! Full of guerilla and grey man tactics that doesn't rest on much more than human will and vast lifetimes of experience and the force be damned. Ed Skrein is an impeccable villain - as tough as they come and never to go down easy. It makes for a very satisfying resolution to this conflict in which the third film is hinted and I will be eager to see this formidable band of badasses fight for whats right,One more time.

title: Zach Snyder blows up
text: As someone who's long admired Zack Snyder's work, diving into "Rebel Moon" was an experience I was eagerly anticipating. Yet, from the opening scenes to the closing credits, I found myself grappling with a profound sense of disappointment. The expectation of embarking on another epic journey, similar to Snyder's past triumphs, quickly faded, replaced by a realization that this was not the masterpiece I had hoped for.The casting, usually a strength in Snyder's projects, felt off this time around. Despite the presence of some notable names, the performances were lackluster, failing to captivate or convey the emotional depth typically associated with his films. It was as though the actors were not fully invested in their roles, or perhaps the direction failed to extract the best from this ensemble.The narrative itself was another point of contention. Where Snyder's storytelling has often been praised for its complexity and depth, "Rebel Moon" presented a plot that felt superficial and unengaging. The storyline seemed to meander without a clear direction, leaving me yearning for the layered narratives I've come to expect from his work.Comparing this to watching a short film on Dust - an outlet I admire for its innovative and thought-provoking content - might seem like an odd juxtaposition. However, the expectation for a Netflix and Zack Snyder collaboration is naturally set at a much higher bar. Dust shorts, while entertaining and insightful, operate within the realm of independent filmmaking, often with limited resources. In contrast, a project like "Rebel Moon," backed by Netflix's considerable resources and Snyder's visionary direction, should transcend these limitations.Yet, the experience felt akin to watching one of those shorts, where the constraints are palpable, and the scope is inherently limited. This isn't to discredit Dust's contributions to the sci-fi genre but rather to highlight the disparity in expectations. From a powerhouse duo like Netflix and Zack Snyder, one anticipates a cinematic experience that pushes boundaries and sets new standards, not one that merely echoes the feel of an indie short film.In sum, while "Rebel Moon" might have had the potential to be another jewel in Zack Snyder's crown, it ultimately fell short of the mark. It's a stark reminder that even the most successful filmmakers can sometimes miss the target, leaving fans like myself in a state of reflection on what could have been.

title: Two Cliffhangers In A Row?
text: We've had some jarring cliffhangers over the years (Star Wars, Matrix series, that Hunger Game Catching Fire stunner), but two in a row? In bad movies, in a mess of a series of films? No thanks.If you were hoping part 2 was going to redeem part 1...uh, no.Zach Snyder's films look cool. No denying that. There's a following. That's indisputable.But all of his films (with him writing in particular) have story, plot and dialogue issues. This film is no different.There is so much exposition (indiscriminately dropped in) that the main story comes to a screeching halt every time. And that exposition? Stupid. Rehashed dull crap.If you have never seen the several versions of Seven Samurai, watch any of them for a better play on the central plot in this film. George Lucas and others have already plundered great Japanese film epics and retreaded spaghetti westerns to develop science fiction films hundreds of times. The modern audience is wise to this, and there is so much content out there that they can smell lame junk from the back row.There are too many coincidences, too many holes in the plot, too much lame dialogue (that some of the actors had HUGE difficulty delivering) and too many forced attempts at shock and awe.It's a shame really. The small story idea around a rogue android gone wild is given scant service and little screen time. That story, expanded upon, could have been amazing. As it stands he shows up to save part of the day, and it's telegraphed from miles away. And the voice work for the Android is not right for his part. Feels like a strange homage to C-3PO.If you finished Part I wondering why all these heroes were willing to risk their lives to rescue a backwater agricultural village on an unremarkable planet... and why an all powerful evil empire would waste resources on it... well, you're going to be seriously disappointed with the answer. Because it's a gigantic nothing burger.Usually folks stick around in an action movie to watch the bad guy get clobbered. Well, not here. The front and center space nazi (brought back from the dead twice?) gets an important part of his body cut off by the heroine. But because this is the PG-13 cut, all of that takes place off screen. So no visual confirmation that the bad guy died. Lame.And the big bad? The guy who has been giving all the orders, and brought nazi-Ned back from the dead? He never shows up. Ridiculous.One of the biggest gripes I have with Snyder's films is that there is no comic relief. They all want to be taken so seriously that there is no joy when a hero succeeds, or a villain is defeated. It becomes more about reflecting on the loss and damage to arrive at the end result. Such a bummer.And the ending? Nope. Another cliff hanger. Will there be a part 3? Please no.So cue it up, watch it, shake your head, and then go watch The Seven Samurai.

title: Zack has discovered SLO MO..
text: And that is where his director skills were accomplished.This movie is why I don't have a Netflix subscription. Unwatchable, a vegan lasagna with vegetable cheese!Time to boycott Zack. Worst ever (big budget) movie ever made has got to be Justice League...but this Rebel Moon also unwatchable.Junk dialogue, poor plot, with lots of slow-mo, Zack's post production spice of choice.Why Zack Snyder, why do you believe you are a relevant director? Get your head checked, you are waste of space in the industry, and Netflix - why do you fund junk moviemaking.I read Rebel Moon has been watched by more people than Barbie...well I could 'giggle' at Barbie but I stopped your slow mo, no action masterpiece 10 minutes in!

title: Never thought I'd see it in a movie, but, now I have...
text: While the visuals can be quite nice in places, it lacks enough plot to make it worthwhile as an overall film. It feels like so much time was wasted on unnecessary elements, most of which should have been established in the previous entry.It also suffers from the worst of Snyder's tendencies, which we all know by now, and probably should've been edited differently as the pacing wasn't great.I personally felt that the first movie should've dealt with much of the characters bonding and backstory, mainly because out of two films we barely know anything about the motives of either faction and the movie hints at a lot more under the surface, it just doesn't ever get around to telling or showing any of it.I never thought I'd see it in a movie (partly because it's not something I ever thought would be in a movie), but, slow-motion corn harvesting is that thing! Life is now complete.Overall, while it had some pretty shots and VFX, it was a lacklustre experience with too many narrative and pacing problems to move it much past the 5* mark. These last two movies are why Zack Snyder is a director that needs someone to reign him in from time to time.Snyder once said he doesn't use slow-mo that much, but this movie alone has enough slow-mo that you could play four of five action movies by other directors, and they would still have less than this one does.

title: Not epic, not engaging
text:
I haven't reviewed in a while and although this film is already ranking so low I still needed to get my thoughts out. I've liked other Snyder productions but Rebel Moon Part I was bad and part II was even worse. The first installment left such little impressions that I completely forgot there'd be a second part.Well, I thought, why not see it through to the end? (And I sure hope this is the end of rebel moon)
There is no engaging story, there are so many plot holes/nonsensical scenes and/or dialogues.Most of all, I never cared. I was never made to care for the protagonists, the village, the "heroes" and I was never made to feel fear, anger or dislike for the antagonists.A few good special effects (outnumbered by many poor ones) and the slow motion scenes were painful. The score was boring and predictable.I feel bad for a couple of actors who I assume tried their best. With such a poor script and such poor direction I'm not sure how they could've done anything different.I surely hope this is the last of rebel moon. Netflix should spend its money on more quality productions.This was not an epic story, just an epic fail.

title: Loved it
text: Fantastic movie. If you are a Zach Snyder fan you'll live it! I did. I thought the imagery was beautiful. I really enjoyed the practical effects used instead of all the CGI you see in the movies today. Some of the tropes were predictable but still enjoyable. I like Zachs world building in this movie. I can really see the influence from StarWars that this movie was originally intended to be. I can not wait for the unrated versions of both the first and second parts. I've been a fan for years and will be for years to come. The only thing that I would say that was over done was the slow motion. When there was slow motion within the slow motion I actually laughed... I was like ok now that's to much Zach. Still I love it and would recommend it.

title: If you think the first one was bad...
text: Part 2 of this movie tries to find the few good qualities of the first and makes sure to remove them for the second installment.There's really not much to see here. About 90% of the movie is one big slow-motion battle scene. More time is spent in slow motion than normal speed.Snyder is great with cinematograph and should stick to making trailers or work for national geographic. He has no skill for storytelling, and once again it shows in his movies.I'm a sucker for almost any sci-fi, but even I could barely stand to watch this.Almost no story, lazy character building, and way too long of a movie.

title: Rebel Moon 2: A Galactic Disaster
text: If you're here to find out if you should waste your time watching the second installment in Zack Snyders "epic space saga" I am here to tell you please don't waste your time because it only gets worse and here's whyRebel Moon 2 " The Scargiver " crashes and burns faster than a spaceship hitting a forcefield. With a plot as thin as space dust, viewers are left adrift in a sea of confusion and disappointment. The narrative jumps from one disjointed scene to another, leaving audiences wondering if they accidentally boarded the wrong spaceship.Cinematography? More like slow-motion overload. Every action sequence drags on longer than a black hole devouring a star, making even the most epic space battles feel like watching paint dry in zero gravity.Forced character romances feel as genuine as a malfunctioning droid, and the acting is so wooden you'd think the cast was made of recycled spacecraft parts. When characters meet their demise, it's hard to summon even a pixel of emotion - a testament to how little the audience cares about their fate.Rebel Moon 2 shamelessly pilfers elements from iconic sci-fi and fantasy franchises like Star Wars and Lord of the Rings, but instead of paying homage, it feels like a cheap knockoff sold at a spaceport gift shop. It's a failed attempt to blend epic storytelling with interstellar adventure, leaving viewers wishing they could warp-speed out of the theater before the credits roll.

title: This is not a film for the gluten intolerant
text: The Space USS Dwight D Eisenhower aircraft carrier and its full battle group was on its way (full steam) to a Space Mennonite community to demand what 50 people have harvested by hand.The onboard Cinnabon must be doing a roaring trade and crew moral heavily dependant on it, that can be the only explanation.Sound ridiculous? That's because it is ....For this to be made, it must give hope to any asylum dweller able to hold a crayon that someday they can walk a red carpet.It seems Netflix looked at what was deemed a good thing 10 years ago and said "ahhh Mr S, how blank do you want that chequebook?". Looking forward to MH370's black box, Brazil World Cups and Ebola vaccine being announced as being green lit as directors of their next three projects.

title: Zack Snyder has lost his mind.
text: This movie is ridiculous garbage. The script is stolen trash, the dialogue trash, the motivation stolen trash, the characters are stereotypical cliched copies of its betters.What possessed Snyder to produce this? Was he blackmailed by an 8 year old child into making his first draft screenplay that was written when he was 6 years old. There is No Way an adult wrote this. They have no concept of proportionality or motivation. This is not even an effective children's film because even educated children have a greater comprehensive understanding of good and bad, right and wrong, tit for tat, and just about every well known Grimm's fairy tale or Greek myths and Aesop's fables. This movie was simply unneeded. Its ONE good characteristic is the visuals. It had Snyders trademark slo mo stylization. However, it was overused and diluted its impact. Why would seeing slo motion reaping of wheat EVER be a thing? Was he paying tribute to Ridley Scott? In Gladiator, when Maximus was dying and dreamed he was walking thru the fields of wheat to get to his family. That wheat slo mo was effective. This film however....

title: bad special effects
text: Ok so apart from the long drawn out storyline where they get to know each others nonsense some of the action was pretty good but then they started using some crazy side lighting effect that covers the whole screen in a bright light like something you get from a camera lens only not if you was looking at it normally with your own 2 eyes and this was then repeated for ever blast shot in the entire movie omg what the craziness was the special effects director thinking ?Just seriously get a grip of the effects team you work with as they destroyed what might have been a good movie.Also do not take so long to make a sequel.

title: Better than I expected
text: "Rebel Moon: The Scargiver" is a visually stunning sci-fi epic with a gripping narrative and compelling characters. Directed by Jack Snyder the film transports viewers to a distant future where rebellion against tyranny is the central theme. The diverse cast of characters, delivers standout performances, bringing depth and emotion to their roles. While the film's musical score can be overly dramatic at times, and the use of slow-motion effects may feel excessive, these minor flaws are overshadowed by its strengths. With breathtaking visuals, pulse-pounding action sequences, and themes of hope and resilience, "Rebel Moon: The Scargiver" is a must-watch for fans of the genre.

title: It would make a good comedy
text: Just finished watching this movie. Imperial ships versus a single village looked cool. An axe man versus soldiers with heavy armor looks impressive too. Motivational lines never leave you wanting more. Historical flashbacks win over school lessons in history. You can even learn how to sing different kinds of songs by watching this movie.It would make a good comedy if they added more jokes to it. Sometimes it is really funny. If you watch carefully you can see a few hilarious jokes, but overal the humor parts are constantly interrupted by the unnecessary long talks. Still better than "Fallout".2 stars for trying and no more.

title: Worse than the first
text: While I might be among the minority who found Part 1 somewhat enjoyable, I can't extend the same courtesy to Part 2. As a long-time Snyder fan, I've admired his talent as a director with his distinct visual style, but unfortunately, Rebel Moon Part 2 falls victim to its dreadful script.This movie is a disaster.There are few good qualities in this chaotic mess of a film. The cast delivers reasonable performances given the material they're handed, and some action sequences showcase Snyder's prowess in that arena. Similar to Michael Bay, he knows how to handle action. However, any praise ends there.Part 2 is a tedious, uninspired, and ultimately futile mess. The first half retells what we've already endured in Part 1, with numerous scenes and flashbacks serving no purpose other than to elongate the runtime. The antagonist, whom I couldn't even summon the effort to look up, is forgettable at best, similar of Captain Phasma from the Star Wars sequel trilogy - appearing, delivering a few lines, then promptly getting beaten and bashed.There's little else to say about this film. It's a lackluster science fiction flick devoid of imagination, burdened by lackluster world-building, forgettable characters, and a narrative so unengaging you'd find more entertainment watching paint dry. It's annoying because Snyder has proven himself capable of greatness in the past. If further installments are going to be made, then they need to improve the script, because I would say I've seen better writing in Twilight.Rating: 3/10.

title: Mystery Science Theater 3000 Will Have a Heyday With This!
text: Remember those guys? Mystery Science Theater 3000's characters, famous for their late night ruthless satire with razor sharp sarcastic dub overs of some of the cheesiest sci-fi ever made. Well, they will have a heyday with the Rebel Moon movies. Part 1 was bad, but Part 2 seals the series' fate. Man, it's sooooo bad. It shows us just how far Netflix has fallen in the quality of its originals. A new low indeed. Horrible story, worsened by ridiculously bad acting, and topped off by pitiful directing. It's as if nobody who worked on it actually watched it before releasing it. And what the heck is the deal with the forced, over-used bokeh effect in most of the scenes? Trying to hide something with everything out of focus? There's not enough bokeh in the world to fix this embarrassment to the sci-fi genre. Mystery Science Theater guys, have fun with this one!

title: Underrated
text: This is not a real review, it should be understood more as a collection of impressions on the film.In my opinion the evaluation of this little saga made up of only two films is really too negative because in the end the film manages well in my opinion to build a good narrative universe in these films, for goodness sake the story has already been seen but it is a very classic science fiction story that In my opinion it is very entertaining and has spectacular special effects. Then it is true that there are also many defects, especially narrative slowness in some points and a total lack of explanation in others which make some scenes incomprehensible but if one watches it with normal expectations based on what was seen in the first film then this is the worthy heir, a good film despite its flaws.

title: Sad Waste of Cash..
text: This is pretty much my view of both Rebel Moon's- the 1st was trash but ok-ish, mainly for some decent visuals. The second compounded all the dross of the 1st and more which is quite a feat I reckon.I read in a recent interviwe the director Zack Snyder said Star Wars is so ingrained in our culture comparison is inevitable. This was pitched as a Star Wars story and passed on, thank god. Some aspects are more than lifted, simply tweaked, making this a generic space western, comitting the crime of spending millions on an often poorly acted, non-sensical, very poorly scripted and plotted pair of movies. Worst of all some of it is just plain dull- the 1st 15/20 minutes of part 2 is pathetic.Snyders's not made a decent movie since his debut Dawn of the Dead, which was a remake, when is this guy gonna give up?

title: This Is a Victorian Wedding Cake
text: So I survived it. This isn't one of the worst movies, and the visuals recommend it, but that's about it. The story simply didn't make any sense: You have a ruthless military man after just enough flour to keep his troops fed for a few days until he finds out that the moon is hiding someone he's been looking for. She grabs some soldiers to help defend the moon, and then it's their forces in opposition.There's a lot of filler in the movie. Everyone has to harvest the wheat BY HAND because the good guys need to be as anti-tech as possible (despite their weapons, their cybernetics, their spaceships, and some meds) and that slow-motion montage is followed by weapons training that takes up less time (because they're hunters, I guess, even though some of these people have no idea how to hold a rifle).There's even a section where everyone tells their background while sitting around that could have been handled by a few lines of dialog. Even the bad guy does stuff just so you'll know he's a bad guy; he's leader just because he's scary not because he's good at it.The acting is all over the place: It's usually pretty good but that's mostly because of the actors, not the direction; they take what they have and go for it. The heroine and villain, however, must have gained twenty pounds each from the amount of scenery they ate; she's sad and moody and he's just vile, but between them, they just don't take their roles above two dimensions.You just don't believe the soldiers were chosen for their training because they're just video game targets. The defenders are even worse because you see a lot of solo action rather than anyone really supporting one another; if they had, then the fight would have been a lot shorter.The visuals are awesome, however. Everything looks great, there are some iconic moments, and it's gorgeous. I love their glowy swords more than those in Star Wars, the costumes were beautiful, and the griffins against spaceships were great. I just wish the tech felt more futuristic; I love steampunk, but powering ships through coal just felt weird.In essence, this is what happens if you mashed the stories of Star Wars and Seven Samurai together and threw in elements of Jupiter Ascending. Incredible visuals, but it's missing so much else.

title: Pointless and Underdeveloped
text: Let's start with my first criticism: Pointless. This was famously Zak Snyder's attempt at making a Star Wars movie but Disney was smart enough to turn him down, so he very thinly disguised the Star Wars elements and made it anyway. So it's just bad Star Wars. But beyond that his whole new idea to freshen up the Star Wars universe? A bad Seven Samurai remake. So something that's already been done mixed a something else that's already been done. Pointless.Now saying it was Underdeveloped is a soft criticism. Snyder has his own extended cuts of these films that may correct some of the TERRIBLE pacing, but I can't see that being enough. This felt like someone shot an entire 8 Episode series and condensed it into 2 movies. And frankly, Snyder is just not a good writer. In fact, he's quite bad. I think he is a great director, he can make things look good, but this was just embarrassing at times. The battle scenes felt like a bunch of 8 year old's playing war in their back yard. So much of this movie was stuff presented as being very important with nothing to make the audience feel that way. There are cinematic cues that imply a feeling, but no information. Like all of the stuff with the robot being presented all dramatically. Who was he again? Someone who was mentioned for 3 seconds in the first movie? You can cue the music and people can gasp, but I'm still confused.Maybe I'll give em another try when Snyder releases his versions, but as it stands these two movies are just bad.

title: So much wasted potential
text: The visual effects were really good, the actors were decent, the potential for this movie was off the roof. And they wasted it all. The battles were stupid. The people were stupid. The strategies were stupid. The motivations were stupid. The technology was stupid. The economics were stupid. The politics were stupid. Everything in this story was stupid. I understand they wanted to remake Seven Samurai, but they basically took the samurai, removed their fighting skills, gave them a compulsion for overtalking and gave them stupid laser guns. And the ending was spectacularly stupid, as it was revealed that they risked everything to defend a village, when there were higher stakes involved.Even if you have no idea how to write, how difficult was it to set up a realistic battle with a military instructor. Just give the guy some money and he will tell you what they would do if they had a bunch of soldiers backed by a few tanks and several flying gunships or if they were besieged by the same and all they had were guerilla fighters. I can suspend my disbelief in the story if you show you actually gave a damn about the rest. Or you can set up really dumb scenes if you have a good story. But if you have none of those, why even try?!What is even worse, many of the events in the second part invalidated much of the first. The more I wrote in this review, the more stars I removed. I wanted to say that the naysayers were a bit harsh and it was a watchable movie, but then my brain switched back on. This wasn't even entertaining. It was boring, pretentions and overwhelmingly stupid. Agh!

title: Canned Trash
text: I found the first part watchable although hardly too good. But this was definitely worse and barely watchable. It is a mish mash of ideas from previous films with hideous writing that is extremely canned/trite and just nonsense frequently. Every character is one dimensional with no flavor. And the setup/scenario is absurd. Very advanced military characters fighting farmers which are a mix of Vikings and simpletons with some using ancient hand held weapons. Finally about 70% of the movie is simply fighting and an overdose of SFX. Netflix failed when they decided to fund, and probably with some big bucks, such a lackluster mess.

title: Just watch Battle Beyond The Stars instead.It's better in every way.
text: It's as if one could see Zack Snyder when He was young,watching the classic Six Million Dollar Man & Bionic Woman that one realizes how the slow motion scenes was an inspiration to Zack. Again like Rebel Moon part one prepare for slo-mo scenes in part two as well. Just do yourself a great favor. If you sit through Rebel Moons parts one & two,go back in time & watch Battle Beyond The Stars. It does what it takes two Rebel Moon films to do,& far better with characterizations,effects,& story that also was inspired by The Seven Samurai. And it only takes one film. Battle Beyond The Stars superior!!!

title: A bit like a Lava cake with toohpaste filling
text: Note: This review is intended to cover both parts 1 and 2 of Rebel Moon.Geez, this looked like it would be so good. So good you want to set a special night aside to watch it, switch off your phone, cuddle with your significant other, and enjoy a special treat. But it's such a huge disappointment. I went in absolutely wanting and expecting to love this. The special affects and design are gorgeous, Snyder's distinct action style is fun, if not particularly surprising anymore. But the writing...whew. What a heck of a bottleneck.Every character is unequivocally flat in the least fun way. The script could have used a massive punch-up, because the dialogue is almost entirely utilitarian. If you like one-liners or just any expression of individualistic personality from a large ensemble cast, look much farther than here. The story feels incredibly reductive. Every character looks good on a marketing poster, but what you see is entirely what you get. The movie offers absolutely nothing from its characters beyond that first impression, and it's not the actors' fault--they're just not given anything to do that provides an opportunity to show any emotional range, hero and villain alike.The story is equally one-dimensional and predictable. If you're a fan of fantasy/sci fi, there's nothing here you won't feel like you've seen a hundred times before, and what's more, it doesn't even feel like they tried. And I'm not criticizing what I see as a failed attempt at trying something new, or flipping a tired trope--I could respect a good effort. There's no impression at all that the creative team even wanted to break ground with this film. It's like they sat down to plan and said to each other, "Let's go back to basics, guys--let's write like our audience hasn't seen a science fiction film since 1960."Again, I want to stress that I went into this film biased in its favor. I wanted to find something, anything, to love about it, but just couldn't.

title: Seven Samurai in Space Scandanavia
text: If you're going to tell this story once again, have better execution. This was a very forgettable effort.I like a lot of the actors in this, but so much of the dialogue is stilted and cliched. Zack Snyder uses slow motion in action sequences like Homer Simpson uses star wipe. Two different characters do the "superhero landing", one of which is an android. I don't know how this is supposed to work, but the big spaceship appears to be coal powered somehow?On the plus side, Sky Yang wears very tight fitting shirts for most of it, and (all too briefly) none at all. I guess the giant birds were kinda cool too.

title: Loved it
text: Love it, keep them coming please.The bad reviews haha, I'm not sure what people expect them to be but I loved it for what it is, a Sci-fi entertainment movie. Well done and I'm hoping there will be more Rebel Moon movies to come. The graphics, the cast are all brilliant!!!!! I'm a little sad that some of my favs were killed off but I'm sure they will be replaced with great new characters. Jimmy/Anthony Hopkins is one of my favs, great addition to the cast. I'm excited to see where the storyline goes from here. Please hurry up and release number three and so on and so on. From an Australian fan xx.

title: Rebel yawn
text: Editor: how many slow-mos?Zack Snyder: Yes!!!!This movie would be normal length (or shorter) without all the slow-motion scenes and that probably would've been better for the pace.. who the f thinks showing someone refilling his water-bottle in slow-mo is a good idea?It makes you think: what will the Zack Snyder cut be like? 4 hours slow-motion only?Also the overly melodramatic protagonists just get me not caring for them as it's all too ... well, melodramatic and over-the-top.All this movie does is too in-your-face and wannabe. And the story is just a bit too dumb, just a star war over a farm, ridiculous.I sometimes think that some filmmakers just use such lame plots to have a reason to throw in fights, explosions and visual fx. It's not like before anymore where fx were used for world-building and immersion of a great story.Like someone wrote in a review for the first part, this movie seems like a Star Wars fan fiction of a high school nerd. This time there even was kind of a lightsaber fight, though in bad .. and they had the colors wrong, good is blue and red is evil, not the other way around. XDIf they really do more of this, I will pass. I watched the first and wasn't impressed. Now I watched this hoping it'll get better, but it didn't.

title: Another Zack Snyder disaster of a film
text:
** spoiler alert **
It's crap. Don't waste your time with it.They need to stop giving Zack Snyder money to make films. This is an absolute mess, even by his recent track record of making some terrible films. The first was bad enough but this one. Christ almighty. You can maybe give it 2-3 stars for the CGI if you manage to get through the whole film. Anyone giving it anymore needs to have a serious word with themselves. Acting is abysmal. Script is even worse than the first film. It's all over the place. One of the worst films to be released over the past few years. Nothing good to say about it. The whole direction of it, the slo-mo's, everything, just plain awful.

title: Apt Title as Watching this Left me with Mental Scars.
text: ... And so it begins, with a Monologue of bad schoolboy writing and silly names delivered by one of the finest actors of the 20th Century ( I hope he got his money up front ) Ah and so to the humble village and the gathering of Heroes. It turns out that the grain this tiny humble village produces is life or death for the Massive Empire... aww hell lets face it. This entire crapshow is awful on all fronts and no Directors cut is going to save this one. The best thing for all concerned is to let this one slowly fade into memory and hope we look back in a few years.( about 20 or so should do it ) all have a good laugh at how you don't make a scifi Epic.

title: Terrible script and characters in Magnificent 7/7 Samurai rip off
text: Well it looks good. And that's the positives over with.Everything else is rubbish. The plot is a rip off. The characters are paper thin and badly acted.Zach Snyder may make beautiful looking movies but he cannot write worth a tap.The slow mo editing is grating and predictable after a while. Style is one thing but Snyder Is a one trick pony of a director.There are far too many characters in the film for us to care about and none of them have any traits that make them interesting.If this was supposed to be Star Wars movie that got rejected, I'm glad it did. Although with what has happened to Star Wars recently, well, don't get me started.Is it too much to ask for a passable, well written movie?

title: A little LotR
text:
Riding through Rohan, somehow feeling like farming in the shire ... then like being in the tavern ... and the singing of the fellowship - sorry general ... scenery and music ... it all reminds me.A crashed ship that is able to fly ... no effort needed ...Scenes that look super familiar ...
Dialog holes, and story jumps ... horses with masks (not even their bodies were tuned with cgi) I am quite annoyed. Suddenly every one knows all villagers ... costumes are super uninspired, boring and normal ... (yes there are a few minor exceptions)And I didn't knew how long 5 days through background telling can take.Keep your suits, they seem future proof, at least by looking at this movie.But there is more ... btw: Netflix allows skipping forward, use it, skip to the sci-fi scenes.The spaceships and space sceneries are amazing. And at least there's a hovering cart at the farmers village - first tech there. The weapons look funny.

title: Zack Snyder forgot the basics
text: This movie (series) tics a lot of boxes for me before watching, a well produced sci fi epic with an original story.The problem is that script writer, Executive producer, Director and D.o.p. Zack Snyder put all his efforts on the polish and none on the thing itself. He forgot the fundamentals of storytelling.I feel nothing for the main characters. This is just a series of events with a bunch of VFX to go on top.Talk about a waste of time and money, who was this movie for Zack? Yourself? Are you happy with the result?Hopefully this is the last movie he directs and writes, he's a skilled producer and a ok cinematographer, but the directing and writing is garbage.Too bad, this showed promise, now I'm just upset.

title: Yawn.
text:
Seriously, these two movies could have been compacted into one.Starship Troopers (1997) was good in its honest subversive social commentary. Tonight's movie is lost in its attempt to be grand space opera, but suffering from repeated B-grade movie tropes and over-used stereotypes.There's nothing new here; but the worst part is mashing together so many ideas from so many great past films and not weaving them together in any meaningful way.What we get instead is a coal-powered intergalactic war-ship with a giant biological or AI head running it but major weapons targeted using hand-cranked adjustments from WW2 gunnery staff.Sure, the visuals are amazing. And the music is extremely good.Just
so
many
problems...that strangely someone made decisions to approve. Unbelievably bad Dialogue in key moments. Unrealistic actions that are obviously meant to "look cool" but ruin the story with their idiocy.Best bit: The intriguingly lost robot voiced by Sir Anthony Hopkins.

title: Was this some sort of Tax Writeoff for Zack Synder??
text: $166 Million to make both the Rebel Moon movies is just nuts.There are no big name actors commanding multi million dollar salaries.They definitely haven't spent it on the script or acting classes for the cast.Special Effects aren't groundbreaking and does it really cost that much for some people at computers to add some laserfire and explosions?Seems to me like this movie, and lots of other hollywood movies these days, are getting overinflated budgets so they can set use their own production and special effects companies to overcharge studios which in the end means us the consumer pays more.As for the movie itself, well it was a great cure for my insomnia...

title: Emotionless Action Movie
text: Part 1 was a beautiful eye candy mess of a predictable sci-fi movie. Unfortunately, Part 2 doesn't build any supporting character depth and only showcases a lack of connection between anyone worth caring about, even when they die.
