Oh, there's plenty of time to mourn them in their slow motion Bugs Bunny death scene, it's just that no one really cares while they check their phone apps in meh as the hero breathes their last gasps. Even when the stereotypical love story arises during the conflict, it feels detached and unbelievable.Overall, the story falls flat and the slow motion is very overused like a podcast stuck at half speed. At some point you're just hoping it finishes quickly like that little league game you attended where your kiddo's team got smoked, your bleachers were silent, and you happily started thinking about the traffic on your drive home if you left soon.Do I recommend it? Not really. Would I watch another episode of what looks like a trilogy? Probably, but not with haste. #Completist.

title: Stop whining so much
text:
When you know how much work they put behind a film like this, you get very annoyed when you see how people sit here and puke over the film and are rude. Stop whining so much!The story is good, the actors are good, the special effects in fantastic, the dialogue is good the movie is very entertaining. It's exciting, it's fast-paced, action, love, that is, a little bit of everything.Just because they made space movies before, why complain about this movie, it's just stupid.I think people are real whiners here👎🏻
For that reason alone, I give the film a ten.And I really hope there will be a sequel, a part three.

title: What a unbelievable waste of time and money
text: Seriously, who creates uninspired redundant nonsense like this? I see a movie with 0 original inspiration, plugged together from existing script blocks and visual paradigms. Pathetic. When I think about how much money was spent on this I get sick - just pushing through whatever promises to be mass compatible. I see a bit of Star Wars, a bit of Lord of the Rings, zero original stuff. Simple storyline which underwhelmes on all levels. This is not cinema, this is visual fast food in a culture coma. It just shows that these old people like Zack Snider should just retire and be happy with whatever they created in the past.

title: Nothing new and a foreign sun
text: Zack Snyder has made marvelous movies, but this is not one of them. Cliché after cliché in a tedious succession with virtually no imagination for plot or something else. Perhaps this movie was made for 14 years olds who have never encountered a science fiction movie combined with swords before. For anyone older, this movie can definitely not be recommended. Its length, two hours for each episode, feels due to lack of imagination, dialogue, and excess heavenly choruses instead nearly double, meaning for hours. Waste of money, material, and whatever else was needed for this movie. Infact it was so boring, that I have got difficulties to reach the required length of characters for this review.

title: Wannabe Epic
text: The premise of the movie has a lot of promise and could have been a compelling story. Unfortunately the writing does not take advantage of the stories potential. It is very clear that the story is trying for a Space Western/Star Wars/Lord of the Rings vibe but it does not know how to capture that level of depth. The characters a very shallow and lazily written. There are some good looking scenes that are cool to look at. There are way too many slow motion sequences that kill the pacing and do not serve any real purpose or help evoke any emotion. There is a lot of fluff to make the movies Look good but unfortunately that is as far as the quality goes. The telling of this story falls short of it's potential.

title: What happened to Zach Synder?
text: When did Zach Snyder go from being a A list director to making crap? RM is science fiction vomit of Star Wars, Mad Max, Lord of the rings, but done incredibly bad. Thank goodness this was streamed and I didn't pay to see this garbage in the theaters.I will say that James the robot was the best thing about this movie, and stole ever scene he was in, maybe it was Hopkins delivery of his lines, or that James was the only actually believable character in this travesty of a movie. I can actually see James the robot becoming a cosplay character. He was genuinely the best thing about this movie. All I can say is thank you for fast forward.I will give ZS the benefit of the doubt, his version of Justice League albeit 4 hours was the movie we as the consumer should have gotten the first time. RM2 had so much backstory montages, it's like this was all cut from the first movie. Which in hindsight is probably what happened. Maybe there will a Rebel Moon: Zach Snyder edition that is the original cut of the movie that makes more sense than this patchwork of science fiction trash we got so far.Would I watch it again, no. Would I recommend it to a friend, no. Am I glad I watched it, no. But...I would recommend this movie for a long flight or car ride.I may come off too harsh, but I know Synder can make great films, Army of the Dead was superb, I just wonder how handicapped he is being by the producers, these two movies could have been one, and it would have a much better flow and feel. I am honestly disappointed in the quality of pictures being made now a days. With the few exceptions such as CODA, and The Batman, we haven't had very good movies in the last 3 years.As viewers we come to movies for an escape, long format is okay, Endgame, Dune, maybe it's time the 2 hour movie format goes away and directors make the movies they want to make.Thank you for your time in reading this.

title: Should have been a series
text: They have tried to force several stories into a couple of movies that just doesn't work, all told in flashbacks that bring nothing to the story, we didn't need to know about ever characters back story, it just gets boring, its lazy from Snyder and I usually like his stuff, but this should have been Netflix series if they wanted to develop all the characters in such ways, the action scenes are good and the visuals are stunning at times as you would expect from a big budget Netflix movie, I just don't know how they keep getting it so wrong, surely someone at Netflix must watch these and opine that they are just not good enough, if you sent to the movie to see this you would be gutted.

title: Gave me chills and I loved how it went. BOOM!
text: After rewatching Rebel Moon Part 1, I was already on board for Rebel Moon Part 2. I couldn't help but be silent as I watched this, and then I couldn't help silently scream for these characters at certain times. I liked part 1, but I actually loved this one.Zack Snyder was not lying when he said this was going to an all out war movie!And, emotional parts of the film along with all these characters getting to know each other's reasons behind fighting against the dreadnought that is The Motherworld.Sofia Boutella was once again magnificent as Kora.Ed Skrein as Atticus Noble once again sends chills on my spine.The whole film was incredible! I'm ready for a Part 3 if possible.

title: I give up.
text: This was more of a rant than anything, it's not like Snyder is going to read this and take it to heart. As a director, at what point do you actually sit back and reevaluate your filmmaking? I ask this, because Zack Snyder doesn't seem to care, or even try to learn and improve from missteps - such as an over reliance on slow-motion. I say this as a viewer that always hopes for a director to turn out a good product. But aside from a few okay extended cuts, his films have been largely misses.If you are reading this, you might've already made up your mind as to whether or not you'll view this sequel. I'm just here to vent like almost everyone on the internet. The Scargiver is somehow worse than its predecessor, and also less exciting. There is a core concept that seems to be interesting despite multiple elements being lifted from properties such as Star Wars. Which makes it even worse knowing that it's squandered. Such as character development, and overall plot structure.Now, I know Zack Snyder trolls will say, "Just wait for his extended cut. That's when it gets good". Problem is, there's nothing about this "franchise" that would justify, or improve the movie to warrant an extended cut. Zack Snyder shouldn't make his name being a director that makes good extended cut - he hasn't earned it. It's just a marketing gimmick for himself and his followers. Even then, some of his extended cuts are simply 'fine'. If you can't make some sort of coherent product on the first initial cut, then you probably aren't cut out to be a director.I say this as someone who wants to see him succeed. By all accounts Zack Snyder seems like a nice man with a signature visual flare. What he needs is a good set of writers, and people to reel him in when he gets off the rails. I hope he moves on to different projects and gets his footing, but by all accounts, The Scargiver is part two in a franchise that's already exhausting.

title: Spent almost $200 mil for this pile of garbage !!!
text: Let me start with saying Snyder is one of my favorite directors and I always stand by him. I never understood why studios did not let him have full control over his movies. Watchman directors cut and Snyder Cut of Justice League are 2 of my favorite movies. I was always rooting for him to direct a SW movie. Now I understand why studios does not let directors have full control over movies. I can't believe they almost spend $200 million for this movie. First one and this one are one of the worst movies I've ever seen. Zero creativity , horrible writing , unwatchable plot , acting is subpar and directing is unbearable ! Overuse of slowmo scenes for no reason is so cringe. I got second hand embarrassment from watching some of the scenes that tried to be emotional but felt extremely forced and poor. And shame on Netflix for green lighting this project and spending 300-400 million dollar for both movies but keep canceling fantastic shows because they don't have enough viewers or they cost too much !!! Please DO NOT make any of these movies and waste our subscription money for them. Just plain horrible.

title: Worst movie I have ever watched in my life
text:
I'm a casual movie watcher with pretty low expectations. The first rebel moon was entertaining enough to me to make me excited, yes, excited for the 2nd movie. Even with all its supposed flaws, I was intrigued. So now I have to say, this is the worst fricken movie I have ever watched in my entire life. Given the world building the first movie sets up, I expected big plot points to be introduced in this one, maybe Kora meets her dad, maybe we get more development on the revolution, literally anything. The entire movie, TWO HOURS OF LIFE I WILL NEVER GET BACK is the group fighting against the general that should've died last movie. Frankly, his death back then was more satisfying instead of in this movie when he dies I just feel "thank god it's over". You can tell this movie was trying to pad out the run time too, the first half or so is just the village preparing for the battle and the preparation montage is in slow-mo every single chance it gets. No characters get any development in this movie, characters die and there is no pay off. There are no plot twists that incite any emotion except maybe in the first 5-10 minutes. I was planning on watching the third, but after this movie left me feeling genuinely upset about what I just spent my time on I don't think my curiosity can even motivate me to watch a 3rd. It's not even worth hate watching, this movie is plain boring with bad creative choices.TLDR: IF YOU ACTUALLY WANT TO ENJOY THE REBEL MOON SERIES, READ A SUMMARY OF THIS MOVIE AND SKIP STRAIGHT TO PART 3 (which I assume will be less horrendous when it comes out. I have hope)
I'm begging you, I'm being serious. I've never wrote a movie review in my entire life and this will be my first and possibly last on IMDB. I have never had a singular movie be the reason to make me drop a series indefinitely. This is the first.

title: This has to be an AI experiment
text: The only explanation I have for this incoherent mess of a scenario is that it was written by an LLM. I cannot make sense of it in any other way.It is very similar to the first part, but somehow worse. The cinematography is great. The production in general is really good. But why couldn't they pay someone to write an actual scenario for this? Is this an experiment to check if AI can replace writers? Is just Snyder taking the piss? I cannot tell, but it is actually interesting. I would like to know.Also what is this thing with the slow motion farming? Did they just give full artistic control to the AI?Anyway, I watched the second part after watching the first for the same reasons I watched the room twice. It's just too bad to skip.

title: Once again critics are just haters and criticism is being used as a biased weapon.
text: As a continuation of Part one, Part two gives to the audience what they felt was missing in p1, (which is understandable since characters' introduction wasn't finished yet) character development is here and this movie definitely strengthens every strong aspect first part had, like cinematography, score, action scenes, CGI, characters' development and the story itself, this one is more emotional, more entertaining and makes you connect more with the characters, what I'm still missing from this version is blood, but again I have to remind myself it is a PG13 version so I guess we will have to wait for the Director's Cuts to see if we get any; but overall Rebel Moon Part Two: The Scar-giver is a spectacular film that elevates the story from 1st part by being an excellent continuation and ending to this introduction of these characters.I really hope we get to see the story continue cause that ending has me totally invested!

title: Slow mo = Slow Movie
text: Yea, it's crapKora and surviving warriors prepare to defend Veldt, their new home, alongside its people against the Realm. The warriors face their pasts, revealing their motivations before the Realm's forces arrive to crush the growing rebellion.That's the plot synopsis from IMBD, mine is, Kora and the gang must fight the bad guy because he's after them again, protect the people and put war behind them.The movie is 100% better than the first, yet it's still just not good. The slow mo, sweet Jesus, ZS came out and said it is his style he loves it, fair enough, it's not for me, I personally believe some shots it can make it awesome but every action scene every few shots just slows the movie way too much, it loses the flow and becomes boring.Acting is fine, no improvement, some REALLY cool shots in this, the sky, the aesthetic itself is cool. The music can be good too.Yea hard pass, this is not a franchise I recommend, lifeless, filled with characters I really don't care for, 3/10.

title: Zack Snyder has done it again!! And I LOVED IT EVEN MORE!
text: The epicness went higher, the emotional moments went deeper, the action was on a higher level, the characters had the time to know each other better than last time, and right now, all I can truly say is, well done. This was an awesome film. Better yet, an awesome sequel to the first Rebel Moon.Zack Snyder has done it again! Made another epic Netflix film that literally stepped up it's game! Not sure what these critics or haters want so badly. Once again, they expected too much. Expectations don't help. I enjoyed both Rebel Moon Part 1 and 2 for what they were and that made me glad with what I witnessed. Another awesome Sci-Fi film this year! I gotta see Part 1 and Part 2 again! If there ever is a Rebel Moon Part 3, I'm all in! The performances were truly amazing! I gotta see them both again!

title: Store-Brand Star Wars
text: Recently, my wife and I have begun shopping at a different grocery store. While it has typically been a pleasant experience, I decided to try their store-brand version of Little Debbie's Cosmic Brownies. To my dismay, I was dissatisfied with the generic alternative and found myself wishing I had spent my time getting Cosmic Brownies instead. Unfortunately, I find myself facing an ironically similar disappointment today.Rebel Moon- Part Two: The Scargiver is director Zack Snyder's second installment in his Netflix Original space opera. Despite Part One: A Child of Fire premiering in December 2023 to unfavorable reviews, Snyder and Netflix were already well underway on Part Two. While originally intending to create a trilogy of films, Snyder found it difficult to fit his vision in a typical 2 ½-3hr runtime (an issue he had previously suffered from while directing DC Comic's Justice League) and decided to split each film into two parts. Now, at the start of a 6-part saga, the Rebel Moon universe attempts to cement itself as a sci-fi epic for the ages.Picking up shortly after the ending of Part One, we see our ragtag team of heroes regroup on Kora's (Sofia Boutella) adopted home world, the moon of Veldt. The group warns the locals of an impending attack from the Imperium, an unfortunate aftermath of their previous encounter. With only 5 days to prepare for the invasion, the team must work alongside the villagers to protect their town or die trying.Rebel Moon- Part Two is unforgivably boring. Suffering from the sins of its predecessor, Part Two cannot handle its 2-hour runtime. While Part One was entirely set-up, the sequel stretches a finale into a full 2-hour film. Unbearably tedious, scenes drag on to questionable lengths, feeling as if there was little trimming done in an attempt to fluff the films runtime as much as possible. When that failed, an egregious amount of slow-motion was unnecessarily shoehorned into every scene. Matching Part One, there are about 45 minutes worth of slow-motion, which, if they had been cut, could have easily made this film more enjoyable. Rebel Moon- Part One & Two are not strong enough to stand on their own and would have greatly benefitted from being edited down into one complete film.Basing his vision off the Star Wars universe, Zack Snyder had stripped the world of any iconic and recognizable traits but failed to replace those with any of his own original or interesting ideas. Though you can clearly see where the inspiration came from, the lack of creativity holds the series back from forming a connection with its audience. Rebel Moon introduces characters, planets, and concepts that are truly difficult to remember or distinguish, as the entire film feels as if it is just placeholder for actual fully fleshed out ideas. Boiling Star Wars down to its most generic aspects, Rebel Moon is left feeling like a movie you would see playing within another movie.While the actors do their best to salvage the situation, they are held back by elementary-level dialogue and a paper-thin script. Suffering from telling, not showing, the film continually insists upon stating exactly how the audience should perceive each character, although we have never seen any of them portrayed to have those qualities. After two films and 4 1/2 hours, none of the characters stand out, with nearly all of them being completely forgettable if they aren't present on screen.Contrary to this example, Zack Snyder truly is a talented director, but he desperately needs the guidance of a gifted writer. While he has had many successes in the past (300, Watchmen, Man of Steel) he had always worked closely with the respective writers to achieve that success. On his own, Snyder hasn't quite mastered the balance and the result is films like Rebel Moon. I do sincerely hope he continues making movies, but I hope he sees these flaws and learns from them before attempting something similar to this project.The world of Rebel Moon was hindered before it began. Clinging to the idea of creating a Star Wars film, Zack Snyder held himself back from standing out and truly creating something original. Akin to a store-brand alternative to your favorite snack, Rebel Moon- Part Two: The Scargiver delivers a bland and unappealing attempt at copying an icon.

title: A parody but not (in slowmo)
text: First of all I liked the first one. Yes, not that good but still ok until the last act. It was at first a good set up. Not the story but the step of the movie. Until the end, again.Cliché characters all around but bearable I think. I mean a movie to recrute the heroes must lead to something really good after, right?Well absolutely not. Because before going to this part two we need to go back to the part one. The end of part one lead us to a resolution that is taken away immediately, not even waiting for part two.You can skip the last act of the part one, adjusting a few things (or not) and then start this part two. Nothing of value is lost (lol).This part two is all visual (even then...) and no substance.Slow mo? Y o u g o t i t. Useless filling shot? Right. Not using the heroes that we spend one movie to recrute? Of course. Meaningful characters growth or something? Nope. A very unmotivated death, dumb even? Yes (the last one I don't care tbh). Ex machina? Nor really but close.It's close to a parody tbh, you don't need to change much to get it. Sad because I can see the potential of Rebel Moon.

title: Amazing Film!
text: I didn't think that Zack Snyder could top part one, but boy did he! Part two put part one to shame! I absolutely love part two, have watched it five times already since its release! Of course Zack Snyder's work is always divisive among the movie watchers, and people love to hate Snyder. Whenever I see crybabies online, I know it's going to be good. The stunts and action in the film were "Revenge of the Sith" level action! Amazing amazing acting from the cast, several times I was tearing up over the struggles of the story. Story was a little bit predictable, but with sci-fi films, that is usually the standard. Seeing part one and part two now makes me even more excited for the ultimate directors cut! The ultimate directors cut will be the superior version to view this film! Nothing held back, brave, and bold!

title: Terrible casting and story
text: Visually it looks great but that's where the greatness ends. Most of the casting choices were really bad. Whoever made the choice for the actor playing Belisarius should probably find another line of work. The first movie was sort of forgettable but mildly entertaining. This movie could have been 30 minutes shorter without all the needless slow motion. Anthony Hopkins must need money because there was no benefit to him taking part in this. The lead character is so unbelievable as a hero that it is distracting and she is not that good of an actress. Zack Snyder should just quietly retire and stop making movies. Enough garbage already.

title: It's no Lord of the Rings, Dune, Star Wars, and Game of Thrones
text: The biggest compliment I can give Rebel Moon: Part Two is that I didn't fall asleep this time.I have never seen a movie so desperately wanting to be not only a franchise but a Wiki fandom hotspot with its world, characters, science fiction names, etc. We have seen failed attempts at a cinematic universe before, but this is something else.The problem is that the characters and the world of Rebel Moon are not interesting. It's not original either, as you can pick up on many familiar things you have seen in other movies. It's no Lord of the Rings, Dune, Star Wars, and Game of Thrones.There is a scene where all our heroes sit around and share their backstories. After someone finishes their back story, they might as well say "OK, your turn."And when characters do bite the dust, I didn't care. You couldn't pay me to care about these guys.There is an R-rated cut for Part One and Two that Snyder is trying to drum up hype for, but I highly doubt there's a good movie somewhere on the cutting room floor. And why is there a director's cut when this is a streaming release and not a theatrical release? Why didn't they release the R-rated cuts to begin with? Because nobody is campaigning like they did for Justice League. So, people have to watch (in total) a six-hour-long movie. Why!? So stupid, lol. And bold of them to think that I am watching both films again.Zack Snyder is just like George Lucas, not a talentless hack, but he needs to stop surrounding himself with 'yes men'.

title: Trash has never looked so epic!
text: I watched this Michael Bayism with little hope, considering the first part was a disaster, but I still wanted to see how bad an expensive and so much advertised movie can be. And yep... it's really really really bad.But hey, we got some budget lightsaber action and laser guns just like in Star Wars, so who cares? Pew pew ...What else... I absolutely loved the slow motions, they allowed viewers to easily notice how bad the fighing coreography was.And the music, so good, full of emotion, I loved it! I was perfectly chosen in contrast with the poorly written dialogue and predictable plot.In the end, the one that did it for me was Leonidas's spartan participating to the action. The abs, the cape, the axe... it was all there. AUGH AUGH AUGH!Now that I've already listed all the positives, there was one big minus to this movie: the end points in the direction of another one. Please mr. Zack, don't do it! Have mercy on us!

title: Boring mess easy to hate!
text: I had hope that part two would be better than one but gosh this is like we'll have a little excitement in the first 30 minutes then proceed to have dreadful farm nonsense for way too long and not enough action till the last hour. Zack Snyder used to have some awesome movies like Dawn of the Dead remake, Sucker Punch, and Watchmen is masterful not sure about the last 4 movies even Justice League got hate until the long cut was released HBO along with Batman Vs. Superman is cheesy; just seems his movies got worse after each one and I'm pleased with the loads of hate Rebel Moon got!The action is far and between or similar to that saying the best of it is basically stolen Star Wars with a different style to it maybe that's something the creators would be proud of it cause is kinda satisfying doesn't help much though. Movies like this and Unfrosted make me glad I don't use Netflix as much as other services. Rebel Moon should've been a mini series maybe that'd be different, I'm very disappointed.

title: There's nothing more butthurt than Star Wars fans.
text:
Trounces Star Wars on every level!You name it these two films do what Star Wars has tried to do, in its many and opaquely convoluted self consumed 'episodes' (an SF soap basically) and failed at every turn to accomplish..and there has only been two iterations!!!Utterly brilliant!Engaging..involving and utterly convincing on every level..everything that SW has miserably failed at.'Don't look too closely' I was once told by a SW fan once..'That's the whole point of SW'...
I was flummoxed..why should I have to squint?Why is SW not accountable? Why does it get a 'free pass'?It doesn't deserve one, that's for sure!

title: Remarkably inept writing
text: I don't know how even mediocre writers could fail so badly at creating characters we care about at all, create any sense of proper world-building, or even create individual scenes that have any kind of meaningful development.No, this series is at this point quite obviously going to just be a collection of scenes where things sort of happen and even within that scene there's no rhyme or reason to it. Forget about a larger sense of consistency across the film. I wish I could say that Snyder at least seems to understand how to create cool action. I think at one point in time he probably did - earlier films of his like Dawn of the Dead and 300 seem to suggest he had some clue about this. I don't know what happened, because even the main battle here was frightfully dull and full of nonsense like people rushing at each other with guns so that they could... hit each other with the guns. People look on as their friends get killed about 20 feet away, at which point they rush over to help them after it's too late. Protagonists have clear opportunities to kill their enemies but simply decide not to for no reason. We discover that the ships are powered by... coal. Yes, there are rooms on the ship where people are shoveling coal into the engines. But they also have scanning technology that rivals Star Trek.These movies should have written themselves. It's a shame, because I really like Sofia Boutella but she deserves a much better franchise than this.

title: Why?
text: I watched both movies back to back. The first part wasn't particularly original, but it provided a certain level of enjoyment that was often debatable.Rebel Moon part two is something that's hard to define while staying in the realm of non-vulgar expression. If we exclude the visual aspect, already proven in the first part, everything else is subject to criticism.The hero characters are painfully basic in a failed attempt to highlight their diversity. Dialogues and remarks are obviously crafted to be dangerous and witty; but they're as hollow as dried gourds. Scenes of large-scale armed conflicts are miserably trivialized and reduced to victorious shouts reminiscent of tribal chants. The deaths of a couple of heroes are made-up to meet moral standards, and precisely because of that, instead of leading to apotheosis, they push the heroes into absurdity.Rebel Moon part I - 4 stars.Rebel Moon part II - 3 stars.Rebel Moon part III - I hope they never make it!

title: Slow, manupulative, felt nothing for any of the characters.
text:
Part 1 was sorta a fun popcorn film/episode/whatever..
Part 2 starts out sloooowww.. remains slow for 2/3rds of the movie while it tries to somehow get us invested in the characters, fails miserably (Kora's response to her companions opening up about why they fight makes me really dislike her.) and then ends with an entirely predictable and fairly boring bang.I had "Nuke em from orbit. It's the only way to be sure" running through my head right from the start of the movie so the lazy contrivance of having a few piles of grain literally protect a bunch of villagers from a well armed space force, just made it impossible to take anything in this film seriously.The timing of their "help" showing up was just the chef's kiss of stupidity.If you're on the fence about whether you need to watch this to complete the set.. don't bother.

title: Better than the reviews indicate:
text: I'm not saying this movie went and reinvented the wheel, or is a genre bending story that is good for all ages, but it is a fitting installment in this universe. The fact of the matter is, when I watched this, I wasn't looking for a heady sci di space opera. I was looking for a fun movie, and I got that. I admit the slo mo could be tedious, and the characters have minimal character work, but it's a fun time. Turn your brain off and enjoy the show. I think it is well worth it, and I would be more than happy to watch another few films in this universe if they keep building on what worked and keep improving. But yeah, this is better than reviews made it out to be by a long shot.

title: Wut?
text: The writers had to have been on drugs and had a 10 year old with them when writing this. Nothing made sense and it seemed like the writers would do a line, ask the 10 year old what would be cool, and put it in the movie without lead up or explanation, then put it in.Why would a galaxy spanning empire go to a small village for grain, then fly around to other planets then come back to this little village for bags of flour?Also, whoever put the fake beards on the actors had to have had a grudge against the actors, the beards looked SO bad to the point you couldn't get past them and watch the scene.

title: Which is worse?
text: All I can think of while watching this sequel is - Which is worse? The haircuts, the acting, or the script? It took me 5 attempts to watch this movie in full, and yet this is the only thought that runs through my mind about it. Djimon by far has the best hair of the bunch and that is the only compliment I can come up with. It's amazing to think of the money Netflix has shelled out to produce this self proclaimed "Epic". They're pot committed now, so I guess the 3rd installment is inevitable, and like any good train wreck, I'll have to force myself to watch it until the very end. I am a glutton for punishment.

title: Nothing new and exciting about it
text: Another take on the Magnificent seven saga and remakes .You can't replace the magic and the emotions that Yul Brinner and Steve Mc Queen gave to us , just moving the same theme in the future.A movie with this potential need to be original, creative and unique. Otherwise you waste money , the talent of good actors , and the time used to produce it.All guns basically shoot endless bullets and don't need to be reloaded ? Com'on .... Be real or at least pretend it .Finally I think the acting is great, the CGI is great, but the story is beyond terrible!You can't mix Star Wars, Magnificent Seven and Star Trek if you don't have a fresh take simply just don't !!

title: Terrible and extremely stupid
text: Watching this movie is wasting time; everything about it is stupid, actors are so weak as their characters. The plot is redundant and extremely shallow as if it's meant for children. There is nothing interesting at all, the plot doesn't make any sense, the story is so weak, and the characters are totally unbelievable.I wonder why they bothered to produce such low quality movie, I think that both the writer and the producer should find other jobs as clearly they don't have what it takes to produce reasonable movies.Unfortunately I can't give it zero star, I'm believe one star is very generous for such waist of time.

title: Many Critics should be eating Humble Pie right now
text: Well, if the critics and haters can for once honestly review a Snyder Movie they would have to concede and surrender the fact that the universe Building put into the first part of what clearly stands as the best Sci-fi opera of all time is very much alive and well. This movie exceeds both Dune 2 and The Creator which were both better than anything before.Having watched the original Star Wars trilogy again after the the first part of Rebel Moon, it was Nostalgia that raises them, not the storytelling, direction, Acting and cinema photography as they stand more on their groundbreaking CGI than any other key point.Snyder is a far better story teller, Director and Cinema Photographer than Lucas ever dream in an Galaxy, Hopefully Netflix realizes just how great a property they have on their hands, and hand Snyder a blank cheque to make Several more movies in this universe.

title: We could have done without this sequel.
text: Rebel Moon-Part Two: The Scargiver is another heavily CGI film with a head scratching plot and overused action scenes. I got to give it to Zack Snyder he is pretty consistent with these type of films, just not in the good kind of consistency. There are scenes in this film that seem to be ripped off straight from Star Wars. Also the multiple slow motion action shots get really tiresome after a while. This movie might have been a little bit more enjoyable if it was edited together better. Now before you start to think I'm a Zack Snyder hater I am not! I have enjoyed some of his previous work like The Watchmen or Dawn of the Dead. I feel like Netflix went all in with this movie franchise from Mr. Snyder and are now probably quickly regretting it. Rebel Moon Part Two is a sequel we did not need but got anyways. Rebel Moon Part Two gets a very low 2 stars out of 10.

title: Why did Anthony Hopkins sign up to this?
text: When you watch a Zack Snyder movie, you know what to expect.Slow motion shots, over stylised violence, slow motion shots, gritty location, slow motion shots, explosions and slow motion shots.The first one wasn't very good and this one isn't very good.Despite some attempts at tragic backstories I just don't care about any of the characters who are all pretty cliche. Ed Skrein is super annoying.You have all kinds of idiocy going on here: a guy fighting in a laser cannon battle with an axe, pound store furiosa, one dude lobbing a bunch of grenades in the open door of a moving shuttle, teaching a bunch of farmers and villagers to fight in 2 days, digging impossibly complex tunnels rigged with explosives in the same timeframe, one scene where everyone is dressed like 13th century nobility and another where they're dressed like 1920s Chicago, name your cliche relationships some kind of subplot about a coup and being framed for it, an all-hope-is-lost-oh-wait-friends-arriving-at-the-last-moment ex machina bit, lots of yelling in victory despite literally half the village being dead and yet another sequel set up.It's about flour remember.

title: Do they know it's bad?
text: Normally I wouldn't want to hate on a movie too much, knowing how many people must've worked so hard on making it. But in the case of both rebel moon movies, I see no excuse for how unrepentantly bad, corny, and poorly acted/written they are. These movies are a head scratcher for being so outrageously late 20th century era campy filmmaking. It's like they wanted to capture the magic of firefly and didn't understand anything about what made that show so fantastic. These movies are just really really bad. I regret all of the time I spent watching them.Djimon Hounsou is amazing as always in everything that he does and this movie didn't deserve him.

title: Giver me strength.
text: Sigh. I've put it off for a few weeks but unfortunately, I have to now admit defeat and settle in for Part two of "Rebel Moon" - a series that, most worryingly, nobody seems to be able to determine how many films it's planned to be spread over. That confusion is demonstrated here, with a movie that should have been the third act of the last film but is instead dragged out to two boring hours.A resurrected Atticus Noble (Ed Skrein) sets his dreadnaught on a course for Veldt. His plan is now not only to take the grain, but to capture Kora (Sofia Boutella) and present her to the motherworld, where she is public enemy number one. Titus (Djimon Hounsou) starts to teach the farmers the art of guerrilla warfare, so they can defend themselves. Kora plans to attack the ship and kill Nobel properly this time, before she does, she admits to the gang her part in the assassination of Princess Issa (Stella Grace Fitzgerald).I feel sorry for Sofia Boutella, this and "Argylle" in the same year is an unenviable double bill. To be fair, none of the problems with this film are down to her, or any of the actors really. They're all just playing boring, lifeless characters in a boring, lifeless film. To be fair, this part is a bit less of a mess than part one was. That was a mishmash of cribbed and stolen ideas. Part two is, at least, coherent by only stealing one idea. The "mercenaries teach the village to fight" plot from "Seventh Samurai". It still looks good too, with the CGI budget being put to good use and still heavily leaning into Snyder's obsession with slow motion.But I just don't care. I don't care about these tedious cliché characters or their story that I've seen done before and better. I don't care whether they die or succeed, or what they reveal about their pasts. It's all so anodyne and I hate the artifice of the "directors cuts", exploiting history for a cynical attempt to make me watch this rubbish again.This is better than the first one, and if they continue to improve at this rate, Part seven might just scrape into acceptability.

title: Ignore the low rating spam - enjoyable watch
text: I looked through a selection of the early 1* & 2 * reviews and it's odd that most come from accounts where no other reviews have been published. Suspicious.I actually watched the film and enjoyed it. It has a slightly different take on the technology of imperial fleets, with coal power, smoke and fumes, and the obvious need to feed the crew from scavenged grain. I enjoyed the back stories, the acting was fine and the battle sequences were well constructed. I was certainly rooting for the rebels.Just because someone reimagines the future of space flight and puts a different spin on it with great visuals and decent CGI there's no way it warrants a 1* or 2* anything! Absolutely crazy. Leave a review by all accounts, but review the film rather than show off your lack of intelligence or impartiality.My suggestion, ignore the reviews and give it a watch. Form your own opinion.

title: Multimillion-Dollar Ineptitude...
text: Rebel Moon 2 is the long awaited sequel to the nothing-burger that was the last movie. Zack Snyder shows that he's capable with captivating visuals and well-choreographed action sequences, but his screenwriting chops just don't cut it when he's doing a self-indulgent 'passion project' that was originally gonna be a Star Wars movie, and he takes character development as 'trivial' instead of seriously like any veteran director treats as equal priority with personal vision.Where to start with this thing? First of all, it feels like Part Two was more a threat of more-of-the-same that the last movie offered, and lo-and-behold: it pretty much is exactly that, except it's a 'pay off' to a culminate story that doesn't feel earned at all.Zack Snyder is a good director when he's got a good script to play with, but don't give him his own script. He'll lose all self-awareness and will go full blown George Lucas over his own lack of creative restraint or finesse on his own movies.Rebel Moon 2 MIGHT be potentially 'remedied' if they release an oversized cut that includes both movies back-to-back, and with extra coverage, but it'd be of little comfort for newcomers who've already heard what they need to know about the film already.This kind of film... it's a wonder Netflix said yes to this one, considering it's a blockbuster-budgeted film that didn't get a wide theatrical release (it got limited release before Netflix) to try and recoup the ridiculous amounts of money sunk into Zack Snyder's now infamous Star Wars ripoff. And they wanted this thing to be a 'franchise' comparable to Harry Potter, James Bond and the MCU, etc.Rebel Moon 2 brings closure to one of the most puzzling two-parters in recent memory, and has you wondering: is there gonna be anything else from Snyder or this 'franchise' afterwards?This is a bit of a weirdly boring movie, what with its development lacking any impact on viewers, and the abuse of the slow-motion technique hampers Rebel Moon in almost every conceivable way.This one's a 2/5 flop-sweat-maker. It's really not a well-defined movie like you'd expect from similarly high-concept directors tackling passion projects, but hey; maybe it'll inspire someone to do even better than what we got here.

title: This is complete, end-to-end awful.
text: I can't think of a way to describe how bad this is without being dramatic. So I won't. It's so bad you can't even say it's poorly directed, poorly acted and horribly written. It's not that good.The writers and director have given no care to the story, and show no attempts to entertain an audience. Its as though they were forced to make this movie and didn't care how it came out of the can.No character has any level of cohesive personality, they all walk blindly through their lives as if following a rail on a ride at a Disney theme park.Unbelievable really that Netflix released this tripe with it's name on it.

title: Magnificent Seven in Space - sort of
text: I watched the first one and felt it was okay if a little lacking for storyline and character depth. So came in without too much optimism for this but at least hopeful.Sadly, the whole movie feels incredibly flat. The storyline is essentially just a rework of The Magnificent Seven. But almost all the characters are either vapid, unlikeable or just horribly fleshed out. The big bad of the first movie returns and is equally big and bad and so comically stereotypical it feels like a monkey has written the script.There isn't a huge amount redeeming for the movie, in theory the cast is pretty heavy hitting, but hugely let down by writing, plotline and plotholes. The visuals, as you'd expect with Zach Snyder are great but visuals don't make a movie good if you're lacking substance.Overall, it's not utterly awful. It's ultimately fairly easy to watch but equally incredibly easy to forget.

title: Cringe
text: So cringe. I had to bite my tongue and refrain myself from jumping off my from my window.They want to make this like Star Wars + Lord of the Rings + Hunger Game + other 100,000 Sci-F movies out there.Gross melancholy music, generals talking like they are in Nazi army..Basically the director wanted everyone in the film to feel like they are gods or the avenger.I just cannot fathom to watch another one of this series and hope this director move away from this genre for GOOD.Save yourself, run save your time, this movie is as good as B rated flick.Don't know what the actors thought when taking the role.

title: It makes no sense
text:
It is incredibly badly written, and to think the writers guild strike.... I mean...
It is also badly directed. Zack Snyder shoud have stopped with Sucker Punch, the only really good and original film he's made.What makes no sense? This evil nazi empire coming to steal the grain from a vilage across the galaxy. Even if they're really coming for Kora, why 15 minutes of scenes and speaches for tje vilagers gathering the wheat??? Everyone knows the wheat is not the goal, the empire and the vilagers. And that amoint of wheat cannot be held as any type of leverage for an entire empire. They'd have to spend mch more worth of fuel than the wheats' worth.So no, it is not a good movie, very likely worse than part 1, I am writing this watching minute 38.....and OMG the clichéd dialogue, I threw up a little bit in my mouth every 5 minutes or so and there's 80 minites left.

title: You All Wanted Good Entertainment From Hollywood, Then You Downrate It Assuring We Won't Get a 3rd Part of this Entertaining Movie
text: And I, for one, find this very thing a massive head scratcher. Are vapid reality shows all you are looking for these days? Because that is where we are headed.While this movie won't win awards or even the applause of major reviewers, one thing it DID deliver on was entertainment. This second part of a story begun in Rebel Moon Part 1, started off slower and maybe a bit too much talking and celebrating the first win, it more than made up for it as the battle begins and continues.I loved that a simple farming community was able to destroy a major very bad and evil ruler in their world. Looking at our world today? It is easy to lose hope we can ever bring sanity back to world politics. But this movie, in its own little corner tells us that even the least of us can have hope for better days.The computer graphics were top notch. The human relationships were wonderful. Was it perfect? Of course not. But it was highly entertaining without mind numbing politics and references to hating certain people thrown in just because Hollywood can. This wonderful story was pure entertainment. It had heart. It had unity, it had great fight scenes, good cinematography, and acting.Yet most of you chose to ignore these obvious assets of this movie and hate it with every review. I don't get people today. You want entertainment, but you can't see it when it is handed to you on a silver platter. Maybe we deserve the dumbed down television and politics filled movies being spewed at us from every channel, every app on the internet. You revel in the reality shows that are taking over the apps like weeds in an unattended field.So, for those of you who hated on this movie? Enjoy your TV reality shows, your politics filled Dick Wolf shows, your growing and growing intrusion of sports proliferating when SOME of us just want fun entertainment. Obviously those of us are now in the minority. And unfortunately, we must endure the brainless TV taking over even the best apps on the internet. Whatever you do, do NOT watch Slow Horses on Apple TV. It is highly entertaining and will definitely bore you to tears!Rebel Moon Parts 1 and 2 are highly entertaining and well acted movies. Thank you Netflix for finally giving us an English language movie that was really quite good. I wish my rating could help pull up the overall ratings of these movies, but like elections, I only get one vote. I wish you all could have seen in these movies what I saw! We would have gotten a 3rd installment for it. So mind numbingly sad!

title: It's a bit w@^(<
text: It's like it wants to be firefly, mad max and Star Wars. Turns out rubbish. Also tries to be an emotional deep saga, still crap. If you're a fan of slow mo there is plenty of that. I reckon they got about a week to learn their lines acting is shocking.So much of it doesn't make se sense.not sure if the aim was to do some gender fluid rubbish but managed that. Who knew axes beats pulser/laser weapons and starship need to charge their canons. Some absolute genius script writing and all for a bit of grain. Powerful female lead my arse she can't act for sh'c but please do keep pushing that pish...

title: Boring & a trudge
text: If you want to see lengthy scenes of harvesting crops then this is the movie for you. If a society is so advanced it has hover carts to collect and transport grain but all other work has to be physical and manually carried out then I am rooting for the bad guys as these people are too stupid to survive. Baffled as to how pretentious you have to be to include this in the movie and think people either need to or would be interested in seeing it.Worst crime of the film is that it is soooooo boring though. It's now a personal challenge to watch all the way through, I am 3 days of trying and not managed to get more than an hour in yet.

title: Magnificent Seven in Space
text: Watching part 1 and ten minutes in I'm getting Magnificent Seven in Space vibes. This continued throughout the movie and thats what it is with a wishy washy kind of back story about an Empire and a Royal Family overthrown told with flashbacks.Down to earth farmers get bullied by evil space empire then warned "we will return". Defenceless farmers find an "anti-hero" hiding amongst them (not a patch on Yul Bryner) and off she goes to gather some warriors to aid their plight.Part 2 sees these warriors return (6 yes thats right I said 6 warriors) plus our Anti-Hero (that makes 7 !)who with a twist is the adopted daughter of the evil empire baddie. I wont spoil the ending but I reckon you can guess what happens.There is a lot of characterisation padding, it could have been cut down to 1 movie leave your brain in the fridge and watch it then its an okay two parter. Watching the making of afterwards makes me think they were a bit deluded and must never have heard of the Magnificent Seven.

title: They didnt even try this time. I like Snyder. 300 was great, and he will make great films again.
text: If someone wanted a lackluster girl power fantasy we already have about a million to chose from. WE ARE OVERSATURATED IN THE ALL POWERFUL FEMALE WARRIOR GENRE. As a bonus this woman is guarding the GIRL WHO IS THE KEY TO EVERYTHING. So we have the two most overused tropes of the 2020s in one film.There really isnt any plot. It just goes from trope to trope with nothing in between. I think the Empire is hungry and they need grain, and despite having robots, they can not get the slow motion grain raising technique just right.300 was an amazing film.I LOVE over the top silly sci fin films. But only when they have heart and are made with bravery and conviction. This film lacks both.

title: One of the best and most immersive cinematic experiences I've ever had. An absolutely breathtaking war movie!
text: And breathe! Whoa! In my life I have watched hundreds upon hundreds of blockbuster movies, and I can say with all confidence that 'Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver' is without a doubt one of the top three best breathtaking cinematic experiences I've ever gone through. INCREDIBLE!Firstly, this second part resolves all the issues of the first one by seamlessly integrating missing story elements. Secondly, cinematography is a remarkable upgrade, even surpassing the already impressive visuals of Part 1. Snyder has actually invented a new cinematic aesthetic!Finally, the direction of the 40-min battle sequence was nothing short of cinematic perfection. It is insanely immersive and grabs all your senses, not letting go until the end. The mesmerizing music by Junkie XL made me feel like I was on the battlefield!The ending of the movie teases more things to be explored in this one story alone in this very big and rich world. Netflix should definitely make a Part 3 to give this story and its characters a proper and satisfying ending, and then proceed to explore more stories from the world of Rebel Moon.

title: No story, no logic
text: The only good thing about this movie is the computer generated graphics, but everything else is giant mess, do NOT expect any meaningful story or even common logic.We have a human civilization spanning over many planets, capable of building massive dreadnought class spaceships and using some kind of intergalactic travel, light sabers, nukes, you name it.Yet there was one shot of the engine room and it looked exactly the same as the Titanic, massive boilers that are heated up by...COAL.So that's the level of logic you can expect for the entire movie, including the story, I'll give you one example: "Let's defend our village by putting sacks of grain in front of it, that way the enemy won't shoot us when we shoot them." OMG.I forced myself to watch through part 1 and 2, but honestly, so many times I had to take a break cause it was borderline unbearable, I may not be the smartest person but this movie was just so void of logic it completely prevented me from even believing anything.Oh and we also have some Tarzan wannabe fighting with axes while everyone else is using guns, plus for some reason he can't seem to ever find any shirt to wear.I really don't understand how this is a Zack Snyder movie...

title: Silly and unrelatable
text: Not sure how to start. I've just watched this second one having watched the first one just yesterday.The first one wasn't very good, not at all. This is one is way way worse.Lots and lots of narration and speeches, everything so over the top.Half of the movie is "heroes" posing, "heroes" fighting in slow motion and "heroes" posing in slow motion.Honestly I couldn't care less if either side (heroes/villains) won at the end. I couldn't care less if the main character died in the end.The soundtrack is in par with the rest. The only feeling it relays is that something is force fed to me. Feels like a desperate and failed attempt to make a "mark" or to be relatable.This movie is very forgetable and unrelatable.

title: Better than the first movie but not by much
text: I tried to like it but how to describe this mess of a movie. I just hate the big bloated whale submarine looking ship with the WW2 cannons, dials and knobs. It just doesn't fit in this futuristic sci-fi movie. The acting is mediocre, the scenes still felt rushed and the plot feels undeveloped. Too many flashbacks are needed to explain everything and now it's unclear where the next movie will go based on how this ended. There are still too many Star Wars rip-offs including flaming laser like blades that are colored blue, use of the term Imperium/empire for the bad guys and the rebel fleet. Sci-fi movies made like this just don't do well with audiences, add the Scargiver to that list. On the positive side, it was a bit better than the first movie but not by much.

title: The story continues...
text: Part 2 starts from where part 1 ended.. Children of fire was about getting the band together and this one is about taking the fight with the bad guys.. But i found this one better than the first one in terms of screenplay and pacing.. You'll know about some background of the characters which will make you relate with them.. But some things seem off and I'm pretty sure Snyder has saved the real elements for extended cuts which will release somewhere in second half of 2024.. Action scenes were epic and visuals were awesome this is one department where snyder is unbeatable.. My favorite shot is when we see a small house at dusk with saturn like red rings can be seen in sky, OMG that shot will stay with me forever.. Set pieces were awesome like ships and laser weapons especially lightsaber like swords with cool wooshing effects.. I mean damn.. Snyder knows exactly how to make an movie awesome.. But story could've been better.. Overall I enjoyed this one a little more than i expected there is some world building that will be picked off in part 3 and I'm interested to see how this universe will grow beyond here.. Junkie XL's score elevates the cinematic experience.. Rebel moon franchise is inspired by old western and samurai movies with taking some elements from Star Wars which is not a bad thing rather it makes this saga more awesome... I'm happy Snyder found a new home at Netflix after what happened to him at WB, and they paid price for it... Don't listen to haters and enjoy if you love straightforward sci fi action films because hate towards Snyder is biased and these fake critics and fans forcefully hate him for no reason... But again this movie could've been more better.I'm waiting to watch the extended cuts to see the full vision and finally make my final verdict.. Until then bye...

title: Another Snyder film super glossy utterly awful
text:
Words cannot express how dire this film is, within the first few minutes there's a terrible monologue recite character names that sound like most of the vowels were removed from a scrabble bag in order to sound sci fi but wait an overly dramatic 'or so they believe' enigmatic clap trap.It's 70's B movie plot and dialogue but without ANY of the B movie schmaltz that made them classics.It takes itself seriously when it shouldn't as it's terrible. It should have a RAZZIE category all of its own, The Snyder Razzie - films so terrible that only 'piping up that it's not the film you wanted to make and if you throw more money at me I will make the cut I wanted to make in the first place.... I have the footage, honest'
Snyder effectively throws talent at a wall and sees what sticks and then shouts wait... I can make it better whilst not being able to make it good in the first place.Awful, awful film.I thought one was bad but part two laughed and said 'watch this then' because it had no beer to be asked to be held.

title: Battle Beyond the Stars (1980)
text: Well, not as boring as the first half of the first movie. It is kinda the same story as the 1980 movie."Battle Beyond the Stars" (t0080421) slightly changed to be able to extend the story beyond one movie. Feels like a Scharzenegger action movie without Schwarzenegger, the iconic hero is missing in this movie.Another random girl struggles with her past and decides to fight evil. It is not cool, not iconic not worth the money. Story and actors are set for a B movie but some one gave them a lot of money and now we got this movie. I like the special effects, looks and feels like kinda steampunk, kinda Serenity (2005).

title: Please stop
text:
What da fuxk!!! Is Zack seeing this before releasing it, This is literally the stupid screenplay I have ever encountered I can't believe I am even saying this but the part 1 make more sense than this,
He hired actors and make them farm in slow motion.I am so disappointed in this movie that it takes me 3 days to finish it like seriously are we in an era where Zack Snyder make this and think of it as a huge thing he's even proud of the movie been number 3 in the world did you ask us, do we love it is the review good or bad he just don't care this is really a down for him
Bro even named this fandom menace please stop already.

title: This is bad
text: It simply does not make sense. It doesn't even make sense or maintain consistency within a 60 second action scene.Synder wrote the script, produced and directed this. Supposedly it was his "baby" that he has tried to get off the ground for a long time.But this reflects so badly on him, everything he is involved with just does not work. Yes he can direct a camera but everything else is below what I would expect from a film student.You have solid actors with zero to work with, a script that a 5 year old likely came up with the plot outline, dialogue so bad I couldn't even laugh, and his visual "style" they only thing he has got going on full display.I have no idea how he gets job, his movies are all rated average with a couple of exceptions. And those exceptions I think are more to do with marketing then skill.

title: Rebel Moon was never meant to a critical success. Accept that and you'll enjoy this movie
text: Cons:Pros:

title: Worse than the last jedi
text:
I must admit i never thought i would say this but ..yes i was wrong thinking that noone ,ever, can do a much worse movie that the last jedi. Mr. Snyder succeeded and i should say,exceptionally well. So, long live the new lord of boredom and stupidity in sci-fi movie industry.To give you some arguments for the above statement we must start with the fact the movie takes place in a world with highly advanced weaponry,medicine and FTL ships.And yet......peasant gloriously gather grains like in dark ages,one fights with a little tomahawk against armored infantry with plasma guns and the supreme achievment in movie goofs, a dreadnought class starship aims gun like WW2 battleships or subs by turning some wheels. I went to bathroom due to boredom i came back they were still aiming....i went in the kitchen to pour a glass of scotch to calm my mind....guess what ...still aiming.Beside these epic moments the movie is like this:
half movie peasants gather around, shout something then un-gather or some people (more of them or just a single person) go outside and look very concerned at the sky
a quarter of the movie some people keep motivational speeches so boring that even my dog started to howl ,which it never does...
and the last quarter of the movie the leading actress moans with different intensities like in some bad simulated sex scenes.As you see i didnt mention the fact stated by others that the so-called movie is a lame copy made of small pieces glued together from other creations. This is his smallest flaw.

title: Slow motion battles AND slow motion farming!
text: Action delivers, some good visuals, but too much slow motion at the wrong times, and unbelievable (even for science fiction) segments. I fast forwarded through some unnecessary portions.This film had a simple plot: defense of a planet required for Logisitics / food for the "bad guy" armies. Still confused how a small village cultivates enough food to become a strategic location - wasting so much manpower and equipment in a universe so large where surely there is tech to produce food? Can bring a human back to life but can't mass produce food in a lab? I get it's science fiction but come on, have some reason or explanation.Anyways, the battle scenes are entertaining, setting aside some wild notions of combat. Too much slow motion - to include farming....guess it was meant to show the band of heroes bonding with the townspeople? Never seen slow motion farming in an action movie before, definite first.Maybe third time will be a charm?

title: A new frontier of bad taste
text: A collection of cliches from all types of films, incoherently blended together: 300, Vikings, Star Wars, Foundation, Dune... the list goes on.The cast is too good for this movie, which makes me wonder what led them to agree to take part of this insanity.The lack of originality is not the main problem as there are many ways to tell similar stories, or the even the same story: small planet of regular folks rebels against the mighty galactic empire, led by the "complicated" hero with a dark past. Fine.But now add all those cliches: light sabers, AI droids, human-cyborg villain, farmers fighting trained soldiers, all the "honor" speeches, etc., and you get 2 hours of unbelievable bad taste. If that is not bad enough, the overuse of slow-motion scenes is nauseating. Why do a slow-mo of folks harvesting????With the exception of the main villain, the acting is ok, but nothing can save this script.

title: As a comedy it pretty much delivers
text:
The story is maybe very simple, but the universe is so dumb I have no words to describe the level of dumbness of it. But that's crossed such a level that with a beer or two you can have a joy watching it! Really!. Me and my wife were almost dying laughing at so many things at almost every scene of the entire movie. First part wasn't that much funny as the second one. I believe this was one of the dumbest movies ever made at this budget and yet pretending it is not a comedy.I don't want to go into too many details, many pointed out the crops as the main axis of the movie. I would say coal topic is even more hilarious. At some point you will see it in the movie. We almost died laughing when we spotted it. I asked myself "how much of coal does the ship (drednaut?) require to activate a hyper drive"? This type of questions you ask yourselves every minute or so...
Worth watching when assuming this is a comedy. Otherwise please don't.

title: Zack cooked
text: It sounds like Zack Snyder really delivered with the second installment of Rebel Moon! The praise for the film's story, characters, cinematography, and music is definitely promising. It's impressive to hear that the action sequences were so impactful and emotionally engaging throughout the film. With a rating of 8.5/10, it seems like it hit the mark for you.The anticipation for the director's cut in August adds an extra layer of excitement. Director's cuts often offer fans a deeper dive into the filmmaker's vision, so it'll be intriguing to see what additional elements Snyder brings to the table. With such high praise for the theatrical release, it's exciting to think about what enhancements or expansions might be in store.

title: Endless slow motion
text: I really wanted to like this move. Too much cinematic drama and not enough actual content. The final battle is good, but 45 mins in all they'd done is harvest wheat. This movie probably only has around 40 minutes of total footage, but they stretch it to two hours by playing 80% of the movie in slow motion. It gets really tiring.There are some good characters and impressive special effects. Netflix tried hard to make a blockbuster. But they would have been better off than just making a single movie that had decent pace, rather than two movies where they didn't have enough content to fill 4 hours.

title: Why 2 parts?
text: The first part put me to sleep after 35 minutes of laughable dialogue. I had nothing to watch on Memorial Day and started to watch Part 2. It started with a scene that made no sense to me, so I went back and watched Part 1. Then I watched Part 2 which is like "The Magnificent 7" with really bad dialogue and corny back stories for the main "good guy"characters. The only thing that makes either part watchable, is the scenery and action sequences. The main baddie is bad for no other reason than to see people suffer. He goes through a process that has already been used in one of the Star Wars movies from the second trilogy. These two films could've been really good with a better storyline and better dialogue.

title: Part 2???
text: With 166mio the most expensive Star Wars knock-off movie of Netflix in 2023 is back, this time with even more bad acting, slow-motion scenes, and amateur CGI.Not even Zack Snyder fans care to like this franchise since it is more of the same unoriginal, chaotic, and cartoonish space opera nonsense.Having to watch this is a tiresome and painful cinematic experience. Even the die-hard sci-fi fans call it "an uninspired trainwreck" - just like part I, the plot of which I already forgot.The film's success on Netflix (almost a billion viewership minutes) suggests that the streaming audiences ignore the horrible reviews (20% Rotten Tomatoes) because they are stuck to whatever the streaming service is offering them. And Netflix in return hopes to gain new subscribers to break even and offset this kind of huge investment!It is absolutely safe to not waste any time on this, skip it and instead watch or re-watch *Dune Part II* which is on the contrary a true cinematic masterpiece!

title: A pretty good Zack Snyder flick!
text: So today I finally got the chance to watch Rebel Moon: Part 2 - The Scargiver, and it was really entertaining and also worth story telling and worth a watch with really good action pack sci-fi.Sofia Boutella nailed her best role as Kora, and Ed Skrein did a solid job with his role as a villain. The first part was quite cinematic, and the second part was also action packed and cinematic you could basically tell that Zack Snyder has done his best work with every colorful cinematic experience, and with the incredible special effects.It's a good thing. I've waited this long for the second part to come out this month of April. Because I really wanted to see how it all ends. And like I said before.... Zack Snyder is the right guy for the job!10/10.

title: So stupid plot.
text: I could't watch the rest of the movie after the harvest scene. It's sooooo stupid, They harvest the wheat by hand!!! Without any machine! And the 3 day of harvest will be good enough to make some breads. And the bad guys are asking for it and doing bad things for a fist of wheat???? It's so stupid! And the plot is so bad, childish and cliché. Shame on all of you for spending that much money for a very poor and stupid scenario. And normally before releasing something like that you show it to some people. Nodoby told anything to the makers of this crap? Even the worst star wars movie is much better than this.

title: All surface, no depth.
text: I feel like Zack Snyder is very misunderstood, we keep expecting great and epic movies, that's normal based on the brands he handles, but you don't give him any favours by judging him by the same bar as other filmmakers that truly do put an effort in giving something of quality and deepness.Things you cannot expect from Zack Snyder: A good script, character development, a well paced rhythm or sense overall as a movie. BUT, it's entertaining and visually stunning. If you are aware of what Snyder can and cannot give you, you'll enjoy it. Awesome action and visuals, of course with too much color editing and slow mo, but that's just his thing.

title: Calling it "Number 2" would've been more accurate.
text: I kept count of 2 fun actions sequences involving explosions of spaceships and the dialogues can be well-written. There are solid foundations for an interesting lore lying underneath the ridiculous shenanigans, you can see potential for a better story even if the movie doesn't live up to the expectations. Those are the only positives in Rebel Moon Part 2.The main problem is Snyder spends a minimal amount of time on character development and as a result you don't care about whether or not the rebels will live to fight another day, making the battle feel insignificant in the process and actors acting like emotionless robots for 70% of the time certainly doesn't help the situation.In the midst of the visual chaos there's something weirdly amusing about watching a director try his best to make something interesting, but failling every single time. There are many death scenes, dramatic moments, inspirational speeches, constant screaming and ridiculously ellaborate action sequences with excessive amounts of slow motion. These moments aren't supposed to be funny, but I couldn't stop laughing at the imcompetente storytelling. If you plan on watching this, make sure to stick around for the funniest cliffhanger in movie history.If you're looking for a guilty pleasure to entertain you for two hours, you won't be dissapointed. It's entertaining for all the wrong reasons tho. Once the numbers for this sequel show a gradual decline in viewership and popularity compared to the original, The streaming giant will think twice before giving Zack Snyder full creative control over anything. A franchise with 6 movies? I doubt it.

title: Let him make a 3rd
text: So I held off watching REBEL MOON part 2 till I had a day off and I could watch part 1 ( for about the 4th time ) and then put part 2 straight on after. Iv seen and heard a lot of mix reviews about but part 2 but I absolutely loved it. I really like what Snyder is making with this universe. I feel it's a good Sci-fi story and visually for me Snyder hits it out the park ( as normal ). The 2nd part picks up right after the events of part 1 and builds on the story. Sofia Boutella is a brilliant strong lead. The supporting cast all deliver as well. I'm so glad I waited till I could watch both films in one sitting. I really hope Netflix greenlight a 3rd. I know Snyder wants to make 6 films in total, I would love this to happen. There is even talk of an anime series as well as graphic novels. I'm totally on board for it all 10/10 for me.

title: it's worse than part 1
text:
In part 1 there was no story, no characters action was depressing because of slow mo in part 2 just doubled that what I just said, I was bored out of my mind.And the character history was same ,"You see, I used to be in a nice place and then mean people came and I was sad cause my loved ones died and now I'm in this village defending grain"
also it was reading like a wikipedia entries.Its pretentious, boring, ai written, soundtrack which got worse, there was no story like it was written by 12 year old. The whole idea of big empire coming for grain to small village farmers like wtf
Overall no plot, blank characters, boring sci fic
0 out of 10.

title: Star Wars The Musical Disney
text: Half of the movie is in slow motion, put Zack Snyder in prison. The bad guys' costumes are like World War II uniforms. The costumes of the good peasants are like those of the Mormon community. Nothing makes sense. The soundtrack is infuriating. Zack Snyder has ruined Star Wars twice. It's an insult to true Star Wars fans.If Zack Snyder has a license to make films, they should take it away for malpractice.If you couldn't resist seeing it to find out what it was about, then you will do everything possible to forget it forever.The Walt Disney Company ruins culture once again.Finally, a waste of budget and acting talent.

title: I feel nothing or care about movie.
text:
I hate say this but why and how actor and actress doesn't not just read script first then accept offer to be in movie? Because they are lazy or want be in slow mo scene.I just can't understand how this movie just got green light from Netflix? Rebel Moon part 1 was literally bad and as for Part 2 same thing. I feel nothing about character, story motivation, revenge above all of them in movie. I only wish the movie had more focus writing good quality story then on ridiculous slow mo scene
Movies is about emotion from as us human to get hype, happy, angry and sad.Last part I want to say this, Zack, please stop writing story or screenplay. Just focus only on director.

title: Should have been a 30 minute movie
text: I enjoyed Part I, but this movie was a bloated mess. If you delete all the filler, you have about 25-30 minutes of worthwhile movie.I found the acting by the 2 main characters, Sofia and Djimon, to be mediocre--a definite falloff from Part I--where they showed enthusiasm and commitment to their roles . Maybe they knew this was a bloated mess and lost their enthusiasm.Rather than fill it with rubbish, Snyder should have made it a 2 part series (not 3) and taken the 30 minutes from this one and made a slightly longer Part II.It seems all he has done is upset those who watched Part 1 expecting some kind of payoff in Part II. By the looks of the comments, he failed big time.Will I watch Part III? Well, in for a penny, in for a pound.

title: It's just an unoriginal mess
text: Visually the movie looks great at times, every Snyder movie does. But when it comes to everything else is just messy and unoriginal. Already said about the first movie, it's a blatant Star Wars rip off with a twist of Western and a bit steam punk. Almost not a single scene where I haven't seen something similar, almost not a piece of dialogue I haven't heard before. The story is sloppy, the characters underdeveloped with a weak attempt to make you understand them better (that table scene... ouch, painful). The cast is not given much to work with, some of the more veteran actors get away with it, but it's painfully obvious who doesn't.Only watch it for the sweet visuals, the rest is a big waste of time.

title: Zack Snyder has got to be stopped.
text: I am not a Snyder hater, by the way. I really enjoyed his Dawn of the Dead, Watchmen, Man of Steel and his Owl movie, a movie not enough people have seen.Sadly, as Snyder has progressed forward, receiving higher and higher budgets, his films have become exponentially worse.A follow up to the straight to Netflix Rebel Moon, Rebel Moon II picks up where the other left off, which isn't saying much.Where the first Rebel Moon took place in different locations, with different characters, most of Rebel Moon II takes place mainly in one location with one final battle.At the end of the day, these movies are Snyder doing his remake of Seven Samurai and Star Wars, except with a lame story.This proves that Snyder NEEDS a quality screenplay to placed into his hands prior to rolling cameras.

title: As a Snyder fan very sad to see a film without fun, because it is all predictable actions. He really needs a good script writer for him to shine and express his skills
text: Story 1/10, - Script 2/10, - Pacing 2/10, - Characters 0/10, - Cinematography 6/10, - World building 5/10, - Visuals 6/10, - Sound design 7/10.As an admirer of Zack Snyder over the years it is sad to see such a failing in story, script, and wrong casting types.The world building is fine, we know that he has that potential.Unfortunately, it appears that rather than letting the characters and their story build the world and then it is informing back on its characters, it is that the world building was done with lack of attention. As well filmmakers have forced all the story and its beings into this shell.Seen through the portfolio of Snyder, I imagine it is the story writer and focusing on what is it that he is exploring, would give him freedom to play around with his artistic colours.

title: I don't understand the hate
text: I never understood the hate for other one of these films yes it's obviously heavily Star Wars influence as it started off as a Star Wars project that got turned down but respectively it done a well-defined job of visually being satisfying yes there could be a little more character development but I understand why there wasn't given that he didn't want to overload people with too much information in the first two installments. I know that Star Wars purest still hate it and anti- Snyder verse folks will feel the same but if you take it for what it is.. a decent visual Epic of good versus bad and stop hating.

title: How the mediocre has fallen
text:
This is a review for both parts one and two
What can I say?
