Snyder has proven beyond a doubt he is gunning for Ed Woods crown for worst film maker.Even with huge budgets and decent actors... this director has created some turds in his time and Rebel Moon ranks up there with Sucker Punch.The plot and writing and some of the performances in rebel moon feel like the start of a 70s porno... and that's something to behold.The reason he continues to have a career is because of his rabid snyderverse fans who have never left their basements and support his mediocre skills.This double feature is showcasing just how bad Snyder is in not just writing but directing.All I can say in the positive note is thankgod Snyder has been relegated to streaming for the rest of his life.It took me over 14 attempts to complete watching rebel moon parts one and two
And I will definitely not try to watch his directors cut later as I believe I would suffer permanent brain rot and end up like his snyderverse fans.

title: When the voice of Anthony Hopkins is the star...
text: Watched both rebel movies. 1st movie was a questionable 4 star, maybe more a 3 star. 2nd movie was even worse. I gave it 2 stars because the CGI and special effects were quite good. But the story... oh my.... where to start.... it just doesn't make any sense at all. The worst are the stupid dialogues, they just don't make any sense. And the backstories on the magnificent 7 were just laughable.With such a budget it could have been so much better. Well at least we now know where Chappie went after his movie. He grew older and got the voice of Anthony Hopkins. Give us an army of 1000 chappies next movie, it'll be finished in 5 minutes. Seriously, James/Jimmy/Chappie was the only interesting character in the whole movie. Long live AI....

title: I so wanted to like the series......
text: I sooo wanted to like Part 1 & 2. This show had so much potential but it was screwed from the get go. Can we say the use of slo moooooo was used waaaayyy too much. The show consists of poor writing, poor directing, poor acting, just all around bad except for one item, the CGI was pretty decent. This is a Star Wars wannabe with Firefly western style agrarian flare. I still can't over the obscene amount of slooooo mooooo used. I had to say it twice because that's how bad it is. I'll give it up to Ed Skrein, he played an awesome bad guy. And the "harvesting" scenes could have been cut and saved 20 mins of my life. My last thoughts are this could have easily been 1 movie if all the slo mo and unnecessary scenes were removed from the film.

title: Snyder again proves he's a cinematography god
text: This is the Empire Strikes Back of the franchise. The action scenes are incredible, it's like the Man of Steel Krypton scene on crack meets 300 in space. The usual hate mob is out in full force, but based on what I've seen here, I can imagine the Directors cut surpassing Dune Part Two for my film of the year. The movie even had surprise tearjerker moments I wasn't expecting. I can't recommend it highly enough! If you felt like you didn't know enough about the team at the end of the first one, fear not, everyone gets a fleshed out backstory with compelling motivations at the start of this second film.

title: Sat Morning kids cartoon as a film
text: My inner 9 year old enjoyed this. Just lots of a action, martial art-esq fights, guns, spaceships... what's not to like :) But, that's it. The script isn't the worst ever, afterall the first film holds that title. But it's so basic and ridiculously implausible - only matched by the implausible bullet-dodging nonsense action. I know Star Wars Stormtroopers are hero blind, but this film takes it to a whole new level. In general I thought the cinematography was fine, although all the slow motion achieved was highlighting 'victims' being hit before the strike lands - honestly. The whole film has that pseudo amateur feel of a TV show. I think some ideas are well suited to a cartoon, and no, I don't mean animated film...I mean cartoon.

title: Not Good Enough
text: '' Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver '' is the second part of the Rebel Moon movies and it's even worse than the first one. Long scenes with no actual purpose, boring action scenes, eye rolling romance, and idiotic characters craft a really boring movie.First of all, there were a lot of long scenes that were just laughable, like those scenes of the farmers...farming for like the whole first half of the movie while a scottish wannabe antheme was playing on the background and slow motion movements of them drinking water spiced up the scene!And then there is the romance, which was unconvincing and the two of them had no chemistry...The whole battle plotline, in addition, was way too predictable, with boring action scenes, and even more boring villains.At least, the princess part looked promising, but that was left for another movie, so...Overall, one out of ten.

title: Fast forward half of the movie
text: Story is a hot mess and all over the place.Almost half of the movie is unrelated to the story made people felt like they just tried to make sure it's a two hour movie with only one hour story.All the slow motion, 5min of singing and suddenly like they were at Thanksgiving's dinner all characters have to talk about their past that we don't care about...How about just make one epic movie with good story instead of two crappy movies and make people think it's a waste of their time watching them.I know Bae Doona from sense8 and she was great in that shows, but in this movie she just seems awkward.I won't waste my time with the part 3 for sure....

title: Right in the middle of number 2
text: I am a true Rebel.When I watch parts of something like a tv show or a movie series, I try and watch it all even if parts of it are really bad sometimes, other parts are good and make it watch in some ways.This is the case with the Rebel Moon movie series.Visually captivating at moments and well made at other moments and with some good acting.Sometimes CGI is so badly done if feel a few nephew's with a decent gaming pc could have done just a bit worse.But what I truly understood watching RB2 is that they made it all like a superhero movie where all the characters bad or good are characters we already know and are part of POP culture.Problem is we don't know those characters and we don't care about them because all we know about them from the movies is their dramatic traumatizing painful lost all hope no reason to live backstories!!!It's full of scenes that should be intense, dramatic, grandiose, happy or sad but we like I said we don't love or feel bad, sad or happy for them.It's so exaggerated the way they make it and the way we should feel that it feels forced all the time.Those 2 movies could have been the 2 first 30 minutes episodes of a 4 episodes limited series.Just by stopping and try to be so literal and and making everything clear and obvious all the time they could cut at least half of the movie length and that is before cutting out all the long montage of people doing a task from a to z all cut in scenes of the most important parts of each tasks you see during those montage.Another good way to shorten the length would be to cut to the bare minimum the ships coming and going and moving and flying, and more coming or going and grand landscaping scenes with badly done CGI because that scene is sooooooo long for no reason at all and brings absolutely nothing to the narrative of that story that they ran out of money to make it look better than what any youtuber who make videos about how to use blender could do.In fact those youtuber are going to recreate the whole movies in 2-3 months with better visual effects than the original and use them as the easiest tutorials for beginners 12 years old and up, come on grandma you can do it too!!!Yes! Your ipad gen 5 is strong enough.Yep I have lots of spare time and i am not that pleased about it so take that minimum words required.

title: Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver
text:
Following directly from Part One, the baddies rescue nasty Admiral Noble's body and put him back together again and he awakes obsessed only with getting Kora. Meanwhile, Kora, Gunnar etc are preparing for another big fight creating cunning traps, putting bombs everywhere etc around their small village.Whilst like its predecessor there is a great deal wrong with this, firstly the 'good' stuff. The action sequences, whilst we've seen them many many times before in better films are well staged and bordering on exciting, supported by seemingly hours of slow motion and a highly portentous score. On the downside, Snyder seems so eager to create his own galaxy far far away with associated history and lore he fails to create characters that will fill it - all they do is fight, roar as they charge into battle, make speeches and burst into tears, all without a scintilla of humour.Bottom line, I just don't think I truly understood all this. The cause of the vast empire of soldiers attacking this little village still seems geared around getting grain - really? And the politics is rattled out quickly in a short section at the start - again I wasn't clear on this - perhaps I'm
just not bright enough. Anyway it does seem as if Snyder is ready to make 2 more of these plus extended R rated versions of the first 2 parts are on their way - I'm so excited!

title: I don't think we deserve good movies.
text: One of the best scifi movies I have seen recently, watched both parts together. The movie industry has become a consumer's market. I have noticed this for the past 10-12 years that, people are only consuming big star collaborative movies with nonsense plot, bad acting and mediocre script, with almost little to none emotional maturity, these type of movies only work because there are big face in them. Majority of the movies are such that the actors are playing themselves rather than playing the characters.Rebel moon also has many familiar faces, but they have solid script, characters have great chemistry, they show emotional maturity which died in the 90's or early 2000's I guess. These movies have wonderful CG scenes. The story is gripping, yes the progression is slow but not boring. The story is in parts so there will be some parts in the movie that is more talkative just build that momentum in the story and depth in the characters.I guess the audience have become too picky or they have lost interest in connecting with a good story. If these movies would have released in early 2000's, people would have gone crazy. I'm not saying that the movies look old, it's just that people don't like different things anymore.

title: Don't waste your valuable time.
text: So I'm a huge Sci-fi fan and this movie is one of the worst things I've seen since Part 1 of this hopefully 2 part series. The ridiculous details in this movie are so laughable it almost seems there was an attempt at humour like in StarShip Troopers, I mean a space ship powered by coal, a ships gun that is aimed with hand cranks like a World War Two anti-aircraft gun, but then you realize no, these guys are trying to be serious. Serious psychedelic drug abuse can be the only explanation for these horrible details. The rest of the story is filled with characters you can't identify with or like, plot lines that make no sense and just agh, it goes on and on, one flaw after another. I hope Netflix does the right thing here and asks Mr. Snyder to empty his desk and follow the nice man in uniform out of the building. If you were hoping for a new Sci-Fi universe to replace the tired and over exploited existing IP, this ain't it.

title: Bad movie in every way
text: Greetings from Lithuania.I had no hopes for "The Scargiver", the second movie in the series (and hopefully the last one) after the abysmal first part. Even the first movie somewhat not that bad. This one unfortunately should be skipped by everyone, even some light alcohol did not help me to sit through it in one go. In three evenings I finished it and it's a bad movie is all I can say.Overall, the director and written of this movie Zack Snyder made two really bad movies. I wasn't the biggest fan of his previous movies, but I did enjoyed them all on some level. Rebel Moon unfortunately is not the case.

title: Its written by an 11 year old fanboy.
text: This movie is all about lensflares and slow motions.If i was a kid at 8 years old i might have liked this film, cus your brain isnt developed enough to understand whats really going on.Which makes this film perfect. Because the evil empire wants its grain from a little farmstead. That farmstead has to be the best in the entire galaxy, why would they send huge ships and soldiers to collect it.And they resurect the evil dude from the first movie, just so he can come down a second time to the village and ask for the grain again...in slow motion..Dont ever set Snyder to direct another movie.

title: Have no expectations and you might enjoy it
text: I honestly don't know what people's expectations of this were and I don't understand what all the hate is about. Snyder has a habit of wandering all over the place with side stories like many fantasy novel writers, which works just fine in a novel but I guess people don't like it in a movie. It doesn't bother me, nor did it expect to be blown away or receive enlightenment by watching this so I enjoyed it. But it didn't have a story (original story) I hear people say, who cares, most sci-fi is as much about the world building, action, spectacle, ships and gadgets as it is about complex or original storylines. Yes it's based on the Seven Samurai/Magnificent Seven trope and it isn't even the first sci-fi to do it, that was Battle Beyond The Stars, but it is a reasonably well crafted addition to the many retellings of this old story. Also maybe Snyder hate is a thing, but it's obvious that people genuinely didn't like this movie as well, which is their right, but if you don't hate Snyder, you like sci-fi and you're not expecting a blockbuster you might enjoy this movie. I did.

title: Part 1 .... Dragged the rebel to the edge of the Cliff. Part 2... The Rebel definitely fell to the bottom
text: After seeing part 2 last night , I can definitely say that I will not be sticking around to wait for the directors cut. Script is atrocious and so wooden , seems to add zero substance to any of the characters. Not even added CGI violence and nudity will make it better in the directors cut.... Such a ashame when they have wasted so much money on beautiful cgi. Rebel Moon only strength is the CGI.The problem with Rebel Moon is Zac Snyder used his previous super hero movies as base block building for this new universe and he's slipped up on a banana hard. I couldn't help think while watching that if I imagined and replaced the rebel moon characters with super heros from the avengers movie or DC universe. It literally could of been renamed and added to that universe.... That's how one dimensional the dialogue is... There aren't really any new original ideas and again, they seem to have weird time gaps in the plot.... Oh no were about to blow this thing up in a second... 20 minutes later in movie... Switches back to scene ok now we can blow up this thing. Just so plain awful. Watching the big battle scene was fun in some bits, but felt like sci-fi musical when slow-motion started...Don't waste your time, if you didn't like part 1! Part 2 definitely doesn't redeem! RIP.

title: Worst than part 1
text:
Humm, lemme think how can I write a review without spoilers...
Oh, wait! There is nothing to spoil.Formulaic, slow drawn for no purpose except to pad the run time (I'm being generous here).Part 1 was not exactly good, but I, at least, could see some promise. Could see where it was heading, in it's hushed way. Part 2 is the oppose, in a bad way.While part 1 hurried along, trying to created several hooks, deal with several issues and unite a lot of people, without stopping in any point to explore the possibilities, part 2 drags... and drags... and drags.... Long scenes of people harvesting grains is just an example, and far from the worse of it.Sure, this is not as bad as, say, Moonfall or Battlefield Earth. And that is the thing I can say about it.

title: I was actually looking forward to part 2
text: I was actually looking forward to Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver after rebel moon child of light came out.The movie was not perfect but it delivered in the entertainment department action great special effects and more.Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver took a whole new direction not sure what happen I was looking forward to the all out war they were suppose to give us.What did you get instead, well each and every main character got there story development and it lasted way to long, all the singing.Part 2 felt like a huge waste of time they knew the direction they wanted to take but just wasted a good hour and a half of boredom.The movie was all in all a great deception after part 1.

title: A droid wears antlers... In space.
text: If that sentence makes no sense to you, welcome to this 'movie'.I'm positive every single line of dialogue from this can be found in some cliche' movie of each genre out there. It was juvenile at times, mostly just laughable.There was zero chemistry between any of the characters and simply nothing for the viewer to care about. This whole endeavor somehow managed to make actors I enjoy in other projects just miserable to watch.This was Star Wars mixed with GoT laid over a typically extreme amount of CGI. All in the hopes you won't notice they've stuffed so many great actors and actresses into another Snyder mess. If I had to get ripped and deal with the against of all of that and it turned out to be this, I'd be upset. Luckily, nobody wants to see me on screen.

title: Somehow even slower than the first
text: It's like they were contractually obligated to fill in a 2 hour runtime but only had a 60 page script. Almost every scene was twice as long as it needed to be so the movie was just a slog to get through. So many scenes had slow motion every 10 seconds that made them even longer (seriously: 4 mins of watching people harvest grain wasn't bad enough so they added slow mo to make it even longer?)The deaths were unearned and seemed to be just tossed in randomly to try to drum up some drama. Even an overly-long scene explaining everyone's backstory (with - you guessed it - slow mo!) wasn't enough to make me care if they died. They were predictable deaths, too - choreographed way ahead of time just based on where the character was or what was going on around them.Honestly can't say a single good thing about this. It was about an hour long than it needed to be (as was the first.) God I hope they don't release a director's cut because I can't imagine what kind of filler they are going to add in for another 30-40 mins. Just kidding - it's going to be extra slow-mo scenes!

title: Very enjoyable!!
text: After getting introduced to the part one by sheer randomness i didnt have any expectations for this series of movies. The first one tickled all the senses for a true scifi, i was finally getting my hopes back for the genre. Maybe we where getting a world filled with heroes, planatary battles and causes to be fought cross galaxies! As the first one wow:ed me of my feat - i did have some expectations going in to the second - they where not fully meet but the second part started to fill all the questions i had going out of the first - backstories where forged, characters attachments was real - even cried a few times. I laughed. I really enjoyed this second part!I can agree that if you dont like true scifi and have an eye for details, this movie might not be for you. If you are the kind of person that enjoys scifi and accept the scenario where you are put in to a world brimmed with information, lore and characters w/o must precontext - then you will defiantly enjoy this one! Open your senses and just enjoy this fantastic scifi!

title: The first was okay I suppose. This one garbage
text: Not only did it feel like it wasted a ridiculous amount of time rehashing on the first one but it also had zero new character development. Lots of ridiculous fighting and my God, why would she choose to have that hideous haircut again. The first one okay kinda but this one was just basically nothing but fodder. For and action movie, I really struggled to pay attention. The acting was sub par. The plot predictable (especially since there wasn't much to it.) I honestly don't know why they bothered making a second one. The whole movie probably could've been sped up to maybe a 20 or 30 minute action scene in one film.

title: This movie requires my first IMDb review ever.
text: I had to go to wiki and see how much this movie costs. I was angry. Do you know how many good things you can do with such an amount of money plus working hours spent? No plot, no characters, absolutely nothing. How is it even possible that you can create a movie like this? Just imagine, I'm a poor village guy, doing my wheat with sickle, but we have a levitating carriage and a space ship is landing on my fields, requesting my harvest for the space army? One village will produce enough flour for space army for 3 days with hands? Ok, I understand, the art, the imagination, that's fine. But, then you need characters, story, you need something. On the other hand, you really need to put significant amount of effort to make such a bad movie. Watching the movie was really a difficult experience. Movie crew, if you are reading this, please understand, by being an actor you agree to put art in the first place, not your bank account. You are all young, so please choose your roles more carefully. Absolute disaster.

title: Brilliant War Movie
text: This film is the perfect complement to Part One!Really enjoyed the continuation, with some great action and battles. Full on War flick at times! But not at the expense of characterization.It looks stunning for the budget level on which this and Part One were made, and Zack Snyder has created a great world here.Nice to see more of Jimmy - Anthony Hopkins' voice work lends a real humanity to the character, and I'm excited to see more of him in the directors cuts. While the directors cuts are hotly awaited, this film doesn't feel truncated or unnecessarily cut down, which is nice (as that's often the risk of doing a shortened 'theatrical' edit).Can't wait for a potential Rebel Moon Part Three :)

title: It makes no sense...
text: It makes no sense, a civilization so advance that can travel through space, has plenty of military power can't take a small village... because they have some grain they need... the heroes walk around with no harm against dozens of soldiers shooting at them, the stormtrooper effect all over again.The plot its so bad and boring... but it looks "nice" with tons of effects and the abuse of slow motion. It feel like I'm watching the original Dragon Ball z series, where it takes hours to advances just mere seconds on the timeline.I was 3/4 of the movie fighting to not fall asleep in the middle of the "action" so i came to write this review.

title: Why do they keep giving this guy money?
text: Surely there are other projects more deserving? Sharknado 12, The Room part 2. This is a waste of time and resources and brings nothing to the art of cinema or film. I want my money back (I didn't pay for it). If I could reach into my TV grab this movie by the neck and take a dump on it I would. I'm more upset that I'm spending my precious time writing about this film instead of jerking off to my own likeness. If I ever see or hear about another Schneider verse film I'm going to rip my own schlong off and put it into the toaster. Anyway there's a midnight screening of The Room coming up soon. Do yourself a favour and watch that instead. There, that writing is way better than this abomination.Put it into a dumpster and light it on fire.

title: Explosive Surprise
text: Just when I thought this movie was OK, it gets better in the sequel, much action it's a different take from star wars (nothing like it) but it has a template that could fall into its universe...it cinematic scope is very outstanding, the acting was very good,I would say this is a must watch, it's better than the first one...it's gritty and has its dark elements, the movie does stand out as something fresh and very accepting to the eye of a sci-fi fanatic but it's lack that one something thats hard to explain, maybe it's because I've been a star wars fan expecting to see a actual darth vader character to walk on the screen...but that's not a bad thing, like I said it's different 💥

title: Yawn fest
text: I must confess I'm still secretly hoping this movie is a parody, a prank played on everyone and we'll be happily laughing when it becomes clear it never intended to be taken seriously.My main beef is with the story, it absolutely makes no sense. Because the story makes no sense, obviously the dialogues and everything else make no sense either.The worst scenes of the movie are those where humans are present, they are even worse if the humans are talking. If there were no humans talking, it could be an ok movie. Judging by the scenery and the special effects, this is a high budget movie and has some skilled technicians working on set.I'm still trying to understand how someone decided to create this story "we are an intergalactic force, subjugating other planets and we send our might juggernauts to connect flour from subjugated planets. They use horses and sickles and they work hard for the flour. But then they start using the sickles as weapons, against the intergalactic force! And they had hammers too, and the women working the fields started shooting with guns. And a chinese lady had two laser swords and she was menacing. And everyone was shooting and some were using laser swords and some were punching and some had knives they were going to use after the punch fight.All characters are forgettable, the only exception is the robot. Zack just make a movie about the robot, with no humans present, please!

title: The secondary second part
text: I have to admit the second part did actually address certain issues of the first, such as lack of a backstory for the characters. Well, as much as one quick and generic flashback per character could be called "addressing the issue", anyway. And it had more action and less indescribable pretended English accents. And overall, it's a pretty picture with a bunch of heroic characters and a fight for the freedom, with a promise to become a longer story, for better or worse (there's "Untitled Rebel Moon Prequel" TV series entry on IMDB).So it's not that bad.Bit it's not very good, either. For some reason the actors' work in the second part looks weaker, save for the main heroine - her fight scenes still look amazing. Also there's no real story being told, neither about the world, nor character's past, nor future - it's all generic "we fight for freedom". And so is almost everything, secondary and generic and lacking the originality: genius tactical general running towards enemy hordes without cover, unexplained and misplaced steampunk aesthetics, incoherent technology that is both unoriginal and unrealistic at the same time. There were a bright flashes of originality like costumes of Tarzan-looking-prince's court, or the imperial healers, or... no I think that's about it.I guess it wouldn't be fair to call it an epic version of a fireplace videos - there's a lot of work being put into this movie - but next big thing in sci-fi universes it's definitely not.

title: Normally I love these kind of movies...
text: Since Zack Snyder did the zombie vegas movie, his movies are like a kid with a new smartphone trying out all slow motion effects and the zoom/out of focus/bokeh effect and put it in the movie as much as possible. It's not cinematic anymore, it's so annoying that it's keeping me from enjoying the story or emerge in the movie/story.CGI was good, but story was meh. I thought the dialogue was very bland. I was not invested in the 7 fighters, very 2d characters, although I know they are very good actors, I've enjoyed other movies or tv series they've played in.During the movie we were more like, this scene is the same as that movie, that scene is from that movie.Normally I enjoy sf action movies, even if they are shallow, but the 'cinematic' effects during the scenes was quite annoying.

title: Cheeky Star Wars knockoff
text: The new Rebel Moon could still hold its own in the form of a slide show, highlighting certain clips, but it's an anti-film here. About industrial waste, which maybe even Netflix would prefer to deny in a few years. As for the use of slow-motion, the new Rebel Moon goes too far compared to the first part, specifically, there is a cut where one of the characters draws water into his water bottle in slow motion.Even watching this movie requires an inhuman amount of patience. And no one should pretend it can't get any worse. Both Zack Snyder and Netflix have a knack for going deeper and deeper. That particular rabbit hole is pretty deep...

title: Compliments the first movie like godfather pt2 to godfather one and Empire to A New Hope
text: RebelMoonPart2 The scargiver, my review: 9.4/10I have seen the film twice now, my favorite thing about the second entry in the Rebel moon franchise is that the dialogue has stepped up since child of fire. One feels that the universe and its characters are fully realized, Their wants and motivations are fully realized with minimal but the right touch of wry humor underneath especially from one of my favorite characters, the noble prince Tarak.The action is actually a step up on a a more creative level than than other Snyder works and keeps. Building with new elements. The villain is only as good as its hero, skrein and boutella deliver very reciting performances as two characters on opposite sides of the coin with them being soldier killing machines , one who broke free and one trapped by orders of their superiors.The music is also more heroic and compliments the musical cues derived from the previous entry, these pg 13 cuts are best viewed as one movie for the general audience, it is a grand epic on operatic sci-fi level, while it may seem like a story told before, Snyder puts enough new elements that mine new things in the genre. Yes the hype is real, part 2 is better than a child of fire (which I gave it a 8.3/10) but part 2 pays off most things in part 1 that it should be viewed as one cohesive whole by general masses to get the most enjoyment.

title: Zack Snyder Overrated (in slow mo)
text: I dont know why I keep going back to Snyder movies to give him another go.I think its because his movies are so popular and get so much hype that I double question that I must be wrong about him.But every time I am welcomed with constant needless slow motion shots, zero character depth and appalling dialogue.If the slow motion was sped up to real time i wonder how long his movies actually are? Length of a tv episode maybe? At best.I just watched people cut wheat in slow motion for what seemed like an eternity in rebel moon 2.If it was select action sequences id understand it but its literally everything.Once the wheat was done i then watched someone drink water in slow mo. Who on earth gets enjoyment out of his movies?Long gone are the days of Dawn of the Dead and Watchmen. Sad times.

title: Full of smoke
text: If you're looking for a movie with lots of pretty explosions and special effects, you came to the right place. Looking for a good story? You'll have better luck reading a Dr. Seuss book.Yeah, it's got a lot of eye candy in terms of CGI special effects and seriously, the smoke machines worked overtime for this production. But when you strip away all the explosions, the smoke and the fire, there's really very little else here to keep your interest. The plot was ridiculously bland and predictable. The acting was on the level of the old Power Ranger shows. I wasn't a huge fan of the first movie but it was okay for killing some time. Figured this would be at least on the same level because the first film seemed to really be pushing towards the follow up story. As if the first was more of just a prequel. However, part 2 just took everything bad from the first movie and tripled it.I'm bumping my rating up to 4 stars for the work the special effects team put into it. Otherwise it would definitely be no better than a 2 star film.

title: Don't waste your time
text: I suffered through the first movie hoping for something good to happen since it's a Zack Snyder film but it never happened. I was hoping that the second film, this one, would be better and bring it together but was again fooled. It was nice that they gave a background to the story in the first 30 minutes but how could this have ever been considered a Star Wars film??? The fact that a tiny farming village is going to defend itself against a starship is absurd. I heard they're going to make 6 films and can honestly say that I will not be watching the others since this is so bad. $80 million budget completely wasted making this piece of garbage.

title: Zach Snyder once again proving he's the worst 'talent' around
text: Where do you start with this? It's like kicking a baby after you've stolen it's sweets. Everyone involved in this truly awful two parter will have known it was going to be terrible. Most Zach Snyder films are.Sure, in the early days we quite liked the endless slow mo, light flashing, action sequences in the rain trick that has become his one and only enduring characteristic (aside from making generally dreadful films) but this plunges new depths I didn't think possible.Who gave this man that amount of money on a script that feels like it's been devised by one of the weird little 'adults living in mommas basement DC fanboys' that he seems to attract.There isn't a single redeeming scene, effect, performance, edit, sound. It's one of the worst things I have ever seen.

title: The two ill-paced slow-motion movies should be recut into one
text: It took me two sittings to make it through this movie, and in the end it wasn't even worth it.The amount of slow motion in this one is astounding. To reinforce the feeling of slow motion the entire second half of the movie is drenched in boring, very slow music that is both overdramatic and very bland. It's only barely that I could stand it. I mean, even without all the slow motion and the music, the pacing would be atrocious.I don't think the main story was too much of a problem, if only it was told in a good way. The problem is more that the people I'm supposed to care about are hardly familiar to me after having watched both parts of the story.The thing is that the two movies should have been one only. Maybe someone with too much free time can recut the two parts into one half-decent movie, no longer than a couple of hours. If so, please put some better music to it (if the dialog is canceled by this, no one will mind) and cut the most of the slow motion or at least speed it up. All the exposition can be ported to a Wikipedia article. Pausing the movie at any time and reading that will surely make the movie drag less than the way it is now.

title: Bigger improvement than the first with a climatic battle from Zack Snyder.
text: 5 out of 5 stars.Rebel Moon Part 2 The Scargiver is an awesome epic space opera that plays as a climatic conclusion to the two part saga. After the last film which had a slow pacing set up and a bit of a letdown. This sequel steps up the action and pacing. The story continues were the first one left off. Kora and her group spending the first hour of the film setting up a defense for there farming village and training the villagers. Also the film spends some exposition on some of these characters on why they are motivated in defending them. The second has the bad guys coming down to the village and a epic battle happens which was well worth the payoff for the two films. The action sequences are exciting and big. The visual effects are good. The cast ensemble is great with some characters having a moment to shine. The plot does set up for a third film with more world building on were it can go. Zack Snyder has improved with this sequel with top notch action and story building.

title: How to make Zack Snyder stop?
text: Yeah....... Zack Snyder has totally lost it. There will be another movie and no matter how much people will hate this one. Snyder at his best of worst directing performance, he does what he is used to do best, at his worst. Nothing will convince anyone that is not a child that something in this movie is worth watching.Well. It is the second part of the copy-paste Star Wars from Ali Express and the characters remains almost funny, while they actually tell their story - one at the time and make another ferry to die and another viewer to fall asleep. Yeah.... he totally lost it. This is the stage at his career that he can allow himself to be out of tune, but not like that, never like that.The plot doesn't exist. The characters are a joke and the Baddy...well...he tries to be fine, but its like a pile of crap covers everything, so even Ed Skrein gets buried under all of that. The super slow motions are just too much and demonstrate where Snyder's career stands, almost drowning in the depth of the mud.Its like Snyder is expecting us to ignore each and every plot hole that exists in his movie and begs us to wait and stay to see the main movie headline - the Indiscriminate shooting of the good guys against the baddies. Ridiculous even for kids and just bad storytelling and none of the action long sequences will save this movie from getting trashed, as it deserves.Once again, we have "Seven Samurais" meet "Star Wars", but If you want to go to a better place with that mix, you can easily find it at the next streaming giant - it is called "The Mandalorian" and it was damn good. No reason for the plot, no interest in the main characters and even in the special effects category (Super and Extras Slow motions don't cut it alone, anymore) - Snyder Losses. Please Make it stop and don't go to another one.

title: Like the 1st part better
text: Man what a disappointment. I gave snyder the benefit of the doubt, thinking the 2nd part would be epic. This movie is really bad unfortunately. The acting is hit or miss. Thr story is all but a miss. The only redeeming quality, is some action sequences. But overall, it was a horrible experience. I can see the light now Snyder. You had me fooled for sure.The real problem is the lackadaisical story telling. I'm thinking Kora is gonna have a cool little backstory of being betrayed by her father. That was an utter failure. The sene itself was constructed very poorly. In my opinion, that doomed the movie. Who cares when your main characters backstory is goofy. Now, I don't even want to see the directors cuts. What a waste.

title: Lost In Space
text: In a cinematic landscape where Netflix sometimes gifts us quirky gems like "Baby Reindeer," "Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver" (2024) feels like receiving a lump of coal. Diving back into the tumultuous galaxy far, far away from originality, director Zack Snyder pushes forward with a sequel that not only stumbles but spectacularly falls face-first into a black hole of incoherence. The movie picks up where the first left off, yet somehow, viewers may find themselves even more lost in space. The plot, or the lack thereof, zigzags through a minefield of flashbacks that manage to subtract rather than add any substantial narrative. Two movies into the saga, and the audience is still scavenging for a plot amidst the rubble of recycled scenes.Ironically, "Rebel Moon" seems to orbit too closely around its more famous cousin, Star Wars, borrowing heavily from its character roster and story arcs but without any of the charm or wit. The dialogue toggles between painfully clichéd and mind-bogglingly nonsensical, leaving one to wonder if the script was perhaps written by a committee of confused droids. The characters are so reminiscent of those from a galaxy far, far away that you half expect a credit scene revealing it was all just a fan fiction from a parallel universe. This sequel not only fails to eclipse its predecessor, which was no stellar feat itself, but plunges into a new low with a concoction of sloppy storytelling and déjà vu inducing motifs.

title: Better than part 1-- but only a little.
text: I am a helpless completist. There are VERY few things in this world, when it comes to entertainment, that I can prevent myself from finishing. So, yeah, I watched "Rebel Moon: The Scargiver" tonight. I found myself underwhelmed, but I can't be surprised by that.Gonna admit it; it was better than part 1. STILL BAD, but had... three scenes that worked RRRRREALLY well, and again, the cast is phenomenal. But, in the end, "Rebel Moon" is still the absolute worst remake of "the Magnificent Seven Samurai Battle Beyond the Galaxy Against the Nazi Cylon Wannabe Empire" that ever has been (or, oh, please, please, PLEASE, *WILL EVER BE*) MADE!!!!

title: Rebel Moon part 2 the scargiver Review
text: This film is really fun, the action scenes I think are amazing every character has there time to shine and I really loved the blades that they used, the ships, the battles, and even jimmy was amazing. I also thought the visuals, and some of the back stories you get with each character really tell you more about each characters past which is something I think they did a very great job with in the film. The spund of the gun or I should day the blasters that the rebels along with the motherboard soilders sounded very powerful. I had a great time watching this film and I can't wait to see more of the Rebel Moon franchise moving forwards.

title: Whole Lotta Movie, Very Little Payoff.....
text: The first one was much better. This one could have been edited down to 20 minutes and tacked onto the end of the first one. There. Done! The action was good. The acting was good. The "story" was not because there really was no story. If all of the fighting was taken out, there would be 20 minutes of movie which was geared toward setting up the fighting..... Sigh. I gave Part 1 a 6. Stick with that one. If I could have, I would have given this one a 4.5, but alas, it gets a 5. Great cast!! Needs a better story. If Netflix is smart, there would be no Part 3. And can someone please tell Zack to lay off all the streaky light flares?!!! It's seriously unnecessary.......

title: It's bad Jim!
text: I really wanted to like this movie. Been wanting a really good scifi movie for a long time. Sadly this is not it.First part was ok and showed promise. This movie however is really bad. Lost interest almost immediately after they started with the slow-mo scenes with the singing. What's with all the singing? Felt like filler scenes to increase the runtime as the story can't carry the movie.A really boring movie with a plot nobody cares about performed by mediocre characters I couldn't care less what happens to them.Only the villain is kind of interesting but that is not enough to save this movie.

title: Uneccessary rape of Slow Motion
text: This movie sucks. Zack Snyder not only ripped off Star Wars, seven samurai and other far better movies, but he is stealing even music from his own movies like 300. As far as my title review goes, it really feels like that. This movie would be 35 minutes long if you cut all the slo-mo from it. Indian soap operas have less slo-mo than this. Do we really need to see farmers cutting grain in slo-mo? Some shots in slo-mo loook good but you are already sick of it by then.As far as plot goes- Seven samurai in space but worse. Characters are bland and dumb, when they die you already forgot who they were and what are their names which is ironic, in the end the do commemoration for them and village elder says "Remember their name" which was funny AF.Anyway, skip this movie.

title: Beyond terrible
text: I had hoped that thing may improve in part 2. Well, no they have not. This is worse than part one as it was the worst big budget thing that I have seen in years. Even after that, they dropped this turd ignoring the savage reviews. So, there is no negative score available else I would have presented this with a negative score.So, the story is pretty much non existent. The dialogue could have been written by a 9 year old and the acting is worse than a local amateur dramatics club. Video Card manufacturers have tech demos for their products that both look better and deliver a more compelling story. It's seriously that bad.To spend so much money on something so terrible really is inexcusable. A dozen low budget Indie films could have been produced for the cost of this absolute catastrophe.The sub-zero award of the year!

title: It will be better than the Star Wars Universe
text:
At first, the Universe that Zach Snyder is building looks fool of cliché but all the characters have depth and you know that the Princess is the most important. Like all the fantasy universes it starts with a small problem/conflict/village 🙂. Yes, we expected the outcome of the first battle and the character's build up, and yes, it was a little corny but the potential of this Universe is huge.If the screenplay will be different in the next episodes, and we imagine that it will go darker, than, " sky is the limit "🙂
I really trust Zach Snyder and his crew. I look forward to see the adventures to come.

title: They must have not had a screening.
text: After watching Part 2 of Rebel Moon, I have come to the following conclusion. This movie could not have been reviewed or "screened" prior to release.Someone was sent a compilation of unsorted individual scenes and did their best to compile them into a story.Knowing nothing of the backstory, the editor began sorting through footage.Ok, let's start by placing non-combat scenes in the front, action scenes can go to the rear.Wait, some of these files were meant to be with Part 1...ok let's move those to the very front.Ok seems good here!Uh oh, we just received some additional flashback clips and a small montage that we have to include somewhere...Hmm.. well lets just close our eyes and splice them in where they lay.Ok, Done!File, save, send & publish!It's a shame and disservice to film lovers everywhere to produce such a poor quality product with this cast and budget.

title: zack snyder isnt as smart as he think he is
text: Lets start with the good... the visuals are good, the slowmo shots are terrible as always but its bad visually. Now the bad, the plot is horrible and i mean horrible! Its doesnt make any sense, the way characters think and act is terrible. Zack snyder tries to make it dramatic but he only makes it more childish. The characters are all empty and boring with no reason to act in any particular way. Fight scenes are unrialistic even for a sci-fi and the actors are so bad that its insulting to the viewer. Also, zack snyder adds choose plot outcome based on nothing but his crazy addition to fake drama. Long story short (unlike zack snyder director's cut) its just a really bad product with a really bad story. Its boring and predictable with very little enjoyment.

title: Bad movie but no fake grain/noise!
text: Hello!The movie is pretty bad, maybe a little better than the first, but there is still too much dumb stuff and of course way too much slow motion. The acting is really bad too. The space ships look fantastic though.But I just want to thank Snyder for not using any fake noise or grain when shooting digitally. Putting fake grain and noise on digital video is a creative pestilence that has gotten out of hand today, with a recent example being Fallout. Instead Snyder gives us a clean high definition modern image that looks fantastic (if you disregard the typical Snyder overuse of slow motion). Not even Nolans movies, shot on real film, have the amount of grain that we see nowadays. So thanks Snyder, this looked amazing on my 75" TV.

title: I thought it was a great start to a new universe.
text: I see a lot of negative reviews for the Rebel Moon titles. Me personally, I enjoyed the story this far. You have to sort of suspend your belief to envision some sci-fi stories. I love that the gave a taste of back story for these characters. This would allow for further delving into later. In regards to the story itself. It was a great story that took part in a small segment of a growing universe. It was fun to see this preparation for battle that is often glossed over in a quick montage in some movies. The visuals were great. The characters were fun and unique. There was enough of a threat that you didn't know who would survive. I know some talk of how slow it went, I personally enjoyed the speed of the story as it took time to further develop characters and the plot. Such a great experience and I look forward to more.

title: I love sci-fi but...
text: I adore science fiction and always cut it some slack when reviewing; my inner geek demands it. But, honestly, I found this hard to watch. Clichés, overacting, a drawn-out, nonsensical storyline, and 2 hours of it!!This could have been sliced into a Netflix series, which might have made it easier to stomach, maybe not. $160 million was splashed on these films. I think Netflix got taken for a ride! Netflix will no doubt say a record number of people watched it, so that's a win from a PR perspective. I just can't believe such a huge sum can be wasted on such a poorly conceived and lazy script. Maybe I'm getting old; maybe storytelling isn't a priority for many of these producers/directors these days.It looked stunning with all the right qualities of a good sci-fi blockbuster, which is why I kept watching, but let's be honest, it was a bit like having a chat with a stunning model that has an IQ of 10!

title: Worse than part one
text: I believe this is a definitive proof that Zack Snyder can't make movies, only visuals.The Blur and Slowmotions are damaging the movie, not improve It.This movie contains WAY too many plot holes, too many slow-mo sequences, lack of logic , cheap clichés .Some characters have been fleshed out a bit, but I still don't care about anyone.There are more questionable artstyle choices... Navy Space Ship is one that constantly bothers me.TOO MANY GRAIN SCENESOnly CGi was actually the only good thing.I really can't recommend this movie to anyone, It's a waste of time... things are happening and no Impact is delivered.4/10 , Skip It.

title: Lost What It Started With!
text: Sadly Part 1 was much better than Part 2. This whole thing started off really good with Part 1 - it built up all these almost super human characters, it laid the groundwork for a huge confrontation - but then - it's kind of like in Part 2 - the whole thing just went flat! All those super heroes disappeared. The conflict and tension just went away!!! Sure there was plenty of shoot em up action - but very little story and again all those string characters just kind of evaporated. Definitely did not have all the strength behind it that made Part 1 so good. Just shoot up everything and get to the end.

title: The decisive rebel combat win Star Wars never delivered
text: I liked part one and have followed the making of content. I suspect the origin of Zack's Rebel Moon goes back to the 1990s and is his reaction to a narrative hole in the Star Wars films. WE all liked the Death Star blown up; we all liked the teddy bears taking down the Empire's walkers; and yet, no Star Wars movie offers a decisive ground-air combat win for eh rebel alliance. Rebel Moon, especially part 2 is the missing film.Given that's the good news, it's easy to turn this around and say, "Nothing new here, same old, same old." I can see tha tpoint of view too. I still give it a 9/10 because both parts one and two are made with a whole hell of a lot of heart and good morale. As with many films running on familiar TV and movie tropes, they can still be good entertainment based on execution (like Wednesday and Heart of Stone on Netflix).For comparison consider Argyle, made by Matthew Vaughn for Apple TV. I saw it in a theater because like the first two Kingsmen so much. However here we have a genuinely bad movie, based on on familiar TV and movie tropes, which even terrific execution could not save. All the sizzle is in the two minute trailer.

title: What a fumble
text: First off Zach Snyder is not a good storyteller. He makes eye candy. So knowing this I don't expect anything particularly deep. But...Falls short of expectations, failing to live up to the already low bar set in the original. The storyline feels disjointed and lacks cohesion, with subplots introduced and abandoned without resolution. Character development is virtually nonexistent. Action sequences feel formulaic and uninspired, failing to evoke any genuine excitement. The visual effects are subpar, detracting from the overall viewing experience. Overall, this is a disappointing sequel that fails to make up for how mediocre the first movie was.

title: So much talking
text: I find I compare movies if the flick reminds me of others. In this case it was coal smoke billowing out of what was supposed to be a version of an Imperial walker, and I dubbed this the child of Star Wars and Wild Wild West. In a scene on the main ship we have coal fires and tenders. The first half is dogged with backstory that had me looking up from my iPad periodically. The dialogue is such that your chances of predicting lines is up there. The battles all slow down so you can see the choreography. I assume most of the budget went for cgi as the best known actor is Djimon Hounsou, who isn't bad with the little he gets to do. Watch Revenge of the Jedi again, and if you can live without Ewoks, you're fine.

title: Underestimated
text: To be honest I was skeptical when I saw part one. I also read the negative reviews of the second part so I was sort of biased to believe that the whole thing has a serious lack of quality. I must admit that was proven wrong after watching the second part. I am not saying that this is a masterpiece, but I would easily rate it with 7 out of 10, and I am actually looking forward for the continuation, experiencing how her story evolves. I am giving a 10 out of 10 rating, as a protest against the negativity of the user reviews, as well as the reviews from experts. This is a streaming movie, if this was a masterpiece, it would hit the theaters instead. Since it is not, we should treat it as such. I am not a big fan of Snyder in general, but if I am to evaluate this as a streaming platform movie, because that what this is, he has actually done quite decent work. I therefore, highly recommend watching both parts.

title: An Amalgum of Other Great films, done just OK
text: Did you hear the one about the film makers that didn't have an original idea for a sci-fi action movie? No? Well, it's called "Rebel Moon." One can't help seeing ripoffs from a lot of good movies and shows: GOTs, Star Wars, Conan the Barbarian, the Mandalorian, Lord of the Rings and the WWII German-esque uniforms from Starship Troopers, just to name a few. That, and throw in some plain folk Mennonite farmers for flavor. It's an ok movie, but as Yogi Bera said, "it's like deja vu all over again," and that makes "Rebel Moon" predictable and forgettable. Moreover, the acting, which is often over-emotive, is at times laughable instead of what it is attempting to be, and that is stirring. If you have nothing better to watch and like SciFi, you can find things to like In "Rebel Moon." Otherwise, this film gets a "meh" and a huge yawn.

title: Huge Snyder Fan
text: As stated, I'm a huge fan of Snyders work. I don't mind the over use of slow mo in his movies and really love the worlds that he is able to make. That being said, both of these RM movies are hollow shells that no acting or flashy special effects was going to save. I have a feeling these directors cuts will be released and have people asking "why didn't we get these versions originally?". I understand the studios butchered his past visions but he had ultimate control here. He made a choice to release the same type of garbage studios have been for years just because he could? He eliminated almost everyone's desire to see them by releasing 2 dumpster fires first. Personally I'll watch them hoping for the same change in attitude I had watching his cuts of bvs, jl, and the extended version of sucker punch. But the question will always remain on the odd release decision....why????

title: Too unbelievable despite good visual FX
text: They must harvest grain by hand using scythes despite having hover carts albeit pulled by alien horses? Not mention the advanced weapons and spaceships. So much of this movie breaks/voids suspension of disbelief that it was hard to enjoy the otherwise good visual FX. A classic case of film making magic wasted on poor concepts/storytelling. The heros were bland and their successes so unlikely that I was almost rooting for the hapless villain whose over the top character was at least colourful. It's a demonstration of how space operas such as this can fail without well motivated story lines regardless of the eye candy.

title: Zack Snyder slo no special effects only
text: I think Zach Snyder likes his slo mo fight scenes with bullets flying around like colored paintballs spatting and throwing lava everywhere. Apart from that there is nothing in Rebel moon franchise, I wud certainly blame my increased Netflix subscription prices if you count these movies totally overhyped , undeveloped story or characters and and totally not meant for any story. Just FX fight scenes, characters killed in slo mo as if they had a deep back story so that audience will feel their killing. His story dev lacks depth here and world of rebel moon hasn't given proper justice or screen time to be developed.

title: Unwatchable
text: I remember watching the first installment of this movie but do not remember anything about it. When I cued up Part 2, elements of the story started to come back to me, and not in a good way.I was only able to get through about 25-30 minutes of this movie before I decided my time would be better spent doing pretty much anything.It's mind boggling to me the amount of money, time, and effort spend to create a movie such as this, and have it be such a nothing burger. You can apply every negative sci-fi/action movie cliche in the book to Rebel Moon Part 2.There are too many problems to list, but the thing that made the least sense to me is how this advanced civilization depended on citizens of a slave planet manually harvesting a crop. Just stupid movie making.

title: Plot is weak and acting is laughably bad but likely because of the crappy scripting
text: Bang! Boom! Slow motion shot! Fancy flipping! Everyone crowding for the spot line with inspirational phrases! The classic David vs Goliath! The surprise saves! And THEN the surprise saves of the surprise saves! And THEN the surprise saves or the surprise.... You get the picture.The movie is one massive cliche that was designed to attract and impress middle school boys... I will say I respect the cleanliness of the movie, but otherwise it was a massive cringe all the way through. The first movie was cringe and I thought it wouldn't get worst... it totally did.Plot was weak and shallow.The acting was pretty bad.The scripts are likely to blame for the acting because of the lines the actors had to say are not easy to say them.The movie relies on CGI 98% of the time.

title: IM BIG FAN ZACK'S MOVIES until this one
text: What in hell he was thinking, nonsense slow motion scenes , the script is completely disaster, there is some scenes with some stupid dialogs , the storytelling its pain to my ears .GOD i was hoping to the idea since he start with this failure project, to be honest i feel sorry for zack , thers something different going here , just imagine he made Watchman, MOS ,BVS, 300, JL maaan , what a downgrade .This film was supposed to be something special to prove that's u still can do .JUST imagine u watch Dune and thin u watch this garbage what a pain in the eyes.The filme full with details for nothing .

title: Just as spectacular as the first one
text: Wow what a movie. The story continues in the sci-fi Magnificent Seven. The first half is fairly slow and admittedly that harvesting scene was quite a slog but most of the second half consists of a jaw dropping, incredible battle. As expected some of the characters die so the suspense is ratcheted up. Beautiful effects, stunning visuals, incredible explosions, glorious slo-mo, great sword fights and wall to wall action in the second half make this a must see. The film never tries to be more than it is and that's ok for people who have good taste; not the forever whiners about just about every movie ever made. Where's the last film they made? Oh yeah........none. Boutella and Skrein play their respective parts well and not over the top and the supporting cast does fine with Hounsou as the standout. Hope Snyder gets his wish and makes more but at least we have the R rated versions to look forward to.

title: Unless you're really bored don't waste your time go for a walk or phone your mum
text:
Considering I thought I was watching an Amish harvesting documentary for the first 30 minutes followed by a poor 7 samurai rip off it's an ok film
Zach Snyder has to be the most overrated filmmaker in Hollywood thank god he never got near making a Star Wars movie
My son said if you sped up all the slow motion parts the movie is only about 45 minutes long between that and lens flares it does drag out a bit there really isn't that much of a story
The ending seems to hint at a sequel and I know this is supposed to be some form of Snyder space universe but seriously Netflix just stop or get a different director.

title: Boring movie
text: This is boring, just like a lot of Snyder movies, he is just a pretentious filmmaker, i like him as a person but this us not very good for various reasons.The action: its slow and boring, the raid 2 its a great example of a good action sequence, its fast and exhilarating, love that movie, here is all stop motion and bland.Characters: we don't care about anyone of the main cast, in kurosawa 7 samurais movie after 3 years i not maybe not every name but i do remember every face and personality.Villain: the villain is the same in both movies, a stereotypical angry guy with a funny hair, no personality beyond hating the main characterFinale: it's basically the same action sequence as the first movie tbhThis movie makes me sad, its just a Walmart star wars, Snyder should retire for a couple of years and comeback stronger, he needs to rethink a lot about his carrer.

title: Worse than Part 1? Not really, but equally bad.
text: In this Part 2, the cinematography doesn't suffer as much as the Part 1 regarding completely out-of-focus or distorted shots, but the presence of lens flares for every tiny light source on screen is ridiculous. During "laser" shootout moments, these flares cover practically the entire screen. The color palette remains very dull, and except for a couple of shots, it can be summarized as insipid or, in the most extreme cases, horrendous. The special effects are not as noticeable as in the Part 1, but they're not remarkable either.As in the first part, the dialogue and script are dismal, constantly teetering on the brink of cringe and incoherence. This isn't helped by the poor staging, where Snyder can't find a better way to present exposition than through a mediocre scene where characters sit and recount their past as if reading it from Wikipedia. Or presenting deaths or dramatic moments in a bland manner, incapable of conveying anything to the audience, pretending that putting dramatic music over the scene compensates for the poor dialogue, performances, and cinematography.Continuing with the performances, they're flat, partly due to both the actors and the script. Practically every character has barely enough lines for their voices to be heard. Snyder prefers to invest footage of his film in trivial slow-motion scenes of wheat harvesting rather than showing us interactions between his characters that allow us to connect with them. The case of Anthony Hopkins is especially lamentable; bringing an actor of his caliber to perform in such a poor role is a complete waste of talent.The only thing that is partially redeemable is the soundtrack. Junkie XL does a good job, although not exceptional, and it's far from his other works.This film is more action-packed, at least in its second half, after a tedious introduction that doesn't really contribute as much to the plot as it could have. This helps to better handle the pace compared to Part 1, and perhaps this is the reason why I can't place this second part in a worse position than its predecessor. The film has great action sequences, especially towards the end, mixed with others that are more disorganized, but they all suffer from the same problem: a complete lack of emotion, as there is never any tension or the feeling that the heroes might not win.The film overall is quite predictable, uninspired, boring, and clumsy. There's really not much to salvage from this franchise attempt.

title: Snyder doing what Snyder does best
text:
It's clear to me now more than ever that Snyder can do nothing good for people!If you don't like Zack Snyder, then fine, but there is absolutely no way any objectively based sane mind can come to this film and call it trash! So if you don't like Snyder, there's a simple solution. STOP... WATCHING... HIS FILMS! Why waste your time on something you'll undoubtedly hate?Now is Snyder, a master filmmaker, no, but his style is fun and unique. The man is a solid director.Anyway...Rebel Moon - Part Two: The Scargiver continues and builds off of what Part One does. The story is good. The character development is great. Showing us these characters' backstories... and by the way showing not telling.Every characters motivation and reasoning for being there is put on full display. I cared about these characters and their well-being. However, I do wish James would have been shown and explained more. The script is well written, the action is phenomenal, the cast delivers great performances, the cinematography, the cgi is amazing, and the films original score is fantastic.Snyder wasted no time in getting straight to the point. This film is basically nonstop action from beginning to end. Then everything pays off in a tense third act. The anticipation from Part One and build-up to this battle was greatly satisfying.I am invested in this universe and hope Snyder gets a chance to do more. Until then, bring on the Snyder Cuts.IMDb: 8/10
Letterboxd: 4/5Watched on Netflix in 4k Dolby Vision.

title: no, just no
text: So i tried to give these movies a chance, i really did. Watched the first one and enjoyed some of the action sequences and even thought i could kind of see how it might've worked in the star wars universe. But then i tried watching the second one. And man this was bad.The plot was just bad, the conversations and dialog were unrealistic and very poorly delivered, like where did they even find these actors, walmart? I turned it off after about an hour because by then absolutely nothing had happened. Well, except having to watch a very uncomfortable sax scene right at the very beginning of the movie between two characters that had no chemistry, can't remember if that was before or after she had told everyone in the camp how much of a horrible person she really was before meeting all of them at the beginning of the last movie, and watching the townsfolk play in the dirt and pretend like were harvesting hay. They literally stretched that out to take up well over an hour of a 2 hour movie, like i said, with NO action. Just pathetic. I had to cut it off and almost felt personally offended by how bad the script and acting was and the fact they felt that the average person would consider that entertainment.

title: Flour as a shield? Um, it can violently burst into flames.
text: The great military genius could have put dirt on most of the flour bags, but no, he lined all the buildings with a substance that if thrust into the air as dust (such as if there was an explosion near by), it would only take a small spark/heat source to cause a chain reaction in all the airborne flour dust.It would either create a massive fireball or explode.I can't imagine what farmers might have thought watching this.I mean, it's not gasoline, and it does have to be airborne, but it can be absolutely devastating.If you're not sure of this, just Google-up "flour mill explosion", and see what you think.It's one thing to have their crops as shields, but quite another to also have them as explosive devices surrounding your people.(If their product was gasoline, would they have surrounded themselves with it?)

title: $83,000,000 garbage
text:
One of the loudest, most senseless collections of
re-done sci-fi classics and rehashed cliches imaginable. I fell asleep during the 'action' scenes even after fast forwarding thru nonsense, supposedly pensive story shots. Snyder may be eternal for 300, but unforgiven for the space trash of rebel moon.Imagine someone woke up, after the apocalypse and read Frank Herbert then watched Seven Samurai and just trailers of every Star Wars ever made. They found a camera, a ton of dynamite and enlisted 20 half witted nuclear survivors to be their actors and made a movie barely worth showing at a family party...and that's rebel moon part deux.

title: Snyder Needs to not write.... just direct....
text:
Opening Narration splanation from hopkinsPicking up pretty much where part 1 ended, our merry band of rag tag fighters led by Sofia Boutella are winding down.... Thinking they've defeated the big bad vader (sorry, Atticus Noble) and the star destroyers (sorry, dreadnoughts) are headed back to the other side of the galaxy, tail between there legs...Our heroes victory celebrations are cut short however as the big bad guy.... Didn't actually die...He's recuperating in vaders healing chamber and when he's all better... Oh boy is he gonna be even bigger and badder and eviler than before....That pretty much covers the plot then.So... Is rebel moon part 2: The scar giver.... Any good.Does it build upon (improve upon?) part 1...? Or does it double down and end being all style no substance......Yeah.It's the latterLike all Zack Snyder movies,Echoes of a recovering garth vader chamberSpace age julious cesar killing bitWooden dialogue.... Lots of flashback with narration for each character...literally a scene (collection of scenes) where the characters sit around a dinner table and give narrate their own flashback sequence)They say show don't tell.... Zack snyder does both...
He shows... AND he tells...He should stick with just showing... I don't thing his strengths lie in writing.... I think he's a fantastic, visually stylistic director.... But his best work comes when he's working from a script he didn't write himself...Link to slomo guys video with snyder, tag em...The final battle... Kinda felt rushed and... Unearned... Like the hero momet... Feels like it came outta nowhere (in guessing it'll be better set up in the directors cut.... Like. BVS)acting is fine......Ed Skrein does a lot with the little he's given..... (especially considering he was only cast like 10 days before he was filming his first scene)Sophia Botella, just doesn't seem to have that IT factor to make here a leading lady.The supporting cast (Djimon Honsou, Michael Huisman etc...) all try there best.... But with the dialogue they're given..... Only so much they can do...The cross cutting in the 3rd act between the space battle.... The ground battle and the fight on the ship... Very remeniscant of star wars....There's a very cool, stylised fight scene with energy swords (totally not light sabers) that's a mash up of return or the jedi, inception and watchmen...... I have to say that scene was very cool....But... That's about the only thing I enjoyed about rebel moon 2...Rebel fleet, evil space soldiers, laser energy swords....small farming planets... Androids with British accents....Yeah... Totally not a star wars movie.... 😉Robots are called Jimmys....so.... I'll take that as a compliment 😉4/10 for rebel moon part 2: The Scargiver.

title: For adults only
text: Definitely, a lot better than last Piter's teen poocie miseries.But I just too old for all this "Red panties" shi1e, I think.In this case - I just can see the scenario drawings in every particular scene of the movie - and I like it.For the world, we're here, now, in Ukraine, living just this exact scenario. "Gross old evil empire came for our grain and ground".You know, in reality it is even more tense, but you can continue to ground the rating. Because you can do it.If we lose - we won't. We will be the next "empire troopers", that will come for you.Hell's experienced troopers, I must said.

title: I'm going to hold my judgement for the Snyder cut
text: If it still suck when the Snyder cut comes out, then I'll definitively know there is something fundamentally flawed with Zack Snyders storytelling.Every aspect of this movie is just lame tropes with "space" in front of it. You have space nazis. Space Julius Caesar. Idk a bunch of real...not important stuff. But everyone is very serious about it.The bad guy is like...cartoonishly over the top bad guy. Like there is no dimension to that guy at all. He's just crew cut zealous white guy. Like that person doesn't exist. And if he does, he's in the basement of his parents house hating the world shoving a remote places they don't belong in a fit of rage. Not...leading an army to do anything of significance.Anyway. It's bad. I'm going to watch it. But just know, I'm not really happy about it.

title: The Epic in Slow Motion by Snyder.
text: Directed by Zack Snyder and starring Sofia Boutella, Ed Skrein, Djimon Hounsou, Michiel Huisman, Bae Doona and Ray Fisher.SynopsisThe rebels prepare to fight Motherworld as unbreakable bonds are forged, new heroes emerge, and legends are created.One cannot deny that Zack Snyder is one of the directors who puts the most enthusiasm into what he does and it is always appreciated that he proposes new things in the industry, even though it is often not the result everyone expects.The ambition that he achieves in his own battle of the galaxies called Rebel Moon has two sides to take as a counterpart. You may like her or you may hate her, but she will not leave you indifferent to what the director proposes to us once again. In my case, I am left with the feeling that I had a pleasant moment in front of the screen despite the shortcomings that the film offers, but Zack Snyder's cunning or habit of occupying the camera manages to make a story that does not advance in In no sense do its slow motions turn it into something much more amazing than what the final result ends up being.It certainly doesn't surpass its first installment and feels like more of the same as what we saw in its first part. With that, we are left with the feeling of waiting for something new to be proposed to us by the director and well, in my opinion he achieves it with one of his best characters in the story such as James, but unfortunately we really see little of him, but when he is on screen is the moment when the film achieves its greatest peak in fun. The rest is a film that continues to give us flat characters and a protagonist who is difficult to get attached to, even though we have an excellent performance by Sofia Boutella, giving herself completely to her role.The great deficit that Rebel Moon has in its central core is that it is difficult to really empathize with its characters and with a story that remains stuck in the same thing and halfway through the film one even comes to feel that they are stuck in the same circle. Despite everything mentioned, the film manages to attract your attention and you do not abandon it along the way, managing to have a much more striking climax and where Snyder's camera skills are allowed to show off much more even though his excess of slow motion is the true seal of everything that Rebel Moon hides.Zack Snyder knows how to visually construct the ideas of his final battle well and makes his budget work correctly, something that one can always highlight from the director who knows how to invest very well with what he has at his disposal. Correct CGI and understandable handling of the action sequences allow the film to visually catch your attention and leave aside a script that lost its surprise a while ago.Netflix bet big with a blockbuster that is in the middle line of a proposal that you can see once in your life and continue with it without having changed anything of what was planned. It is a film that has moments and that serve to prevent it from being a complete disaster and we are left with an acceptable and correct film to position itself as a blockbuster for Netflix and for the Snyderverse.Don't expect to find the best film of the year or the best of the director, but a weekend pastime without high expectations.

title: Very Average
text: Cringy, stereotypical characters with sickly sweet dialogue within a superficial storyline that requires the audience to suspend belief throughout the whole story. Watch a small hamlet of farmers miraculously take on a highly trained army with minimal experience and only wooden huts for protection. The heroes seem to have come straight from a novel written for young tweens and would only appeal to those who really don't want to think too much about the plot or back stories of the characters.The visual effects and starships are beautiful and Ed Skrein's performance as the evil Admiral Atticus is a rare highlight, making it watchable (just). So much potential squandered by poor plot and writing.Please stop making these now.

title: What was the movie again?
text: I thought the first part was mildly OK at best.By the time part 2 came out I had to re-watch part 1 again to even remember I'd seen it before, it left that much of an impression.So yeah, part 2...First 30 minutes in and I'm already terribly annoyed by the over use of slow-motion. Why so much!The whole movie could be 30 minutes shorter if there was no slow-mo and if there are any slow-motion scenes, make sure the right stuff is slowed down. I understand slowing down scenes can add a thrilling element and it allows the graphic department to show what they can do with modern graphics but come on.The story is as thin as tin foil. The acting is so-so, the effects are actually decent (when not unnecessarily slowed down) and the story... Nothing new there.By any means, don't waste your time on this.

title: Very enjoyable!
text: I hesitated to watch this after reading so many vitriolic reviews. After an attempt at watching Atlas on Netflix, I had to stop and find something else to cleanse the palate. I finally decided to give this a try - and I was glad I did. Epic sci-fi! Compellingly characters. Stellar cast. Anthony Hopkins as "James" was pretty inspired. A ragtag team of heroic fighters. A classic villain. Solid story. Great action and pretty epic VFX. I just wish I could have seen it in a theater to get the full impact of the sound and visuals. I'm really hoping that the story continues at is is intended to be told. I will definitely not read any reviews next time and just grab the popcorn and watch!

title: I'm sure the director's cut will be better
