text: Just like the justice league director's cut was superior I'm hoping when it's released it will make this movie better... A week after finishing this ive almost forgot the plot already. I'd rather him do a new zombie film. This movie was too childish and felt like it went on and on. Not to mention the characters were almost invincible when the fighting was happening and no one seemed to be able to get hurt.... I've always been a huge fan of zack snyder films but these last two have been absolute rubbish. Maybe they made it this way for netflix? Or for kids? This movie was garbage just like sucker punch was.

title: Low scoregiver
text: Argh, I've wasted four and a quarter hours on this drabble. No comparison to the $160m wasted on a college boy's drunken scribbles, hey Zachy boy?!It's just bad. If you haven't yet committed to watching it with the hope of it getting better and kicking in to gear...don't! Save your time and go do something else better instead. Four and a quarter hours, just think of all the funky things you could do with that time. Go. Do that instead.There is definitely potential for rebel moon, it just has not been delivered, despite a good budget, cast, and visuals. Unfortunately, this seems to be a case of the parts not making a whole - the missing piece is the storyline.

title: Epic Cinematic Brilliance
text: These movies are everything people "say" they want in a film. It is original, it's epic, it's absolutely stunning in its presentation. It's heroic, it's tragic, it's almost perfect. The only problem with this movie is its audience. Society has become far too lazy with the attention span of a fruit fly to enjoy a movie that requires time to develop its story and characters. This story does just that. This second movie ended in a way that would lead one to believe more is coming. I truly hope so. I would love to see how this group of characters works together to take the fight to the enemy. And I'm more than willing to sit through more of Nolan's filmmaking brilliance to see it play out. Put down your phone. Put away the tablet. Turn off the lights and pop some popcorn or order a pizza and just enjoy the movie.

title: A Zack Snyder Film Reel
text: This is like having ADHD and OCD at the same time. It's an action packed visual marvel with nowhere to go. The acting is ok. Script kinda poor. This felt like Stuart I mean Snyder saying "look what I can do". At least it's "free" with subscription. So can't be too mad. Snyder knows how to experiment with sci-fi which I appreciate but this felt rushed and disconnected plot wise. Did you ever watch that family guy episode where Brian took a bunch of adderall and made Space Shire 7. Ya that's how these films played out. Snyder wanted us to build a connection with some of the main characters but it's all overpowered by the consistent action. Meh. Might be better to watch high. Hey 420 is tomorrow! Maybe that was his intention all along lol.

title: I like the slow build
text: I really liked this Rebel Moon 2 and I liked Rebel Moon 1, too. It feels like I am getting started on a really good series of novels. And I enjoy taking my time with them. Some other reviews mention that they think nothing really happens and no progress is made, but I don't think that's the case. Maybe the progression is too slow for some people. I appreciate the slow relationship build of the team, and their progress to finding their way. I like that everything doesn't happen all at once (full character builds with back stories, binding relationships, etc.) The affects and action are great. I'd watch more set in this universe.

title: here we go again...
text:
Here we go again...Just as with the first part , it feels that everything in the world of cinematography (all world as is ) went absolutely upside down... Nothing makes sense anymore : man are women , women are men , some are cats , some are whoever , here is another example of absolutely illogical , braindead people out there , who worship the most stupid movie in existence (Barbie ,of course ))), but in mass criticize and put down this film ... If you'll have any knowledge or understanding of the most amazing universe of storytelling via books and movies , you would see that this film is basically fantasy variation on Magnificent Seven , or it's predecessor
& samurais ...No plot , no story ... primitive people ... The story is as old as the first fairy tale : Big bad force bullying good innocents , here comes the help (in many different ways over centuries )))
So ,why not to just relax and enjoy it for what it is :modern fairy tale with amazing action and simple old story....

title: Cinematic Art
text: The hypocritical snyder haters are back at it. This is clearly a popular and profitable franchise posting #1 across most if not all regions upon release.All main characters get an albeit brief backstory explaining their motives on why they will fight & die rebelling against the motherworld.The visuals are as you'd expect from Snyder top tier. The fight choreography is brilliant and the levels of actions packed into this movie just have to be seen to be appreciated.The story is set for many more movies to come and I welcome it. If you don't like it then don't watch it and stop trying to ruin it for the people that do thoroughly enjoy his work.Disney are still making movies for you to watch instead.

title: Beautiful
text: It is noteworthy that the director's version of the movie will be even better as it has much more time to better develop the approach. The movie is far superior to the first one. Even though I didn't have the same experience of watching on a big cinema screen, like the first one, I still really liked what I saw in this second part.The movie features beautiful scenes. The fight choreographies are insane, making it truly a great war movie. Although it is far from being Snyder's best movie, Rebel Moon Part 2: The Scar Marker is undoubtedly an excellent movie.It is noteworthy that the director managed to do with the resources available, raising the level for original Netflix movies.

title: It is a great movie and story.
text: I don't get the hate here and read a lot of the comments. Some of them don't seem to get the story or the main point at all. It is NOT about the grain. It is about Power, Betrayal. Simple as that. Fresh take on Star Wars and Dune but different storyline and different universe.I totally get it. Action and story, all balanced. Great acting from main characters. OK slow mo, it is not over used and only a few parts and actually it is good at the right scene. I couldn't believe I was emotional at the end and so piss off at the Balisarius for all the wrong and pain that he has caused on so many worlds. Poor Kora had suffered enough already and let her be.The first one gave you brief story behind what was happening. Kora seeked a few heroes to help with the rebellion. Part 2 gave you more details and brief background on each hero. Then action, the fight, unexpected help and turn of event. It's truly entertaining and never a dull moment. I have watched second time and still enjoying it. I hope they made the third one where Kora kill her adopted dad and found the princess to restore the peace.Seriously, it is a great story and if you keep an open mind, you should enjoy this movie. I have seen so many movies, TV series, all genres and I have thousand of movie collection. I know what a bad movie or story look like but this is NOT a bad movie. It is one of the BEST Sci Fi movie. I love Star Wars, Star Trek and Dune. This will sit among them under Sci Fi category.

title: Like Dune but without the boring parts
text:
It was never a boring second throughout this movie.You get to know the characters and you care for them,
It´s an emotional roller coaster.All the characters, even the small ones are highly individual and memorable. Not like Dune where every character looks exactly the same.Spectacular finale to the buildup in Part 1: A Child Of Fire.Can ´ t wait to see Rebel Moon Part 3
(Wondering what the title will be)The Directors cut ´ s will definitely be even more epic and emotional.Hope it'll be true they'll come out in the summer of 2024.I think these movies will grow with time and even if it doesn't go mainstream it have definitely found its audience and fanbase that are big.We need to find the Princess Issa and fight.

title: Amazing part 2
text: The sequel takes viewers on a thrilling journey through the cosmos, delivering jaw-dropping action sequences and heart-pounding drama. From its gripping storyline to its stunning visual effects, "Rebel Moon: Part 2" is a cinematic experience that leaves audiences clamoring for more at home.One of the standout aspects of "Rebel Moon: Part 2" is its impeccable storytelling. Building upon the rich lore established in the first film, the sequel delves deeper into the conflict between the tyrannical Federation and the brave rebels fighting for freedom. With its intricate plot twists and well-developed characters, the film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats from start to finish. Each scene is meticulously crafted to heighten tension and evoke emotion, resulting in a truly immersive cinematic experience.Of course, no discussion of "Rebel Moon: Part 2" would be complete without mentioning its breathtaking visual effects. From the vast expanse of space to the intricately detailed alien landscapes, every frame of the film is a feast for the eyes. The visual effects team has outdone themselves, creating stunning environments and jaw-dropping action sequences that push the boundaries of what is possible on screen. Whether it's a high-stakes space battle or a breathtaking planetary vista, the graphics in "Rebel Moon: Part 2" are nothing short of spectacular.But it's not just the visuals that make "Rebel Moon: Part 2" a standout film; it's also the performances of its talented cast. Led by charismatic leads and supported by a talented ensemble, the actors bring their characters to life with depth and authenticity. From the fearless rebel leader to the conflicted Federation general, each member of the cast delivers a memorable performance that adds layers to the film's narrative.As the credits roll on "Rebel Moon: Part 2," one thing is clear: fans are already eagerly anticipating the next installment. With its gripping storyline, stunning visuals, and memorable performances, the sequel sets the stage for an epic conclusion to the trilogy. Audiences are left with burning questions and eager anticipation, wondering what fate has in store for their favorite characters and the galaxy they inhabit.As fans I hope for Rebel Moon: Part 3.

title: One of the best
text: I don't know about others but for be this was a great movie i even cried at the last part. I don't know what they say and what they expect from movie but i got what I expected i am sad with all this negativity they might not make 3rd.As a movies it did serve it's Purpose.graphic wise also i am in i can watch 10 more. I have seen some of them talking about black hole and scientific side but it's a movie what more can be expected it's just imagination.This is my personal thoughts so no offense i am just saying what attracted me to the movie how ever i was not expecting the second one this soon but oh boy no one is happier than me.

title: Epic Filmmaking
text: Epic Filmmaking from everyone involved with Rebel Moon Part Two. The cinematography is a work of Art, so many different shots I felt I was looking at a beautiful enriched detail picture in an Art Gallery. Sofia Boutella is a Movie Star, such a great performance from her throughout the entire film & man what a show she put on in the final act. Ed Skrein embodied the villain role, every time he was on screen you felt his dominating presence & you're just waiting to see him do something destructive. Djimon Hounsou, hats off & round of applause! He's character General Titus is such a Soulful Worrier, I would go into any battle under his leadership & believe we would have Victory. Anthony Hopkins's voiced character Jimmy is a complexed character where I see there's so much more to explore & showcase as a sentient Artificial Intelligence, that's in assistance with Humans. In closing, it was a nice touch to see Cleopatra Coleman's beautiful character Devra Bloodaxe come in for the Victory Lap, I would like to see a spin off series on the Bloodaxes. Tom Holkenborg rocks it again with the intense & beautiful Score, further establishing his catalog beside the great Hans Zimmer. Thank you to everyone involved in creating this Epic Case Study Film, definitely one for The Ages.

title: "Defying the Haters: A Glowing Review of Rebel Moon'
text: The hate for this movie puzzles me. Just because it's similar to Star Wars? Seems unfair to bash it for that. It's a stunning movie visually, and the story totally makes sense. Plus, the action scenes are top-notch and it's just plain enjoyable to watch. Let's give credit where it's due and enjoy the film for what it is-a fun ride with its own charm.Just to say, I certainly found enjoyment in that regard. Being a Zack Snyder fan might have influenced my perspective, but I also believe the cast was excellently chosen.I'm already looking forward to the third film. If it has even half as much action and stunning special effects, I'll be satisfied. In short, ignore the haters and enjoy the show!

title: Don't believe the bad reviews
text: This movie was fun! I liked the first one and this was a solid follow up. The world building was seen a little more clearly in this too. So if the main characters stick together I hope that in the next movie they get out more into space. I mean come on!!! Give me another movie from this year or last that checks off everything a sci-fi fan wants. All I see are people complaining about the same things. It is just people playing follow the leader. They are not taking in the material and judging it on what is there. Just a bunch of people saying the first one sucked, it did not, and following up with this one is worse, it is not. I would have enjoyed the two together initially even though that would have been a long movie. I won't give a spoiler but that one flashback seeing where the main character went "wrong" really set the next phase up well. I hope we get to see the real big bad in the next movie. I would watch several more of these. I think considering Snyder's history these are some of his best work since Watchmen.

title: You could enjoy it
text: The movie is absurdly bad. But only if you judge it by the standards of a movie.However, if we change the optics, we could enjoy it.It is very much like an ancient heroic epos. Strange and sometimes absurd dialogues like those in Odyssey by Homer. Strange motivations of the heroes like in Beowulf or The Song of Roland. I am sure if Homer could make a movie based on his Illiad, there would have been a lot of slow motion scenes.Of course, the script is super primitive, but it is like in operas or in ballets. Only a formality to help the author to demonstrate what he really wants to. In the case of Snyder, surely its visual component. And visually this movie is superb! Aesthetics is so cool!You must fast forward the most cringe moments, but overall it is an interesting experiment.

title: Brilliant! Best Sci-Fi movie I've seen in the last years.
text: When I saw the classification I thought "this people must be mad to only give that to this incredible movie,I have to register on IMDB and for the first time make a review to say people they must see it!!they can't pass by and not seeing it because of that unfair classification!"Great story,great characters played by great actors,great storyline,great sets,great special effects but this movie is so more about the storyline that just confusing lights and fights and effects as we see in the last action/fiction movies. This one managed to create its own rich universe and make us immerge and dream.

title: What's wrong with people?!
text: I absolutely loved both part 1 & 2, they were brilliant! I am very confused on the bad ratings, I am wondering if these are obsessed Star Wars fans that can't accept or appreciate some similar but different type of story that they have to cut this one down to saying it is awful?! Really?! These movies were so good, story original, action excellent and heartfelt. Was better than majority of the Disney made Star Wars, but maybe that's what all the hate is, not being able to appreciate it for what it is. I love Star Wars, but was able to enjoy these in a different way! Watch it and don't listen to all the hate!

title: Visually stunning and action-packed sci-fi epic
text: "Rebel Moon" (2024) is a visually stunning and action-packed sci-fi epic. Directed by Zack Snyder, the film immerses viewers in a richly crafted universe where a peaceful colony on the edge of the galaxy must defend itself against a tyrannical empire. The ensemble cast delivers strong performances, with standout roles by Sofia Boutella and Charlie Hunnam. The movie combines Snyder's signature style with a compelling narrative, offering thrilling battles and deep emotional arcs. With its breathtaking visuals and engaging story, "Rebel Moon" is a must-watch for sci-fi enthusiasts and Snyder fans alike.

title: Rebel Moon Pt 2 is Spectacular and I never give out 10s!
text: "Rebel Moon Pt 2" (4/19/24, Netflix, Dir: Zach Snyder) Wow, just wow. RM Pt1 was good, very good, but this Part 2 takes it to another level! Zach Snyder brought alot of the magic of "300" to make this a spectacular event. This is a "Star Wars" that Kathleen Kennedy and her minions could never make. This is a masterpiece of the genre - and I NEVER say that about anything. Sofia B. Makes a decent enough protag but Ed Skrein as Atticus Noble makes a deliciously evil villain, even more so in this outing. But let's go back to Zach for a moment. This film shows you the potential that can be realized when you let an A-list personality produce, write, direct, and do the cinematography for an action/adventure film. Few have tried, and most fail, but Zach scores big here. And the final five minutes set the stage for what the Part 3 story would be, so here's to hoping Netflix does the Right Thing by Greenlighting it!

title: Rebel Moon part 2: The Scargiver is a breathtaking work of art
text: Congratulations to Mr. Snyder and Netflix. I'll admit that even though i enjoyed part 1, I did think it was a bit rushed and I looked forward to the r rated version but with Rebel Moon part 2: The Scargiver that was not the case at all. This film delivered on all aspects. Reveling the characters past allows u to connect emotionally to each one in a way the first lacked. Zack has said he wrote these as a single film and i wish they would have released it as one film. With saying that, even as 2 films The Scargiver stands alone perfectly. The build up to the climax brings u in close and allows you to work and become a part of the village. The actors in this film prove that they are not just bodies for the action sequences but people who could be your neighbors on a distant planet. Zacks use of slow motion not only makes for the best action scenes you have ever seen but also allows you to see the beauty of everyday life in the village. The climaxs tempo has your heart pounding and keeps you on the edge of your seat wondering what is going to happen next. Ive never been so into a battle sequence, probably because in other films u already know or have a good idea of the outcome. The ups and downs and ups and downs of this section of the film had me worried for the characters at every moment. The final fight was one of the best I've ever seen in a film. Perfectly choreographed with camera angles that make u feel like you're right there with the characters. Even though it is a fight sequence, every frame is visually magnificent. Something I love about Snyders work is that at any moment u can pause the film and the visual aspect is so gorgeous that you could print it to canvas and hang it on your wall and Rebel Moon part 2: The Scargiver doubles down on this with breath taking visuals for the entirety of the film. I still look forward to the r rated versions but I have no idea what they can add to Rebel Moon part 2: The Scargiver to make it any better. Two thumbs way up for Zack Snyder and Netflix! I look forward to more films from this universe!

title: Part one was good, even though people are down rating it I don't know why...but part two is awesome!
text: Reading the reviews I thought the movie would be one of the worst I've ever watched. Even so, I watched this movie and it can not be the movie of the year, but it is very far from being a bad movie. I urge you to watch and evaluate by yourself, because in my opinion, people are being an little unfair to this movie, it simple doesn't make sense people criticizing that much. This part two is much better than the first one, the visual effects, the actors, sounds...they're pretty awesome. I really don't know why the movie is being down voted like that. Perhaps some people don't like Zack Snyder style or there is something going on this movie that I'm not aware of, but I think the movie worths watching.

title: Stunning!
text: I just can't get it, why we live in such a society full of resentment and dullness. Why it feels like every second person has to take out their everyday frustrations on great movies or series. My God, of course not every movie can be a new Godfather, a new Star Wars or something similar. But we all watch movies and series to turn our backs on everyday life for a while. To be entertained. And Rebel Moon has achieved that in absolutely every way. Great pictures, great actors, the plot has prepared us for follow-up films (if they are made because so many have to give their subjective opinion for the measure of all things), so: for us an insanely great movie!

title: Why the hate??
text: I thought part one was a bit slow not great but not terrible. Part 2 makes up for this and helps to make the story more compelling.I thoroughly enjoyed it and then I was a bit sad to find out that there won't be any more sequels, Because this movie got me into it properly. 6 movies that were intended and I suppose I will never know the full story now.But I love the effects and aesthetics! The sound is fantastic. The performances were spot on and this movie has a lot of heart!At the time of writing this it stands at 5.2 on IMDB.This rating is not accurate at all in my opinion I just feel like people are dumping on it.For me it's an 8 and part 1 was a 6.5.

title: IT'S CINEMA
text: Another great installment of this new Zack Snyder saga, really on par with its predecessor. These are the kind of Zack Snyder movies we've been waiting to see.I have loved this story since the First Part, its Protagonist and Villain are excellent and this rematch was more than expected, it really fascinates me how this actress fit perfectly into her role and shines in spades, before she had participated in one or another failure like The Mummy with Tom Cruise, but now this actress is on the rise and is the best.The plot is very good, original and, I must be honest, I have not seen something so well done in this genre since 2005 when George Lucas' "The Revenge Of The Sids" was released.It is wonderful and amazingly watchable, and by the end you can see that it is only the beginning of a great saga, this time, by Snyder, which when it hits the nail on the head is incredible.A special section deserves the Soundtrack, which is spectacular and accompanies the film masterfully.100% recommended if you like films of this genre and even more so if you follow Zack Snyder's style.

title: Loved The Second Installment In Franchise Can't Wait For 3rd Part
text: Rebel Moon Part 2 The Scargiver was Fantastic and hands down to Zack Snyder . Not only is it better than the first one but the action and emotional connections are felt way stronger in the second installment. From beginning to end you are on a rollercoaster ride,Zack Snyder you never cease to amaze us with your incredible diverse casting, unique point of view and how you keep defying Hollywood. I highly recommend and I definitely want more of this franchise, Can't wait for the 3rd part.Please note:- Kindly Judge this movie by your own brain don't depend upon any article I'm sure you'll love Rebel Moon Part 2 The Scargiver More When compared to first one.

title: What's wrong with those people
text: When I read the bad reviews, I couldn't believe it. I said to myself: this is Snider, it can't be as bad as they say... Well, I was right, the bad reviews are unfounded, and I seriously wonder what's wrong with these people who have left so many bad reviews. This film is a phenomenal visual spectacle! Everything about it is perfect. Every scene is a work of art. You can feel everyone's hard work and talent. At every moment, I was exclaiming WOW! And WOW! And more WOW! The costumes, sets, atmospheres, characters, etc. And the breathtaking shots... everything is perfect. The first part left me a little perplexed, as I wasn't expecting such a scenario, but the second part clarified a lot of things, and we can then grasp the whole work. I very much hope there will be a sequel soon.

title: Title: A Stellar Epic with a Nostalgic Twist
text: Netflix's "Rebel Moon" is a breathtaking space opera that masterfully blends grand-scale sci-fi with the classic appeal of a timeless Western. Zack Snyder has crafted a visually stunning universe, brimming with rich lore and unforgettable characters. This film is a must-watch for fans of both science fiction and epic adventures.One of the standout features of "Rebel Moon" is its striking resemblance to "The Magnificent Seven." Much like the beloved Western, "Rebel Moon" revolves around a band of diverse heroes coming together to defend a peaceful community against overwhelming odds. The film's core narrative-outsiders uniting to protect the vulnerable-echoes the themes of camaraderie, sacrifice, and justice that made "The Magnificent Seven" a classic.The ensemble cast delivers outstanding performances, each character bringing unique strengths and captivating backstories to the forefront. Their dynamic interactions and shared mission create an emotional resonance that elevates the film beyond mere spectacle. Fans of "The Magnificent Seven" will appreciate the homage paid to the original, while enjoying the fresh and imaginative setting of a distant galaxy."Rebel Moon" also excels in its world-building, with stunning visual effects and intricate set designs that immerse viewers in a richly detailed cosmos. Snyder's direction ensures that the action sequences are both thrilling and beautifully choreographed, making every battle scene a visual feast.In conclusion, "Rebel Moon" is a triumphant addition to Netflix's catalog, offering a perfect blend of nostalgia and innovation. It stands as a worthy successor to "The Magnificent Seven," reimagined for a new generation in a faraway universe. Whether you're a sci-fi enthusiast or a fan of classic Westerns, "Rebel Moon" is a cinematic experience that shouldn't be missed.

title: Not an action movie- but a story of redemption
text: Let's get the hard part out of the way. I liked it!It's not Shogun, but then it shouldn't be. Or should it have been several long episodes? Who knows? Now it stands alone. The characters are interesting, and I think an episodic series would let us know more about their wounds.As is, there is a bucolic but endearing long harvest scene. The land is the star: the land anchors this disparate set of orphans in a single set piece, a goal of choice. Isn't that Freedom?The cinematography is really gorgeous, especially on the practicals. The village, over watched by Jimmy, is a beacon that draws friend and foe. To the imperium, it represents dissent. To the fighters, it represent all they've lost in other places. The sense of place is very strong. The even show highlights each protagonist in a wonderful pre-industrial way, while the antagonists are intent on delivering hellish destruction with atomics and weapons that destroy with magma.Kora is a lightly drawn character, and Sofia draws her out in deft touches and intensity. Admiral Noble isn't, and the character is over the top, maybe the only mismatch on the film's delivery. General Titus has the same nobility that Djimon Hounsou always carries. He sings a haunting song after dinner in another language, making it all the more longing. The young girl steals everyone's heart with her hopeful naivety. And it works.I'll leave the rest of the story to your watching. It drew me in, I think because I listened as intently as I watched. The movie deserves a nuanced watch, looking for connections and unspoken communications.There's enough criticism to go around. I watched it for the storytelling, and I got it. I hope you do too.PS- embrace the Buck Rogers/Flash Gordon appearances. They're almost quaint, like steam punk!

title: 8/10, 10 to boost from the ridiculously low current 5
text: I greatly enjoyed this sequel, as did my mother. We watched it right after the first one. I'm very happy they made a sequel, as it would've been far too rushed as a single film. I still feel this would make an amazing tv series, video game, or anime, as it would give more time to flesh out the characters. I would adore a book, too. As is, I really truly enjoyed it, especially the Samurai Seven parallels. I highly recommend giving it a shot, and like someone else said in a review, if you aren't the Simpsons comic book guy, you'll enjoy this. Many seem to think that simply because it occurs in space, it's a ripoff of a certain popular movies series, and I find that take extremely ignorant. Watch the movie, decide for yourself.

title: I think people are mean just because its a cool thing to do.
text: I watched rebel moon part 1. Although i had no idea where this came from or what was going on in the first 30 mins...i caught on. Part 1 was entertaining enough for me to want to see part 2 and im glad i did. Part 2 was all the way up on action and it brought the story full circle. I got the plot and understood where it was going. It was a great popcorn action movie and for once i think people should shut up and let their minds go just to enjoy some fun entertainment. I only dislike one zack synder movie in my life. Thats saying a lot. I like his work and his movies are great to me. Fun time..

title: Best movie I have watch in a long time.
text: Dear Sir/Madame,I always say "everyone their own thing".As a 36 years old college student I have utmost enjoyed this movie. I found the movie fun, beautiful and very cool. The amount of coolness and such nice things I have never seen in other movies before makes me very come to life.I watch around an average of 2 movies a day. And I have seen like so many movies in my life already..I think people are just jaleous and just don't have taste. Imo this is one of the best movies I watch in my life.Zack if you are reading this: thank you so much. Much love from a guy from the Netherlands.I must keep it short. And it's maybe not really detailed. I will update it soon. At the moment I'm very flabbergasted by this movie. I will think about what I will write her in depth and come back with a good review.Thanks.

title: So much fun
text: Zack Snyder follows up his Rebel Moon with a soaring part two that outdoes the first in high and handsome style. This is a heartfelt, rousing space opera that isn't so much heavy on grand ideas as it is grand spectacle, with an almost space western by way of Roman epic through-line as several disparate characters from many corners of the universe do battle with a vicious fascist regime, resplendent with the spatially satisfying slow motion choreography that Snyder adores indulging in (its kinda like Paul Greengrass and his relentless shaky cam; it's either your thing, or it vehemently ain't), stirring emotional musical score from Tom Holkenborg and fun, spirited performances from a game cast of welcome faces like Djimon Hounsou, Cary Elwes, Doona Bae, Ed Skrein, the soulful vocal pipes of Anthony Hopkins, Michiel Huisman, Staz Nair and our angularly lithe main character, Sofia Boutella. Now, the elephant in the room. Snyder is a terrific artist who has never made a bad film, and it's time for all the Mountain Dew chugging basement dwellers to just accept it... and move on. This is a fun, visually dazzling piece of pulp science fiction with nothing too much on its mind other than a Magnificent Seven In The Stars type storyline, here to entertain us and nothing more. In that respect it does a damn fine job, presenting us a world teeming with world building detail, cathartic incident and musical swells accenting it all royally. It's good fun, so man up and deal with it.

title: Watch knowing it got greenlit, to sell two versions.
text: This film was funded because two cuts of the film were asked by Netflix. I kinda feel it's up to everyone if they wanna watch both versions of the directors cut, versus the shorter PG cuts. For me it's like getting 4 films for the price of one. Sure it's sly business strategy, but it's what got the film greenlit. And I don't see certain films seeing the light of the day without these financing choices these days. I enjoyed part 1 and 2, but I know I will review the directors cuts differently. For a streaming film, this is of cinematic quality, watch it on a big screen or home projector. Part 1 and 2 work well binged.

title: Best!!!!
text: It was a very good movie!! Loved every minute of it? There was a front, a middle and an end, drama and struggle!! Yes!!! Both parts were very understandable and very good. Keep it up. Waiting for the next part!! I hope the next part comes soon because this universe can be continued a lot! I also really liked the Star Wars references, the drama at the end was also very sad. I felt sorry for the girl. Chi is very cool. Every part of the film was very beautiful, the distant red planet... incredibly beautiful! Thank you for every minute.this is the best series. I hope there will be more like this!!

title: Awesome! Just watch it!
text: A lot of people compare Rebel Moon to Star Wars which is understandable since it was written to fit in to that universe but I'm glad it didn't get picked up by Lucasfilm/Disney. I've seen all the Star Wars movies and they have become less interesting and more desparate as time goes on (Force Awakens brings back Luke, Han, and Leia come on).Rebel Moon is a refreshing sci-fi action movie. The effects of the guns, explosions, and energy swords are amazing and highly entertaining. The contrast of the simplicity and smallness of the settlement of Veldt to the shear magnitude and bruteness of the Motherworld is captivating. The choreography is fluid, doesn't seem like a bunch of random fighting scenes like a lot of other movies in this genre.Oh the reviewers that think this is all about WHEAT are missing the big picture. This is about power, and the dynamics of how fragile that power can be. If people stop submitting to power and put up a resistance things can change. In this film the Motherworld needs the resources from Veldt and all the other planets they dominate in order to function.

title: It is not a 10 but had to elevate ratings read on...
text: I do not post a lot of reviews but I don't understand the haters. What's with all the hate and bad reviews? Ok agreed it is not the best but come on we seen worse! If you cannot sit down and watch a movie where you live the movie for the little time of 2 hours generally, then why in earth are you watching movies??? It had background stories, action feelings, revenge, love and everything what you would expect in a world where YOU would have to fight for what's prescious to you like your life, your family and everything you ever cared for! If this aspect of movie watching is lost then what do you want to see? Movies are here to take us from our mundane world to somewhere where everything is possible.....

title: Loved every second of it
text: I don't get the hate. I loved every bit of it. I love movies from Kieszlowski, to Medem, I love the classics and the new. This is a new form of movies, one that I very much appreciate. I found it was very artistic, I loved the slow motions, I cried and I laughed such as when in the classics, actors portrayed every nuance of an emotion through their faces and scripts were intricately woven. These are different times and I am glad there is a range. Don't be fooled by all the haters, lean back and enjoy, and if you are into this you will have a great time. Does the acting feel forced or stiff at times? Sure, but watch any of the eastern classics, it's not that actors in this movie don't know how to act, they do, it is an artistic choice by a brilliant director.

title: It's a good movie, better than the first one.
text: As a Synder fan, I wasn't satisfied with Rebel Moon Part 1. However, this sequel has more than made up for its predecessor's shortcomings, and I enjoyed it immensely. Instead of two separate films, Zack should have made a 3+ hours-long movie.Despite the predictable story, it still manages to captivate me. The characters' backstories are well-developed, giving them a strong motivation to fight for Veldt. However, the robot "James" lacks any meaningful arc explaining his peculiar attire. Nonetheless, his presence as a spectator over the village reminded me of Ephialtes from 300 and as a superhero during the battle.Zack's slow-motion effects may be slightly overused and the cinematography is decent in comparison to his other works.In my opinion, if Lucasfilm had allowed Zack to make these films under the Star Wars franchise, they would have been better spin-offs. There would have been no need to waste time creating worlds and cultures for this story to be made as films.Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and would recommend it without hesitation. I'm eagerly anticipating seeing it become a franchise.Ratings for this movie seems unfair.

title: I don't understand why most review here give bad scores
text: The first movie I know it feels doesn't have a soul and star wars wanna be.But this 2nd part is really good. The story gets deeper and makes more sense.I just watched dune and watched this one after, its still good.Most people compared it if it's the same genre and the release time is not far from each other, but seriously this movie is still good.When I watched this I don't the remember the first part, after a few minutes start to remember the stories. After the movie done, the credit said Zack. No wonder it's so good.I don't understand why most review here give bad scores. I can't wait for 3rd part or the finale.

title: Not sure why all the hate.
text: These movies were pitched as a Star Wars movie. That is why they have that feel. But when they passed Snyder reworked it to what it is now. Is the story great? No. But what I lacks in that department it makes up in the look of it, the sound, the special effects, the coolness of it all. Most of the actors are good and game for the fun,Sofia Boutella is a really good heroine, and it has a fantastic villian. And best if all, for the Snyder fans, it has great action and lots of slo-mo. Is this movie gonna win awards? No. But it is very entertaining. I can't wait to seen the Snyder cuts of both movies. I'm sure it will be even better.

title: Enjoyable and movie: Likes and Dislikes
text: I found a bit funny knowing people who rated part one below 5, still watched part two and rated low. I have never in my life watched movie part two after rating 1st part below 5. For me, movie below 5 is a total garbage not worth even wasting time for it.In general they focused movie on emotions and I found few scenes very interesting. Especially still remember my favourite scene.I would definitely would watch part 3 and I have big hopes for good improvements for part 3 because they won't waste again time on showing characters by developing their history and showing it.I think was mistake to waste soo much time just to introduce characters. That's why disliked the mostly part one.Slow motion scenes really didn't bothered me, it was totally fine with a movie style. Also, movie a bit too much predictable. For example to watch Breaking Bad, The Game of Thrones was soo enjoyable because well made and very hard to predict scenes and what will happen next.

title: Ready for part 3!!
text: I enjoyed both movies. I rarely review movies, but there is no need for this one to get the heat and the low ratings on here. Some people say that it lacked story but honestly, I watched nine Star Wars films and exactly how much story and plot is in all of that and look at the fame that the Star Wars franchise has! People know why they watch the movies that they like for the reasons they like them That is enough said. This would have been a great addition to the Star Wars franchise over that Ray skywalker bull crap that was the last three stupid Star Wars films. This had action, great effects, battle scenes, and enough plot just to keep it going. I want to see Part 3 and more be made because you know that they will make it. And you know that people will be watching this movies For years to come, especially the ones that are talking crap about it now they will enjoy it and watch it 10 years from now as I'm sure it will be a part of our pop culture like Star Wars and Star Trek and everything else....

title: Shocked by reviews
text: One of the most action packed and visually stimulating movies I've seen in a long time. Further the acting is so amazing. Fight scenes were spectacular!! My heart rate was up and up with each punch. Sure there's a lot of similarities with other famous sci-fi plots but it's 2023, what doesn't? This was entertaining, so enjoy it despite the ridiculously critical reviews that fail to acknowledge this was in fact a well executed action sci-fi movie, better than the first.Also why does a review need so many characters? Feels a little silly to have to do this, to get it to pass the 600 minimum. But here we are 🙃

title: Don't understand all the hate. Great movie.
text: I really don't understand all the hate. It was a great movie. Great part 2. I hope that they continue making more of them. There is no way this is a 2 to 5 star movie. No chance in hell. Why all the hate is because people just hate Snyder in general. Based on the reviews I thought this movie was going to be horrible. It was not. It was a fantastic. And I would most definitely watch multiple times. The story actually explained itself and gave the characters depth. You understood everything and the whole thing came together as we wanted it to. Don't read the reviews. The movies fantastic. I would say honestly it's better than the sequels in Star Wars. It has GOT vibes. Give this movie a shot. The Scargiver is a must watch.

title: Not finished yet...
text: Regardless what critics and Star Wars nerds say, Rebel Moon is a fantastic story. It has great characters, great action, stunning visuals, and just about everything a syfy action movie needs.Thing is though, these movies aren't complete. Zack Snyder was given the freedom to make PG-13 cuts (per Netflix's request) and his R-rated director cuts at the same time. There is still 2 hours of story yet to be seen, and Snyder has said himself, the tone, order, and takes will be different in the Snydercuts.When they drop this summer, you will finally get to see the story as Snyder intended. Most people that are complaining just talk trash but have no logic for backing it up.If the PG-13 versions feel like they're missing something, that's because they are. And all will be told and fulfilled this summer.All critics and reviewers, myself included, give their opinion on the movie, but IT DOESN'T MAKE THEM RIGHT. It's all a matter of opinion, and to me, the critics and the Star Wars funboy's opinions do not matter.

title: Beginning of an epic fantasy....
text: Parts one and two of rebel moon have much the similar, and beautiful, aspects as movies such as Star Wars, the Riddick movies, and more. While yes you can say some aspects are/have been done, that does not make them any less enjoyable to watch. Remember that if you look back all stories are just the retelling of those before. It's the way it is portrayed that is what shines through. These movies have had beautiful overarching narratives of family, faith, unity, and overcoming our pasts and failures that touches to the heart if who we are. I truly hope that this is a series that continues to grow and we are able to join in for an epic journey of growth of both person and cause. Excited to see what comes next!

title: Exciting
text: Great characters, attention to detail. Iconic World War I World War II meet Star Wars. Great acting. Zack you hit all the spots and the CGI was amazing. I can't imagine any sci-fi buff or action adventure buff not enjoying number one but very much number two. Cannot wait for number three. This is a whole believable world that makes sense. Characters die and characters live on as it should be in a Trilogy or Anthology whichever it may end up being. Please make the third one at least. We need it. We need Cora she is amazing and I will be a fan of hers the rest of her career. Anybody who did not enjoy this needs to watch it again.

title: Is a good movie
text: The movie was good, the action, and the art, everything was good to me. In fact I thought is was better then the first part. Looking to see more. The acting was real good, I don't see why people are giving it such bad reviews. Sophia is bad ass in this movie, she really kicks ass. And Ed of course is a great actor and did his job didn't skip a beat. Hope to see more of him. For having such bad reviews, it sure is the number one movie right now on Netflix. The movie is fun to watch, and very different. Action from start to finish. And did not know the robot was HANNIBAL LOL !! But over all is a nice action family movie.

title: Rare
text: As the viewer watched this film, it reminded them of the courageous partisan struggle of World War II against the Nazi-fascist evil. The villains appear to be Nazis even from the way they dress and behave, especially the leader. On the contrary, the good ones are reminiscent of the partisans even in their humble clothing typical of those poor times. And exactly as then, they had no other choice but to fight against an implacable and unstoppable enemy who wanted to enslave them by denying them EVERYTHING.What really struck me about this film is the acting of the actors, which is really well done and realistic, a rare thing to see in movies nowadays. Then also the plot, action, fights and special effects were good.

title: "Rebel Moon 2" elevates the bar for action-packed space operas...
text: "Rebel Moon 2" elevates the bar for action-packed space operas, delivering a sequel that not only surpasses its predecessor in terms of sheer adrenaline but also pays homage to the classics that have shaped the genre. Zack Snyder's signature style is unmistakable, with each frame brimming with his unique blend of grandiose spectacle and intimate character moments.Fans of "Star Wars" and "300" will find plenty to appreciate here, as Snyder deftly weaves familiar motifs and aesthetics from these iconic films into the fabric of "Rebel Moon 2." The result is a thrilling ride that feels both fresh and nostalgically reverent.As the credits roll, the anticipation for a third installment is palpable. With the groundwork laid for an even more expansive universe, the saga of "Rebel Moon" is poised to become a new cornerstone of sci-fi cinema. Here's to hoping that part 3, when announced, will take us to even greater heights.

title: Four Stars for the CGI
text: I wasted two pints of Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream for this (okay, not really wasted :). First, where did all that grand food come from? Not those poor hungry farmers. Excellent, sex within the first twelve minutes of the movie. And is this a future version of Magnificent Seven? Yep. With hints of Gladiator, again. Yep. Everyone is having a grand time before they get annihilated in five days. But the way the script goes, it's five months. Just so much stupid, inconsistent stuff. Lousy script... Again. Acting was okay. CGI was fantastic, as with all Sci-Fi movies with a decent budget. This will not get an Academy Award nomination for best costumes, maybe a Razzie."Oh, look, damn... They showed up"... We've seen this script at least a thousand times. Nothing new, nothing exciting, nothing exceptional. Just below average crap.Thank you for your time.
